loans.name: Jackelin Lizeth

texts.es: Jackeline tiene una pequeña hija a quién quiere darle un buen futuro, es por eso que cada día se esfuerza por sus estudios, está en el último año de su carrera de Contabilidad, y el crédito solicitado será para pagar el curso de titulación. Quiere cumplir todas sus metas, y una de ellas es de llegar a convertirse en una profesional y poder ejercer su carrera y poder triunfar en la vida. Le gusta mucho lo que estudia
texts.en:
Jackelin has a little girl and wants to give her a good future. That's why every day she works hard at her studies. This is her last year in an accounting program, and the requested loan will be used to pay for her qualifications course. 

She wants to reach all of her goals, and one of them is to become a professional, to be able to work in her field, and succeed in life. She enjoys what she studies very much.

loans.use: to pay end of degree course costs.

loans.name: Union Pesquera Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Union Pesquera esta ubicado en una zona cañera a la orilla de una hermosa  laguna  la cual es la principal fuente de trabajo de la comunidad ya que la mayoria de su gente se dedica a la pesca, este grupo esta integrado por 5 personas muy luchadora y trabajadoras cada una de ellas tiene una actividad economica:
Crstobal brinda el servicio de carpinteria, Yuliana y Eusebia venta de mojarra Lucia ciber cafe e ines venta de pollo.

Lucia tiene la edad tiene la edad de 33 años estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Adolfo el cual trabaja como campesino, ellos tienen dos hijos. Lucia platica que hace un poco mas de 6 años con el apoyo de su esposo abrio un ciber cafe con la intencion de ganar un poco de dinero y apoyar a su espposo en el gasto ya que cada dia la situacion economica esta mas dificil, su negocio esta ubicado a un costado de su casa en un pequeño local que ha construido, ella brinda el servicio de renta de computadoras e impresiones, con el paso del tiempo su neocio ha crecido y inicio a vender cds y memorias usb aumentar sus ganancias.

ella invertira este credito en  la compra de tintas, hojas blancas, cds, usb y dar mantenimiento a equipo de computo para continuar brindando el servio del internet.

ella ests muy contenta ya que no tiene mucha competencia y las ganancias son buenas, ella desea con el tiempoo segur ampliando su negocio e invertir en la compra de mas equipos de computo.


El Grupo Union pesquera agradece a la fundacion la confiansa que les dio al otorgarles este prestamo.
texts.en:
The “Unión Pesquera” group is located in a sugarcane producing zone on the shores of a beautiful lagoon that’s the main source of employment for the community since most of the residents fish.  This group is composed of five very hardworking, tenacious people each with their own economic activity:  Cristobal provides carpentry services, Yuliana and Eusebia sell ‘mojarra’ [type of  bream], Lucía has an Internet café and Ines sells chicken.

Lucía, 33, attended high school and is married to Adolfo who works as a farmer; they have two children.  Lucía relates that a little over six years ago with help from her husband she opened an Internet café aiming at earning a bit of money to help her husband with daily expenses since every day the economic situation was becoming more difficult.  Her business is located next door to her house in a small locale she built.  She rents computers and makes copies.  In time her business has grown and she started to sell CDs and USB memory sticks to increase her profits.  She will use the loan to buy ink, sheets of paper, CDs and USBs and to service the equipment to continue providing Internet access service.  She is very happy because she does not have much competition and profits are good.  She wants in time to continue expanding the business and purchase more computer systems.

The Unión Pesquera group thanks the Fundación for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy ink, sheets of paper, CDs, USBs and to service the equipment.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité ESPERANZA  es del Chaco, están en el primer ciclo, y las miembros nos dicen que desean trabajar juntas para poder ayudar a sus familias, quieren darles un mejor futuro y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades
La  Sra Agustina se dedica a la venta de mercería, donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser de bazar, ropas, perfumes calzados y demás. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene una buena variedad y por ello atrae a los clientes. 
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su local con calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar y demás, para que de esa forma pueda seguir atrayendo a más clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named "Esperanza" (Hope) is from Chaco and starting its first loan cycle. The members say they are working together so that they can help their families. They want to provide their families with a better future and see that they go through life with all of their needs met.

Sra. Agustina has a shop where she sells all types of merchandise (otherwise known as a bazaar). She offers clothing, perfumes, shoes, and other products. Agustina says that she has very good customers because she always maintains a good variety, which helps to attract business. The loan she is requesting will be used to restock her shop with shoes, garments, bazaar products, and other items. This will help her continue attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes, garments, bazaar products, and other items.

loans.name: Agua De La Caña Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Agua de la caña esta conformado por  trece mujeres humildes, alegres y trabajadoras con deseos de mejorar su vida y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de un pueblo llama Agua de la  caña antes de llegar a agua de la caña  esta un rió que pertenece a  pinotepa se llama rió de la arena esta mas cerca de la comunidad de agua de la caña que  de pinotepa.
El pueblo de agua de la caña es muy pequeño  pero  es muy lindo ya que hay muchos árboles  verdes, mucho agua, árboles muy grandes  a los que ellos le llaman parotas, es muy fresco  hay muchos animales como marranos, perros y chivitos.
Una de las tradiciones de agua de la caña son: las mayordomías y la fiesta del pueblo que se celebran cada  tres de mayo.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Porfirio una señora amable y alegre de cuarenta y nueve años de edad.
Doña Porfiria se dedica a la venta de perfumes desde hace  cinco años  ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  salir a vender de casa en casa  y platicar con sus clientas para que entre platica i platica le compren sus perfumes.
Lo que no le gusta de su negocio es  que algunas de sus clientas se atrasan en pagarle y eso hace sentir triste por que no puede adquirir sus ganancias.
Uno de los restos de doña Porfirio es que  en ocasiones no tiene dinero para  invertir  y comprar más mercancía  ya que en ocasiones rápido se le termina.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una perfumería  en su comunidad para que cuando sus clientas le vayan a comprar  se sientan a gusto  y puedan elegir sus perfumes.
Doña Porfirio es viuda  y tiene la cantidad de  cinco hijos quienes ya están casados se llaman  Daniel, Nayeli, Andrea, Yomara y Andrés.
Doña Porfirio pidió el préstamo para la compra de más perfumes para la venta por menudeo.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por las oportunidades que les ha dado para que sus vidas mejoren y así  puedan poder tener su propio negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Inocencia- quien se dedica  a la venta de calzado.
Alicia- se dedica a la venta de  pollos.
Yolanda- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Teresa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Andrea- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de catalogo.
Dolores- se dedica servicio de carpintería venta muebles.
Maribel- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Adriana- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Lizbeth- se dedica a  la venta de carne.
Adelfa- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Maria Elena- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las personas de no tiene recursos para iniciar un negocio y una mejor vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Agua de Caña” (Sugarcane Water) and it’s composed of three humble, cheerful, very hardworking women who want to improve their lives and give their children a better future.  The members of this group are from a town called Agua de Caña.  Just before arriving at Agua de Caña there is a river that belongs to Pinotepa called Río de Arena that’s closer to the community of Agua de Caña than it is to Pinotepa.  The town of Agua de Caña is very small but it’s quite beautiful because there are many green trees, much water and very large trees called “parotas;”  it’s very cool and there are many animals like pigs, dogs and little goats.  One of Agua de Caña’s traditions is the “Mayordomías” [series of religious festivities] and the town’s festival that take place each May 3rd.

One of the group members is Porfiria, a very kind and cheerful, 49-year-old woman.  Porfiria has been selling perfume for five years and she tells us that what she likes best about her business is going out to sell house to house and chatting with her customers because while she’s chatting away with one and another, they buy perfume.

What she doesn’t like about her business is that some of her customers take their time to pay her and this makes her sad because she can’t earn her profits.  One of her challenges is that sometimes she does not have money to invest in the purchase of more merchandise that she sometimes runs out of quickly.

One of her dreams is to have a perfume shop in her community so that when her customers come by to buy they will feel comfortable and will be able to choose their perfumes.

Porfiria is a widow and has five children who are married and are called: Daniel, Nayeli, Andrea, Yomara and Andrés.

Porfiria requested the loan to buy more perfumes to sell at retail.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunities it’s given to improve their lives and have their own businesses. 

The other group members are:

Inocencia- sells shoes
Alicia- sells chickens
Yolanda- sells traditional Mexican fast-food snacks
Teresa- sells traditional Mexican fast-food snacks
Andrea- sells fruit and vegetables
Margarita- catalogue sales
Dolores- carpentry and furniture sales
Maribel- clothes sales
Adriana- sells traditional Mexican fast-food snacks
Lizbeth- meat sales
Adelfa- grocery sales
Maria Elena- sells traditional Mexican fast-food snacks

They thank the Fundación for helping people who don’t have resources to start businesses and a better life.

loans.use: to buy perfume to resell.

loans.name: Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Jesús esta integrado por diez personas trabajadoras e indígenas con deseos de superarse y mejorar su  vida y engrandecer sus negocios y así poder darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Los integrantes  de este grupo son originarios de  pinotepa nacional Oaxaca tierra de progreso y superación.
Las tradiciones de pinotepa son las mayordomías y la fiesta quinto viernes mejor conocido como semana santa viene los juegos y muchos extranjeros a vender sus artesanías.
En la comunidad hay muchos pequeños negocios  reflejo de su trabajo y las personas de pinotepa visten de nagua y mandil.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Xochitl  Cristina de  treinta  siete años de edad una señora que se caracteriza por ser trabajadora y amable.
Doña Xochitl como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo y amigas se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes como es: galletas, refrescos, café, azucar, pan, frijoles, arroz, aceite y chiles.
Doña Xochitl nos dice que tiene su pequeño local donde vende sus mercancías y donde atiende con amabilidad y cariño a sus clientas ya que  siempre trata de tener su tienda surtida para que sus clientas encuentren lo que buscan.
Doña Xochitl nos dice que lo que  más le gusta de su negocio es tener su tienda llena de mercancía y atender bien a sus clientas.
Lo que no le gusta de su negocio es cuando tiene  suficiente dinero para invertirlo y comprar más mercancía, por  su tienda queda vacío.
Nos dice que esta muy contenta  por que gracias a dios  ha podido continuar con su negocio y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes para  la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por  darles siempre la  oportunidad de ser una mujer emprendedora con deseos e ilusiones.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Honoria- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Silvina- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Reyna Antolina- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Maria de Lourdes- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Bertoldina Estela- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Maria Gloria- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Eliézer- se dedica a la venta de teléfonos.
Ines Tomasa - se dedica a la venta de comida.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por darles la oportunidad de cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called Jesús.  It is comprised of ten hard-working indigenous people who have the desire to improve themselves, to improve their lives, and to expand their businesses.  This way they will be able to give their children a better future. 

The members of the group are from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, land of progress and growth.  The traditions of Pinotepa are the patron saints and the “Fiesta Quinto Viernes” better known as Holy Week.  The games come, and many foreigners come to sell their handicrafts.  There are many small businesses in the community, and they reflect their work.  The people in Pinotepa wear petticoats and mandils (a type of apron).

Cristina, age 37, is one of the members of this group.  She is known for being hard-working and kind. Xochitl, as she is better known by her communal bank colleagues and friends, sells groceries like cookies, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, beans, rice, oil, and chilies.  Xochitl tells us that she has a small place where she sells her merchandise and tends to her customers kindly and affectionately.  She always tries to have her store stocked so that her customers will find what they are looking for.

Xochitl tells us that what she likes the most about her business is having a store full of merchandise and waiting on her customers well.  What she does not like about her business is when she does not have enough money to buy more merchandise and her store is empty.

She tells us that she is very happy because, thanks to God, she has been able to continue her business, and, therefore, she has been able to improve her quality of life.  She asked for the loan to buy more groceries to sell.  She thanks the Fundación for always giving her the opportunity to be an enterprising woman with hopes and dreams.

The other members of the group are:

Guadalupe- sells typical Mexican snacks
Honoria- sells bread
Silvina- sells soft drinks
Reyna Antolina- sells soft drinks
Maria de Lourdes- sells clothes
Bertoldina Estela- sells groceries
Maria Gloria- sells typical Mexican snacks
Eliézer- sells telephones
Ines Tomasa – sells food

They give thanks to the Fundación for giving them the opportunity to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Ebenezer esta integrado por cinco personas humildes de un pequeño pueblo llamado "San  Juan Bautista lo de Soto" donde puedes admirar la naturaleza  ya que hay muchos árboles verdes y el clima es caluroso, es un pueblo donde se puede ver a los niños correr por las calles jugando con plena libertad y sin violencia.
Uno de los integrantes de este grupo es el señor Ignacio German  de cuarenta y nueva años de edad, se caracteriza por ser un señor trabajador y un poco callado.
Don Ignacio  como mejor lo conocen sus compañeras de grupo y sus paisanos  es dueño de un taxi lo trabajada todos los días de la semana menos cuando siembra maíz  ya  que traslada a  sus paisanos de su comunidad a la ciudad mas cercana que es Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.
También nos cuenta que se dedica a la siembra de maíz, lo que mas le gusta de la siembra de maíz es  que la mayoría de las temporadas tiene buena cosecha y eso lo hace sentir exitoso ya que puede  tener mas ganancias y mas maíz.
Debido a que Don Ignacio es diversificado en sus negocios, esta vez ha solicitado el préstamo para utilizarlo en su servicio de taxi, él va a comprar refacciones para su taxi, sin embargo éste préstamo impactará en los dos negocios ya que las ganancias que tenga del taxi las utilizará en la siembra de maiz.
Nos dice que esta muy agradecido con fundacion por abrirle las puertas a un nuevo rumbo que es  seguir con su negocio y mejorar su vida y su comunidad.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Julia- se dedica a la venta de  carne.
Leticia- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Gloria- se dedica a prestar servicio de alfarería.
Tomasa  Dominga  – se dedica a la venta de quesos.

Le da las gracias a fundacion por darle la oportunidad para que puedan seguir con sus negocios y así puedan mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Ebenezer” and it’s made up of five humble people from a small town called “San Juan Bautista Lo de Soto” where you can admire nature because there are many green trees; the weather is hot.  It’s a town where you can see children running in the streets playing completely free and with no violence.

One of the members of this group is Ignacio German, 49, who is noted for being a somewhat quiet, hardworking man.  Don Ignacio, as he’s better known by his fellow members and neighbors, owns a taxi that he works every day of the week except when he’s planting corn transporting his neighbors in the community to the nearest city which is Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.

He also tells us that he works farming corn.  What he likes best about farming corn is that most seasons he gets good harvests and this makes him feel successful because he can have more profits and more corn.

Because Don Ignacio is diversified in his businesses, this time he asked for the loan to use in his taxi service.  He will buy spare parts for the taxi.  However, the loan will have an impact on both businesses because he will use profits from his taxi to plant corn.

He tells us that he’s very grateful to the Fundación for having opened doors to a new path to continue with his business and improve his and his community’s life.

The other group members are:

Julia- sells meat
Leticia- sells food
Gloria- pottery
Tomasa Dominga – sells cheese

They thank the Fundación for giving them the opportunity to stay in business to thus improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

location.town: san juan bautista lo de soto,oaxaca

loans.name: Las Rebeldes Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Las Rebeldes esta formado por 12 mujeres alegres, amabres y trabajadoras, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad economica: Teresa venta de antojitos, Petra cria de cerdos, Irene venta de calzado, Guadalupe venta de antojitos, Olivia venta de carne, Maria Isabel reposteria, Araceli frutas y legumbres, Clara Maria reposteria, Teresa venta de ropa, Filomena venta de antojitos, Laura venta de antojitos, Maria Leonor joyeria.
Este grupo esta ubicado en una zona cañera y la mayoria de sus habitantes se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña.

Doña Petra tiene la edad de 38 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con don clemente con el cual tiene dos hijos, Ella platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar ya que desde muy chica sus padres le enseñaron a  trabajar para salir adelante, Doña Petra dice que hace mas de 19 años inicio a criar cerdos para su posterior venta con la intencion de ganar un poco de dinero extra y ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Ella compra los cerdos desde que son pequeños y los alimenta hasta que son adultos y estan listos para ser vendidos. A doña petra le gusta mucho su actividad ya que la realiza sin desatender a su famila y apesar de que es mucho el trabajo la ganancia es buena.

ella invertira este credito en la compra de cerdos, alimentos y vacunas para continuar realizando su actividad.

Ella desea que con esta inversion su negocio continue progresando ya que le gustaria dar a su familia mejor calidad de vida e invertir un poco en remodelar su hogar.

Este grupo agradece a la fundación por el préstamo que se les ha otorgado.
texts.en:
The group "Las Rebeldes" is made up of 12 happy, kind, and hardworking women. Each one of them has a job: Teresa sells snacks, Petra raises pigs, Irene sells shoes, Guadalupe sells snacks, Olivia sells meat, Maria Isabel has a confectionery, Araceli sells fruits and vegetables, Clara Maria has a confectionery, Teresa sells clothing, Filomena sells snacks, Laura sells snacks, and Maria Leonor sells jewelry.

This group is located in a sugar-cane region and the majority of its inhabitants work sowing and cultivating sugar cane.

Petra is 38 years old. She only studied through high school and she is married to a man named Clemente with whom she has two children. She tells us that she has always liked to work since she was very small. Her parents taught her how to work to get ahead. Petra says that she started raising pigs more than 19 years ago in order to later sell them, with the intention of earning a little extra money and helping with household costs.

She buys pigs when they're little and feeds them until they're adults and ready to be sold. Petra really likes her work since she can do it without neglecting her family, and although it's a lot of work the earnings are good.

She will invest this loan in buying more pigs, feed, and vaccines to continue carrying out her work. With this investment, she desires that her business continue making progress because she would like to give her family a better quality of life and invest a little in remodeling her home. 

This group is grateful to the foundation for the loan which has been granted.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar tiene 23 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, nos comenta que se dedica a la peluquería, que tiene ubicada en su propia casa. Cuenta que se dedica a esto hace ya 3 años, lo que le ha ayudado a formarse una buena clientela que siempre acude hasta el. 
Estuvo ganando experiencia en la Argentina, luego de un tiempo por allá vino a abrir su local aquí y empezó a trabajar. El es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a su familia. 
Solicita ell crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, ruleros y demás insumos necesarios con los que podrá abastecerse y de esa forma seguir dando una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edgar, 23, is from the city of Curuguaty.  He tells us he works in a beauty salon he has in his own house.  He has done this work for three years, which has helped him develop a good clientele that always goes to him.

He was getting experience in Argentina.  After some time there he came to open his place here and he began to work.  He is a very hardworking and enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead to help his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his beauty salon such as dyes, creams, curlers, and other supplies necessary to stock his business and so continue giving his customers good service.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, curlers, and other supplies.

loans.name: El Santuario Group

texts.es:
Teresa cuenta con 42 años de edad tiene 11 hijos pero 6 ya son independiente casados con familias, solo 4 dependen de ella dos están estudiando Sergio estudia la preparatoria y Joel esta en tercero de secundaria, teresa esta casada su esposo se llama fausto que se dedica al campo. 

Ella se dedica al comercio con la venta de verduras y carne lo cual dice que le va bien con el negocio ya tiene 4 años con el negocio y dice que su negocio ha ido incrementando poco a poco espera que le vaya muy bien, invertirá su préstamo en la compra de verduras como son: chile, jitomate, cebolla, lechuga, etc. Y también comprara carne para la venta espera que le negocio incremente mas y así darle una mejor educación a sus hijos ya que le gustaría que se prepararan profesionalmente.

Teresa pertenece al grupo el santuario el cual esta integrado por 15 mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Yanet, Aloína, Natividad, Elvia, Maribel, Soila, Rufina, Alma Rosa, Nelsa, Elvia, Demetria, Rufina, Alberta, flora, todas cuentan con  una actividad comercial como son: venta de carne y legumbre, venta de pollos, carnicería, perfumería, ropa, frutas, pescado, pan, venta de plásticos, etc.
texts.en:
Teresa, 42, has 11 children but 6 of them are already on their own and married, only four still depend on her.  Two of them are attending school, Sergio in high school and Joel in 9th grade.  Teresa’s married.  Her husband’s name is Fausto and he works in the fields.

She’s a merchant.  She sells vegetables and meat.  She says she does well with the business since she’s been in business four years now and it’s been growing little by little.  She hopes to do well and will invest her loan in the purchase of vegetables like chilies, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, etc.  She will also buy meat to sell.  She hopes that business will grow more to provide a better education for her children because she’d like them to become professionals.

Teresa belongs to the “El Santuario” group which is composed of 15 women who are very hard working.  We mention them next:  Yanet, Aloína, Natividad, Elvia, Maribel, Soila, Rufina, Alma Rosa, Nelsa, Elvia, Demetria, Rufina, Alberta and Flora.  Each has her own commercial activity like: meat and vegetable sales, chicken sales, butcher shop, perfumes, clothes, fruit, fish, bread, plastics sales, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 22-year-old married woman with two children. She has a business selling firewood and porridge in Tetra Pak and has been in the business for three years. She gets a monthly income of 45,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This will be Margret's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more firewood. In future, she wants to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Rosa dalia cuenta con 38 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos los cuales solo estudian 3 Luis esta estudiando la preparatoria segundo grado, Elvis esta en tercero de secundaria y Sandra esta en segundo de secundaria, su esposo se llama Néstor es campesino se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende pollos lo cual dice que le va muy bien con el negocio ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de pollos para la cría ya tiene 9 años con el negocio espera que el préstamo le ayude ya que le gustaría darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y darles mejor educación sus hijos ya que le gustaría que su hija estudiara para doctora espera que todo salga bien ya que le gustaría que el negocio creciera mas ahora solo vende pollos pero le gustaría vende otra cosa aun no ha pensado que pero esta pensando en poner otro negocio y así ir creciendo el negocio.

Rosa dalia pertenece al grupo las marías el cual esta integrado por 10 mujeres trabajadoras las cuales están dispuestas a salir adelante día con día para darles un mejor estilo de vida  a sus familias a continuación serán mencionadas: Isabel, Elisandra, Indira, Paula, Alberta, Marisol, Carmela, Maelbis, Irma, todas cuentan con una actividad comercial como son: venta de artículos domésticos, venta de pollos, perfumes, productos de abarrotes, frutas, legumbres, comida, refrescos, accesorios para la elaboración de cubiertos, maíz,
texts.en:
Rosa Dalia, age 38, is married and has four children.  Three of them go to school.  Luis is in the second year of high school.  Elvis is in the third year of middle school, and Sandra is in the second year of middle school. Her husband is a farmer and devotes himself to the fields.

She sells chickens, and she says that her business is going very well for her.  She will use the loan to buy chickens to raise.  She has had the business for nine years, and she hopes the loan will help her.  She would like to give her family a better life style.  She would like her daughter to study to be a doctor, and she hopes it all goes well.  She would like the business to grow more.  She only sells chickens now, but she would like to sell another thing.  She has not yet planned it, but she is thinking of setting up another business.  This way her business will be growing.

Rosa Dalia belongs to the Las Marías communal bank.  It is comprised of ten hard-working women who are prepared to get ahead day to day in order to give their families a better lifestyle.  

The following are members of the group:  Isabel, Elisandra, Indira, Paula, Alberta, Marisol, Carmela, Maelbis, and Irma.  All of them have a business activity like selling domestic items, chickens, perfumes, groceries, fruits, vegetables, food, soft drinks, materials for making cutlery, and corn.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal San Jose está conforme  por diez emprendedoras que se unieron para formar este grupo, todas son de la misma comunidad en el cual a pesar que sus negocios son diferentes todas se apoyan y se brindan consejos para sus negocios. Maribel es parte de este grupo y su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación ya tiene años de experiencia y sabe los que sus clientes necesitan, está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos granos básicos, aceite, jabón, detergente entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The “San José” communal bank is composed of ten entrepreneurs who joined together to form this group.  They are all from the same community and although their individual businesses are different they all support each other and provide advice for their businesses.

Maribel is part of this group and the activity she does is a grocery store she has at home; she has years’ experience and knows what her customers need.  She’s asking for the loan to buy basic grains, oil, soap and detergent, among other products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Hortencia actualmente vende chicharrones y tamales los cuales los elabora en su domicilio para venderlos en el tianguis. su proyecto es poder vender quesadillas y desea comprar la plancha para los guisos y poder tener mas variedad en guisos y asi poder tener mas ingresos y clientes.
Ella no cuenta con todo el capital es por eso que acude con nosotros para que le apoyemos.
texts.en: María Hortencia currently sells fried pork rinds and tamales that she makes at home to then sell in the street market.  Her project is to be able to also sell "quesadillas" [grilled tortillas stuffed with cheese and other ingredients] and she wants to buy the griddle for these items and have more variety of food available to increase income and customers.  She does not have all the capital she needs and this is why she’s calling on us to support her.

loans.use: to buy a griddle.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is widowed and has five children, two of whom attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda. Mwajuma sells green bananas on a wholesale basis at the market, which she has been doing for six years. She works six days a week. 

Mwajuma is requesting for a loan for 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals are to start going to farmers for bananas and to buy a plot of land. Mwajuma lives in a rented house with access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: to purchase more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de Cocharcas, tiene 39 años de edad,ella vende cereales al por mayor, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 15 años, ella aprendió mucho a administrar su negocio, le gusta venir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque la capacitan para su negocio así como para el ámbito personal que en otras instituciones no lo hacen,el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales como quinua, habas y otros para su negocio donde provee a instituciones grandes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39, and a member of Bancomunal Virgen de Cocharcas communal bank. She sells staple foods at wholesale. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 15 years. She has learned a great deal from running her business.

She likes to go to Bancomunal meetings because they provide training in business, as well as in personal development; something that they don't do in other institutions. 

She will use the loan she is applying for to buy staples such as quinoa, lima beans and other products for her business, which supplies large institutions.

loans.use: To buy food staples such as quinoa, lima beans and other products for her business.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Josefa, tiene 54 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos adultos. Ella forma parte del grupo "El triunfo" formado por 7 socios trabajadores y responsables residentes del distrito de Carabayllo.
La Sra. Josefa se dedica desde hace 9 años a la atención de su bodega, inició con la venta de golosinas en una pequeña vitrina y poco a poco con su esfuerzo, apoyo de sus hijos ha ido incrementando los productos de su bodega, hoy en día tiene un negocio surtido que le permite tener una tranquilidad económica.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de diferentes marcas y tamaños de bebidas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefa, 54, has five adult children.  She’s part of the “El Triunfo” group which has 7 hardworking, responsible members residents of Carabayllo District.

Josefa has been tending to her grocery store for nine years.   She started out selling snacks from a small display case and gradually with her effort and support from her children she’s increase the products in her sore.  

Today, she has a well-stocked business that allows her to have economic peace of mind.  The loan she got will be used to buy beverages of various sizes and brands to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Epifania Reyna, tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Carbayllo. Ella forma parte del grupo "El Mirador" integrado por 6 socios, todos comerciantes; sus compañeros la eligieron como tesorera del grupo.
La Sra. Epifania Reyna se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza en su domicilio, con la intención de independizarse y tener su propio negocio empezó ella ofreciendo menu a sus vecinos, poco a poco ha ido aumentando su clientela y mejorando el ambiente donde atiende a sus clientes.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en comprar insumos al por mayor para poder obtener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Epifania Reyna, 59, lives in Carbayllo District.  She’s part of the “El Mirador” group which has six members, all merchants.  Her fellow members chose her to be group treasurer.

Epifania Reyna has been selling food for a year, an activity she carries out at home.  Aiming at becoming independent and having her own business, she started selling daily meals to her neighbors and gradually has increased her clientele and improved the environment where she tends to her customers.  She will use the granted loan to buy ingredients at wholesale to attain a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Proyectando Un Sueño Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Proyectando un Sueño”, está conformado por 25 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa usada, ropa nueva, abarrotes, artesanía en cuero y preparación de comida, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Padre de las Casas.
Jessica presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en la segunda fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Viste una polera manga corta, color rosado, su cabello lo usa corto, el cual es de color negro. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía, desde hace 10 años. Específicamente realiza tejidos con lana hilada de oveja. Entre sus producciones se encuentran los calcetines, gorros y chalecos. Comenta que aprendió el oficio a través de un curso que dictó la Municipalidad de la zona. Comenta que algunos días de la semana se instala en una feria artesanal y el resto de los días vende de manera más personalizada a los conocidos de su entorno más cercano.
Sus materiales, los compra directamente a personas que trabajan en la esquila de oveja en el campo.
Con el crédito comprará lana hilada de oveja.
Una de las metas para su negocio es surgir para instalarse con un local establecido.
Jessica vive junto a su marido y una de sus dos hijas, quien estudia. Uno de sus sueños es enseñar el oficio a gente esforzada que quiera emprender.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá  invertir en su negocio.
Comenta que su cargo como directiva del grupo del Banco comunal ha sido una experiencia enriquecedora para desarrollarse en el ámbito personal. Ya que también el grupo ha facilitado su gestión al ser unido y comprometido.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Proyectando un Sueño” (Designing a Dream) and it’s composed of 25 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work.  Among them are sales of used and new clothes, grocery sales, leather crafts, food preparation, among others.  They all are from the Padre de las Casas Commune.

Jessica is communal bank group president and in the photo is seated in the second row, third from right to left.  She’s wearing a short-sleeve pink shirt; her hair is short and its color is black.

She’s been doing crafts for ten years.  Specifically, she knits with sheep’s wool yarn.  Among her products are socks, caps and vests.  She comments that she learned the occupation from a course the local municipality taught.  She comments that some days of the week she sets herself up in a crafts fair and the rest of the days she sells in a more personalized way to acquaintances nearby.

She buys her materials directly from people who work shearing sheep in the countryside.  She will use the loan to buy sheep’s wool yarn.  One of her business goals is to get ahead so that she can open a stand-alone store.

Jessica lives with her husband and one of her two daughters who attends school.  One of her dreams is to teach the occupation to determined people who might want to venture into it.  She’s very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it will allow her to invest in her business.

She comments that her job as a communal bank group leader has been a very enriching experience for her personal development; her group has facilitated her tenure in office by being united and committed.

Padre Las Casas is a commune in south Chile near the city of Temuco in the Araucanía region.  It was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas who was a defender of Indian rights during the conquest of America.  This commune is noted for having a significant Mapuche population.  Its economy is based on agroindustry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy sheep's wool yarn.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman with three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She has been operating a hotel for the last six years and dreams of opening another hotel in the future. Other sources of income include her husband's earnings.

She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She says food is her greatest monthly expense. 

Chari joined Yehu in order to access loans. She plans to use her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to repair her hotel premises and purchase wheatflour and sugar.

loans.use: to repair her hotel premises, and purchase wheatflour and sugar.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, and her four children are in school. She also supports her sister and brother. The family lives in its own house, which has access to electricity and piped water. Prossy’s monthly expenses include school fees and food.

For the past seven years Prossy has run a beauty salon where she also sells beauty products. She works seven days a week. Seasonality and a sporadic electrical current are her major challenges.

Prossy has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of cosmetics, hair treatments and braids. Her ambition is to own a fully stocked salon and buy a plot of land upon which to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cosmetics, hair treatments and braids for her salon.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a forty-one-year-old married lady with three children.  She has a welding business and has been in the business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This will be Lucy's first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy two grinding machines. In the future, she wants to boost her business by adding more machines.

loans.use: buy two grinding machines

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette sells foodstuff such as beans and potatoes. She is single. She is 34 years old. She has been selling beans and potatoes for 14 years. With this loan, she will add more beans and potatoes to sell. She plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy beans and potatoes to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with two children.  He owns a cereals shop.  He has been in the business for six years now with good success. 

This will be James' second  loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to purchase a generator and build a grill door. With the anticipated profits, he plans to plough back to his business.

loans.use: buy a generator and build a grill door

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married.

Wissam has owned a shop selling spare parts for cars since 2002.  He has more than nine years of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Wissam is requesting a $2700 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: pay rent and add inventories

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a thirty-nine-year-old man who is single with one child.  He owns a restaurant business, which has been in operation for seven months now and gets a monthly income of forty five thousand shillings.

This will be Peter's first loan from KADET LTD.   He plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of food such as maize, wheat flour, beans, rice, etc. In the future, he wants to ensure his family acquires their basic needs.

loans.use: buy food stock for his restaurant

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has six children.

Ahmad has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Ahmad is requesting a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent, to make display cases and to add more foodstuff. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: pay rent, make display cases, and restock his store

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal sells different types of fabrics.  She is married to a tailor.  She is 27 years old.  She has spent 7 years selling fabrics. With this loan, she will add more fabrics to sell. She plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet's group is comprised of 4 hard working women. Janet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Janet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Janet to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house on it. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Janet's future prospects by helping her to learning how to save money.

loans.use: buy sugar and soap to resell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a thirty-five-year-old man who is married and has one child.  He operates a public address business and offers DJ services.  He has been in the business for nine years now.  

This will be Alex's third loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to purchase a Rane mixer. The profits will be used to plough back into his business.   In the future, he wants to open a school in Nairobi to teach upcoming DJs.

loans.use: to purchase a reen mixer

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 26 years old and married to Alex. They are blessed with one child.

Alice sells textiles such as blankets, sheets and nets to the residents of Kangundo. She has been in this business for the last five years and makes an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

Alice has a good credit history with KADET LTD and this is her second loan. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, with which she plans to buy more blankets, sheets and nets to sell. 

She will use the extra profit to save and to educate her children.

Alice hopes to have a business that can fully support the needs of her customers and fulfil her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and nets for sale.

loans.name: Corazon Unido Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON UNIDO” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora María. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción, venta de tucumanas, servicios y comercio.

La señora María, indica que hace años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeros. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de tucumanas que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de una actividad anterior.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de un coche de ventas, mismo que utilizará para el traslado de sus productos; posterior a la elaboración de sus productos lo comercializará de forma ambulante  en las diferentes plazas de la ciudad de El Alto. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Corazón Unido” (United Heart) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by María.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have production, sale of turnovers, services and commerce.

María indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer communal associations for years having been invited to join by her fellow members.  Currently she has a business that she’s had for years making and selling turnovers.  She learned this activity from a previous one.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy a food cart that she’ll use to transport her products.  Once she makes the products she will sell them in an ambulatory fashion in various squares in the city of El Alto.  This business helps her support her family since she has a spouse and four children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy a food cart.

loans.name: Chulumani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHULUMANI” iniciará su treintavo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de animales domésticos, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, venta de libros, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de gorros de bebe, venta de leche y queso, venta de zapatos, venta de gorritas.

La señora Ana,  indica que hace seis años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un taller de costura de chompas que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (compra de lanas), que servirá para la elaboración de las prendas. Ella nos cuenta que el negocio que realiza lo desarrolla todos los días y lo comercializa en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito y los controles médicos.
texts.en:
The “Chulumani” communal bank will start its 30th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board headed by Ana.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have: sale of domestic animals, neighborhood store, knitting sweaters, book sales, blanket sales, food sales, knitting baby caps, milk and cheese sales, shoe sales and sale of little caps.

Ana indicates that she’s been a member of a Pro Mujer communal association for six years having been invited to join by a fellow member.  She currently has a sewing workshop where she knits sweaters; she’s had it for years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy merchandise like wool yarn that she’ll use to make the items.  She tells us that she works at her business every day and sells in the city of El Alto’s street markets.  This business helps her support her family since she’s married and has three children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training, the loans and the health monitoring.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 34-year-old married man. He has three children aged from one to 12 years old. 

He describes himself to be an aggressive businessman. 

Samuel runs a butcher's shop and has been involved in this business for 12 years, employing one staff member. 

The business is located within a fast-growing shopping centre, and the primary customers are local residents. 

Samuel's biggest business challenge is having insufficient funds for improving his business. He would like a 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more meat to sell. He hopes to purchase cows and have his own slaughterhouse in the future.

Beyond that, his goal is to move into the big hotel business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is thirty years old and married to a businesswoman. For the past nine years he has sold men’s trousers and shirts.

Jean is requesting a 600,000 RWF loan from UOB. With this loan he will buy more menswear to sell in his store. He plans to use the profits to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque por 14 mujeres de esa ciudad, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas que por medio del trabajo de todas ellas desean poder ayudar a sus familias y darles de esa forma un mejor estilo de vida.
La Sra. Dora se dedica a la venta de comestibles, está casada con el señor Julio, tienen  6 hijos,  que viven con ella. Ella solicitó el crédito  para la compra de carne, verduras, huevo, pan, etc., con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo las comidas que vende. Dora tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio, para ir ampliando más la venta de otras cosas.
texts.en:
“Santa Rita” is the group formed in the city of Luque by 14 women from this city.  All of them are neighbors and friends who through their work want to be able to help their families and give them a better lifestyle that way.

Dora sells food.  She’s married to Julio and they have six children living with her.  She asked for the loan to buy meat, vegetables, eggs, bread, etc. to continue making the food she sells.  Dora’s goal is to gradually expand her business to increase sale of other things.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité San Vicente se conformó en el año 2011 y con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 2  ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta con lo que se ayudan las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Justa se dedica a la venta de leche, sábanas y gallinas, nos comenta que trabaja desde muy temprano todos los días, y que gracias a su arduo esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y sabanas, con lo que podrá tener en stock los productos que vende y de esa forma poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes de día a día.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” committee formed in 2011 and with much effort are now in their second cycle working together as a team in the program.  Besides the independent work each does, they also carry out group activities to help each other out.

Justa sells milk, sheets and chickens.  She comments that she works every day starting very early and thanks to her effort and sacrifice has been able to help her family and give them what they need.

She asks for the loan to buy milk and sheets to have stock available of what she sells and meet day to day customer demand.

loans.use: to buy milk and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña guapa cuenta con 14 integrantes, las mismas son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Las mujeres de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas e invierten sus créditos para el sustento de sus negocios y con ellos poder ayudar a sus familias. 
La Sra. Beatriz, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la producción y venta de dulces, y comenta que gracias a este trabajo puede ayudar a su familia y darles para el día a día. Su meta es poder tener algún día una gran fábrica y poder dar trabajo a más personas con ganas de salir adelante. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche, maní y demás insumos que necesite para hacer los dulces que vende. Agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group has 14 members from the city of Caacupé.  The women in this committee have a variety of activities and will invest their loan to maintain their business and with them be able to help their families.

Beatriz is one of the members. She makes sweets to sell.  She comments that thanks to this work she’s able to help her family and meet their daily needs.  Her goal is to someday be able to have a big factory and provide employment for more people who want to get ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy sugar, milk, peanuts and other ingredients she needs to make the sweets she sells.  

They are grateful for the opportunity they are getting from Kiva and from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, peanuts and other ingredients.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
A hardworking entrepreneur, Cheryl is 38, married and has four children in school. For the past sixteen years she has run a spare parts business in the Philippines.

Cheryl has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more parts to sell. Her ambition is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more parts to sell.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola is a married woman who is still childless. Her husband is a business man.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expense is mostly for food, and she dreams of buying a vehicle in the future to ease her ferrying of charcoal. 

Pola sells charcoal from her home and describes thieves to be her major challenge from her place of operation.  With the KSH 20,000, she plans to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 41-year-old lady from Migori.  She is widowed and takes care of six children aged between 8 to 20 years.

Susana operates a maize cereal selling business, which she has done for the last 6 years and makes a monthly income of KES 18,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy a maize grinding machine (poshomill). Her profits will be used to add more stock of maize.

Her dream is to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: buy a maize grinder

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be a determined and visionary woman. 

Grace operates a retail store where she sells skirt suits, trousers, shirts and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located along a busy shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payment from customers.  

Earlier on, Grace had requested two loans from SMEP and was able to repay them well. She has a plan of increasing her stock and is therefore requesting for a loan of KES 50,000  to buy clothes and shoes. Grace's dream and  business goal is to be a distributor within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she can build a house and buy land.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is aged 31. She is a mother of three children who are in the range of 4 and 9 years old. She has been selling bed sheets for the past 8 years. With this loan, she will buy more bed sheets to sell. She plans to use the profits to make more accumulation of savings.

loans.use: buy bed sheet to sell

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en: Duncan is taking another loan of KSH 50,000 to start an M-pesa business (mobile money transfer). With this loan, he wants to add money float for his M-pesa business.  Since the previous loan, his monthly income has increased by 50 percent. He dreams of establishing another M-pesa business in the future.

loans.use: add money float for his M-pesa business.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha sells foodstuff such as rice, sugar, and sodas. She is married to a technician.  Donatha is 25 years old. She has spent three years in the business of selling rice, sugar and charcoal. With this loan, she will add more rice, sugar and sodas for selling. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy  is a 49-year-old single woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a butcher shop, a retail store selling charcoal, and a grocery store where she sells meat, vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located along a busy road. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of meat and insecurity within the area. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy sweet potatoes and charcoal to sell. Nancy's dream and business goal is to venture into running a big retail shop.

loans.use: buy charcoal and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Nancy.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 24, 19, and 15. She has 1 additional dependent who is her Mother.  

In 1998, Nancy established her business selling cosmetics, suitcases, Coleman products and DVD players. She began her business because she wants to independently provide for some of her basic needs. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month from this business. 

Nancy would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid a previous loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cosmetics, DVD player and Coleman products. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Nancy plans to own a house in Kenema and to give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, suitace, coleman and DVD labtop

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
This is 63 year-old Francis.  He is married and has 4 children, aged 34, 29, 25 and 20. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him, that is his wife.  

In 1986, Francis established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he  want to better equip himself for solving his domestic problems, and this is his sole source of survival.  Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Francis would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid a previous loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy patient drugs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Francis plans to upgrade his drugstore, to build a house, and to own a private car.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is taking out another Kiva loan of KSH 50,000 for her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice to sell. Thanks for Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Club De Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLUB DE AMIGAS” iniciará su decimo noveno ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lourdes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chuño y papa, venta de cosméticos, venta de celulares, venta ropa, ferretería, venta de enaguas, venta de mantas, venta de artesanías, venta de bicicletas.

La señora Lourdes,  indica que hace once años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un taller de tejido de enaguas que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (compra de lanas), que servirá para la elaboración de las prendas. Ella nos cuenta que el negocio que realiza lo desarrolla todos los días y lo comercializa por mayor a las personas de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Club de Amigas” (Girlfriends’ Club) communal bank will start its 9th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 11 members led by a governing board headed by Lourdes.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: sale of dehydrated potatoes and potatoes, cosmetics sales, mobile phone sales, clothing sales, hardware, traditional skirt sales, blanket sales, crafts sales and bicycle sales.

Lourdes indicates that she’s been a member of a Pro Mujer communal association for the last 11 years having joined on her own initiative.  She currently has a workshop where she weaves traditional skirts; she’s had it for years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy wool yarn that she will use to make the skirts.  She tells us that she works every day and sell at wholesale to people in street fairs in the city of El Alto.  This business helps her support her family since she’s married and has two children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health service.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is from Maloro, a part of Tangub City in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 64 years old and married with one child. For the past thirty years Rosario has owned and operated a pedicab service, presently earning 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosario joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to be used to repair and maintain her pedicab. By doing so, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her pedicab.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children, six are in school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She has a pub selling beers and local gin on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy and own a fully stocked pub, to build her own house and also to expand her business into wholesale. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: La Sra. Imelda tiene la profecion de enfermera y cuenta con muchos años ejerciendo,su esposo el Sr. Rafael labora en una maquiladora los dos son personas trabajadoras y cuentan con tres hijos. ellos quieren darle lo mejor a sus tres pequeños es por eso que acuden con nosotros para que le apoyemos con el credito para poder enjarrar su recamara y poner piso de concreto esto es para poder darle mas espacio a sus hijos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Imelda’s profession is nursing and she’s been exercising it for years.  Her husband is Rafael and he works in an assembly plant.  They are both hardworking people and they have three children.  They want to give their three little ones the best and this is why they’ve called on us for our support with a loan to be able to plaster their bedroom and install a concrete floor to provide more space for their children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to plaster a room and install a concrete floor.

loans.name: Las Ponderosas Group

texts.es:
23 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque se unieron con las ganas de ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma sacar adelante a sus familias y a sus hijos. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras con con un gran espiitu emprendedor. 
La sra. Francisca se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser medias, zapatos, ropas, bijouterie y demás. Ella gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no necesiten nada. Ella esta casada con el señor Anastacio tienen 5 hijos. 
Ella solicita el crédito  para la compra de productos variados, con lo cual podrá tener variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella nos comenta que tiene como meta tener su propio negocio estable y de esa forma no tener que recorrer por las calles.
texts.en:
Twenty-three women from the city of Luque joined together wanting to help each other out and in this way move their families and children forward.  They are tenacious, enterprising women with great enterprising spirits.

Francisca is a street vendor of all types of products like stockings, shoes, clothes, costume jewelry and others.  Thanks to her effort she’s been able to give her family all they need and insure that they have no unmet needs.  She’s married to Anastacio and they have five children.

She asked for the loan to buy assorted products to in order to have variety to sell and offer her customers.  She comments that her goal is to have a stable business of her own so that she won’t have to wander the streets any longer.

loans.use: to buy stockings, shoes, clothes, costume jewelry and others.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 64 years old and married with five children. For the past six years she has run a general store. She also makes money buying and selling ready-to-wear and plastic wares, in addition to doing some tailoring. She works hard to help support her family.

Editha has previously borrowed and paid eight loans through NWTF. She is now requesting a 17,000 PHP loan to buy more stock for her store.

Editha’s plan is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child. She has been selling cashew nuts at the market for the past two years. She describes seasonality as her major challenge, and food as her greatest expense during the month. Halima aspires to open a shop in the future. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

With the KES 20,000, she intends to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronica is fifty-six years old. She is single and all her children are grown up, not depending on her. She is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past twelve years.

This is her first loan. She was brought to KADET Ltd. by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase chicken feed and a stock of chicks to rear. She hopes to become a renowned poultry distributor in her area.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and and more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child and is in school. She also takes care of her mother and her sister. 

Olivia sells bananas on a retail basis at the market and has been in this business for one year, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Olivia's goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He aspires to open a shop in future. For the past year, Ali has been selling fuel from home. Other sources of income include his wife’s earnings, and she describes high transport costs to be her major challenge. Ali owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Ali plans to purchase more jerrycans of fuel using this loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of fuel.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is 36 years old, married to a house builder, and has three children who attend school.  She owns a store where she sells bed sheets. 

Adeline is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more bed sheets to sell. With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She sells costumes for men and skirts for ladies, which she has been doing for four years. 

Pauline is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more costumes for men because she has realized that more men need costumes.

loans.use: to purchase costumes for men and skirts for ladies.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 33 and the mother of three children who are between ten months and seven years in age. Two of her children go to school.

For the past ten years Yvonne has sold clothes such as trousers, dresses and skirts. She is requesting a 500,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more clothes to sell.

Yvonne’s profits will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to  buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Peter, who is in his mid twenties, is married with one child. He has had a poultry business for two years now.  He works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy chicken feed and cover household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to buy more chicken feed for his poultry business. His dream is to one day be able to open a retail shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Juhudi" which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Esaïe Plus Group

texts.en:
Moseka, aged forty-eight, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Esaïe Plus”. It is composed of twenty members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Moseka has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1982. She sells Shikwanges (kind of bread made from manioc flour) which is one of the main foods in Kinshasa. Her business is in the middle of developing progressively. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy a larger quantity of shikwanges in bulk to resell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $40 per week. Moseka is married and the mother of eight children aged between six and twenty-eight years old, of whom six attend school.

loans.use: to purchase shikwanges (type of bread) in bulk so as to resell them at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bosembo Plus Group

texts.en:
Kikadi aged twenty-nine, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Bosembo Plus”, which is composed of twenty members united in solidarity to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Kikadi has been in his business for some years. He operates a drugstore in the eastern part of Kinshasa. He likes it and he is working hard to achieve his dream of someday opening a larger medicine facility to sell medicine to retailers. He intends to use the next loan to buy more medicine needed by his customers in his area to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of about US$80. 

Kikadi is single.

loans.use: to purchase medicine needed by his customers.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cheikh Ab.kh

texts.fr: Cheikh est un jeune marié sans enfant.Il tient une boutique de vente de téléphone portables et d'accessoires. Il a arrété ses études il y a 5 ans faute de moyens de les poursuivre. Il a ouvert alors cette boutique avec l'aide de son oncle.Il parvient à générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des portables et des accessoires téléphoniques. Son ambition est d'agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Cheikh is a young married man with no children. He has a small shop selling mobile phones and accessories. He ended his studies five years ago due to a lack of funding. Therefore he opened this store with his uncle's help. He manages to generate a fairly consistent income which means he can support his family and cover their living costs. In order to increase his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 300,000f to purchase mobile phones and phone accessories. His ambition is to grown his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa es de la ciudad de Concepción, es un grupo integrado por 20 mujeres, todas jefas de familia, que se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio del trabajo en conjunto ayudarse las unas a las otras. 
 Clotilde es parte de este grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con un gran espíritu de superación, es por ello que lucha incansablemente para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá surtir su local y atraer a más clientes. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva.
texts.en:
“Kuña Guapa” is from the city of Concepción; it’s a group made up of 20 women, all heads of household, who joined together with the goal of working together and through their teamwork help each other out.

Clotilde is part of this group and she comments that she works selling all sorts of clothes.  She is a very hardworking person with a great spirit of self-improvement which is why she strives tirelessly in order to improve her and her family’s living conditions.  She asks for the loan to buy clothes to stock her locale and attract more customers.

They are grateful for this opportunity they are getting from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es un grupo muy activo y unido, a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes siempre saben salir adelante. Actualmente este grupo se encuentra en el ciclo número once, tienen ahorros para poder ayudarse con cualquier inconveniente.
