loans.use: to buy candy, bonbons, popsicles, chocolates, fried pork rinds.

loans.name: La Vida Plena  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Vida Plena está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute que se encuentra ubicado en el sector nor-oriental de la provincia del Azuay, la población de Paute es una de las más laboriosas y emprendedoras de la provincia de Azuay, han sabido afrontar los desafíos, adaptarse a los cambios e innovar para liderar nuevas líneas de producción. Cuentan con gastronomía típica y su  producción de flores hace de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación rosas de la más alta calidad y una gran variedad de flores. Su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, aun mantienen encendida la llama de sus  tradiciones y la cultura de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. María Verónica, tiene 20 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 11 meses de edad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive con su hermana  en casa de su abuelita.

La Señorita. María Verónica se dedica por el momento al cuidado de su hija y cómo pasa la mayor de su tiempo en casa cría cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra cuyes, cerdos y en su alimento de animales para seguir creciendo en este negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir sus estudios Universitarios y llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The “La Vida Plena” (The Full Life) communal bank is formed by 8 female and 1 male members who live around Paute Canton located in the northeast sector of Azuay Province.  Paute’s population is one of the hardest working and most enterprising in Azuay Province.  They’ve known how to face up to challenges, to adapt to changes and to innovate to lead in new lines of production.  They have a typical cuisine and flower production makes this canton a virtual garden.  The highest quality roses are grown for export as well as a great variety of other flowers.  Its people are very warmhearted and still keep the flame of their traditions and the culture of its peoples lit.

One of the members of this group is María Verónica, 20.  She’s a single mother of an 11-month old daughter.  She does not own a house; she lives with her sister in their grandmother’s house.  For the moment, María Verónica is caring for her daughter but since she spends most of her time at home she raises guinea pigs and pigs to sell in her community.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy guinea pigs, pigs and animal feed to continue growing in this business.  Her dream is to continue with her university studies and become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 57, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her four children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses.  

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups who meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Юсуф житель района Шахритус. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Юсуф арендует небольшой участок земли, где выращивает бахчевые культуры и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, семян арбуза и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Yusuf is a resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 43 years old and has five children. Yusuf rents out a small plot of land where he cultivates melons and plants fruit trees. He has been in this business for twenty years. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer, watermelon seeds and fuel for the tractor.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, watermelon seeds and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio tiene 47 años y es divorciado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de  16;  9 y 7 años el es de ocupación carpintero  desde hace diez años, su carpintería se  encuentran en la localidad de Monte  Grande,  este préstamo es  su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr.  Lucio utilizara  este préstamo  para la reparación  de su  vehículo para  su negocio ya que este vehículo le ayuda a transportar la madera para la compra o para la entrega de los pedidos que tenga , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para la reparación de su vehículo ya que esta es su herramienta de trabajo, el Sr.  Lucio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar el  rendimiento de su vehículo y así poder  transportar también mayor cantidad de madera y generar mayores ingresos, el Sr. Lucio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lucio, 47, is divorced and has three children who are 16, 9 and 7 years old.  His profession for the last ten years has been carpentry.  His shop is located in Monte Grande.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution.  Lucio will use this loan to repair his vehicle for his business because this vehicle helps him transport the lumber he buys or to deliver any orders he might have completed.  His reason for asking for the loan is to repair the vehicle because it’s his work tool.  

The challenge Lucio faces in his business is to improve his quality of life and he will use profits to improve his vehicle’s performance so that he can transport larger amounts of lumber and generate higher income.  Lucio is a very hardworking person who feels very happy and grateful to the Institution for the support it’s provided him by granting the loan.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Herland

texts.es: El Sr. Herland  tiene 41 años y no es casado pero convive   con  su pareja con la cual tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 8 años, se dedica a la  agricultura desde hace diez años, su parcela se encuentra en la localidad de sombrerito,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, Herland utilizara este préstamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y de Verengena, es Sr, Herland solicita este préstamo para incremento de  de capital de trabajo ya que una vez que cosecha sus verduras los vende en el mercado de la localidad, directo del productor al consumidor,   Herland enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  utilizara los beneficios para  mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia,  El Sr. Herland es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Herland, 41, isn’t married but lives with his spouse with whom he has an 8 year old son.  He’s been farming for the last ten years.  His parcel is located in Sombrerito.  This loan is his third sequence in the institution and Herland will use it to buy potato and eggplant seeds.

Herland is asking for this loan to increase his working capital because once he harvests his vegetables he sells them in the local market directly from producer to consumer.

The challenge Herland faces in his business is to improve his quality of life and will use profits to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  Herland is a very hardworking person and he feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy potato and eggpland seeds.

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en: Mrs. Hera Devi is 30 years old. She lives in a single family with her husband and two children. She has one daughter and one son. Her daughter is studying in grade 4 and her son is just over a year old. They are a middle class family. Her husband, Mr. Ram Krishna, is engaged in woodcarving. He has 10 years of experience in this field. He sells his work to dealers. He also employs three workers in his woodcarving business. Woodcarving work is one of the traditional works for the local people work in Thecho and Thecho is famous for its woodcarving. Now Mrs Hera Devi is requesting a loan to help her husband buy materials for his woodcarving business. Her husband is the only income source for the family and all the financial requirements of the family are met with his income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for woodcarving

loans.name: Victor Esteban

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor tiene 30 años de edad,  es casado pero convive  con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 13, 12 y 1 año,   tiene como actividad  la orfebrería, fabrica variedad de joyas, su joyería se encuentra ubicado que se encuentran en la  zona Mercurio,  Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr.   Víctor  va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de oro para la fabricación de joyas  para su negocio, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de materia prima, el sr.  Víctor  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y  va a utilizar los beneficios para reinvertir y fabricar más joyas su deseo es  establecerse bien en el rubro ya que el sr. Víctor es una persona joven y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Victor, 30, is married and he lives with 3 children who are ages 13, 12 and 1.  He works making a variety of jewelry out of gold.  His jewelry business is located in the Mercurio neighborhood.  This is his second loan with the institution.  Victor will use this loan to buy gold to use in making jewelry for his business.  The reason that he is requesting this loan is to buy raw materials.  Victor's challenge in this business is the competition.  He will reinvest the profits from this loan so that he can make more jewelry.  He wants to become well established in this line of work, because Victor is a hardworking young person.  He is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided in the granting of this loan.

loans.use: to buy gold to make jewelry

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly, 42, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in a growing agricultural business for over 20 years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband produces palm sugar to sell. He earns about USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed. They are a garment worker, a mechanic and a rice mill employee. They earn approximately USD 9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Saly is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase mechanical tools for her son to use in his work. This purchase will help her son get enough tools to use in his repair service. In the future, she would like to expand her son’s business by purchasing spare parts to sell and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools for her son to use in his work

loans.name: Veith

texts.en: Veith, 61, is widowed and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over five years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed in the factory. They earn about USD 9 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Veith is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to re-sell. By doing so, she can earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to re-sell

loans.name: Kuvat

texts.ru: Куват 50-летний женатый мужчина. Он работает в пекарне. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Куват имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии он учитель химии. В этой области он работает 10 лет. Кроме того у него на рынке имеется пекарня, где он печет лепешки. Этим видом деятельности занимается год. Кредит берет для покупки муки и дров.
texts.en: Kuvat is a 50 year old man. He works in the bakery. He has six children. His wife is a homemaker. Kuvat has a higher education with a degree in teaching. He is a chemistry teacher and worked in this field for ten years. He also has a bakery on the local market where he bakes flat breads. He has been in this business for one year. He is taking out the loan to buy flour and wood.

loans.use: to buy flour and wood.

loans.name: El Nanchito Group

texts.es:
Patricia cuenta con 54 años de edad, es casada su esposo se llama Honorino y  se dedica al campo.  Solo tiene una hija Haylline tiene 6 años está estudiando lo cual  cursa el 1° de primaria.
Ella se dedica al comercio, en ventas de ropa quien cuenta que invertirá su préstamo en surtir su negocio, ya que necesita comprar ropa para poder actualizar todas las prendas a la moda por ejemplo, necesita comprar más vestidos de fiestas, pantalones casuales, blusas que están a la moda ,ropa interior para dama y para caballero también y así tanto como patricia que es la comerciante y los clientes tendrán un beneficio que para patricia seria lo doble de ventas que tenía en las ventas anteriores y para los clientes seria la actualización de moda en su estilo personal.
 La señora patricia tiene la esperanza de que así será su suerte a partir de ahora gracias al préstamo que se le otorgo, también podrá ayudarle a su hija a salir adelante en su educación.
Patricia pertenece al grupo El Nanchito lo cual está  integrado por 11 mujeres trabajadoras que a continuación se mencionaran. Irma, Luisa, Geronima, Fabiana, patricia, Elia, Virginia, Rosabel, Felicita, Gloria y Catatalina todas ellas cuentan con actividades comerciales como son: venta de bolillos, venta de camotes,  ropa,  pan, dulces y frutas
texts.en:
Patricia is 54, married, and her husband's name is Honorino. He is a farmer. She has a daughter, Haylline, who is 6 years old and in first grade of primary school.

She sells clothing, and tells us that she will invest her loan in stocking her business, as she needs to buy clothing to update all her items to the latest styles. For example, she needs to buy more party dresses, casual pants, stylish blouses, as well as ladies' and men's underwear. This way, both Patricia and the customers will benefit. Patricia would double her sales from what she had before, and the customers would get the latest fashions in a style that suits them.

Patricia hopes that things will work out for her this way from now on, thanks to the loan that she has been granted. As well, she will be able to help her daughter succeed in getting an education.

Patricia belongs to the "El Nanchito" group, made up of 11 hard-working women, as follows: Irma, Luisa, Geronima, Fabiana, Patricia, Elia, Virginia, Rosabel, Felicita, Gloria and Catalina. All of them have small businesses such as selling bread rolls, sweet potatoes, clothing, bread, candy and fruit.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria tiene 38 años, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos, ambos en edad escolar, que aun dependen de ella. Gloria tiene un conocido local de comidas rápidas, donde ofrece a sus clientes y vecinos del barrio pizzas y hamburguesas, aparte de refrescos, así también cuenta con el servicio de Delivery para sus clientes que soliciten sus productos a domicilio.
Se dedica a este trabajo dese hace 5 años, brindando a sus clientes un excelente servicio. Ella es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la refacción parcial de su local, lo que le permite atender a sus clientes de manera más cómoda. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Gloria, 38, is the single mother of two children.  They are both school-aged children who are dependent upon her.  Gloria has a well-known fast food business where she offers her customers and neighbors pizzas, hamburgers and soft drinks.  She also has a delivery service for customers who request that her products be delivered to their homes.

Gloria has been doing this work for 5 years, providing her customers with excellent service.  She is a person who has a strong desire to get ahead and to help her family through her work.

Gloria is requesting a loan to do some repairs to her business premises.  This will allow her to provide more comfortable service to her customers.  She appreciates the Fundacion and Kiva for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to refurbish her food stall

loans.name: Eliezer Antonio

texts.es: Eliezer está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad, está cursando el último años y el crédito solicitado es para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Actualmente está laborando y es así como paga sus estudios. Dentro de algunos años se ve en un mejor puesto, obteniendo mayores ingresos, se ve desempeñándose en su área  y apoyar a sus padres en todo lo necesario. Se ha propuesta coronar y cumplir su sueño, obtener un título universitario y que su mamá se sienta orgullosa , ya que sería el primero en la familia en tener un título universitario.
texts.en:
Eliezer is studying the career of accounting, and he is in his last year.  The requested loan to to pay the final fees for his diploma in his career.  He is currently working, and that is how he pays for school.

Within a few years he sees himself in a better position and getting greater income.  He sees himself working in his area and supporting his parents in everything they need.

He has been determined to finish and fulfill his dream of getting his university degree and that his mother will be proud of him.  He will be the first in the family to get a university degree.

loans.use: to to pay the final fees for his diploma in his career.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty, es un grupo de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 12 mujeres que se unieron con la esperanza de poder ayudar a sus familias. Su objetivo es poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal, y saben que gracias al programa de la fundación podrán hacerlo.
Sinthia vende comidas de todo tipo, y comenta que tiene muy buena sazón, por lo que tiene ya muy buena clientela que siempre gusta de todo lo que ella hace. Se meta es poder tener un comedor y de esa forma poder tener mayores ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás insumos que necesitará para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, Kuna Aty, is a group from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are 12 women who joined hoping to help their families. The group's goal is to grow not only economically, but also personally, and they know that through the program of the foundation they may do so.

Sinthia, one of the members of the group, sells food of all kinds.  She says her food has very good flavor so she has a very good customer base and they always like everything she does.  Her goal is to have a dining area and thus have higher income to help her family.

Sinthia is requesting a loan for the purchase of meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies she'll need to continue making the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
La Sra. Geronima tiene 61 años de edad se encuentra acompañada del Sr. Edison de 40 edad, ambos viven en el en la Ciudad de Itá.
Tanto la Sra. Como don Edison se dedican al comercio, Ña Geronima tiene una despensa bien surtida, además tiene una cantina escolar en la Escuela Ángel Gabriel. En su despensa tiene ventas de verduras, frutas, carnes de chancho, pollos, vacunos, y además todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, bebidas y lácteos. La Sra. Geronima es una persona muy sacrificada que día a día se esfuerza para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, carnes, etc. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Geronima, 61, lives with her partner Edison, 40, in the city of Itá.  They both work in retail trade.  Geronima has a well-stocked store, and she also has a snack bar in the Ángel Gabriel school.  In her store she sells vegetables, fruit, pork, chicken, beef, consumer staples, drinks and dairy products.  Geronima is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

Geronima will use this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, etc.  She thanks the Fundacion and Kiva for the assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, etc.

loans.name: Agripin

texts.es:
El Sr. Agripin es casado y  vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Luque. Él tiene un taller de de fabricación de guampas de  fibra de vidrio, a lo cual se dedica desde el año 2007.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. El comenta que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
El solicita el  préstamo para la compra de elementos para su trabajo, como ser bases, fibras y demás insumos y de esa manera cubrir su demanda. El préstamo le dará un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Agripin is married and lives in his own home in the cty of Lugue.  He has a workshop manufacturing fiberglass guampas, which he has worked since 2007.  He is a very hard working person and wants to get ahead through his work.  He says he works everyday from very early in the morning.  His goal is to keep working and in this way continue to help his family.  He requests the loan to buy elements for his work, like bases, fiber, and other supplies so that he is able to meet his demands.  The loan will give his work a better profit margin, which will help him improve his level in life.

loans.use: buy bases, fiber and other supplies to make guampas.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 46, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Moises, an employee. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marissa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marissa hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having her own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sulma Sobeyda

texts.es: Sulma está estudiando la carrera de administractión de empresas, y está solicitando el crédito para comprar una computadora para hacer más fácil su trabajo en la universidad, tanto de preparación como de investigación y le permitirá también instalar un programa de inglés educativo. Le inspiran a realizar sus metas el deseo de superación y el deseo de no emigrar de su patria, sino servir aquí en el desarrollo de la sociedad. Desea en un futuro ser consultora, trabajando para instituciones que lo requieran, desea desarrollarse como una mujer independiente.
texts.en:
Sulma is studying a degree in Business Administration, and is requesting a loan to buy a computer to make her preparation and research work for the course easier. It will also enable her to install an educational English programme. 

She is inspired to acheive her goals by her desire to excel and to remain in her home country to help with societies development, rather than emigrating.

In the future, she wants to be a consultant, working for institutions that require help, and she wants to develop as an independent woman.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Daysi Jaqueline

texts.es: Daysi trabaja en una distribuidora de productos como Impulsadora de Ventas, está estudiando la carrera de Mercadeo y Publicidad y solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Dentro de 5 o 10 años se ve como gerente de alguna marca, cosechando el fruto de su esfuerzo. Le inspira su madre ya que ella siempre ha trabajado y sin tener una profesión ha sacado adelante a su familia, ella siempre le ha inspirado porque nunca se ha dado por vencida. Daysi es una persona perseverante con muchos deseos de superación y es para ella un orgullo poder culminar sus estudios, tener en sus manos su título.
texts.en: Daysi works as a sales associate for a product distributor. She is studying for a degree in Marketing and Advertising, and she is requesting the loan to pay for the final course in her studies. Within 5 or 10 years, she sees herself as a brand manager, reaping the fruits of her efforts. She was inspired by her mother, who has always worked and helped her family get ahead without having a profession, and who has been inspiring because she never gave up. Daysi is a determined person with a great desire to get ahead. She takes great pride in being able to finish her studies and have her degree in her hand.

loans.use: to pay for the final course in her university studies.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “La Esperanza” están en el Primer Ciclo  con 12  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas  y responsables, se ayudan las unas a las otras y de esa forma hacen que el trabajo es más fácil. 
Carmen vende cosméticos y comenta que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, que siempre compra de ella, ya que tiene muy buenos productos y a bajo costo. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda y allí ofrecer todos los productos que tiene y más. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de ser alguien en la vida. 
Carmen solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos de variadas marcas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ofreciendo buna calidad a sus clientas, además de buena variedad.
texts.en:
The committee is called “La Esperanza” (Hope).  They are in their first cycle with 12 members.  It’s a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united and responsible; they help each other out and this makes their work easier.

Carmen sells cosmetics and she comments that she already has a well-established clientele who always buys from her because she has very good products at low prices.  Her goal is to be able to have a great store to sell all the products she has and then some there.  She defines herself as a very hardworking person who very much wants to become someone in life.

Carmen is asking for the loan to buy cosmetics of varied brands so that she can continue to offer her customers good quality as well as good variety.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Tet Trankil De Saillants 1, 2 &3 Group

texts.fr:
Marc  est le coordinateur de son groupe tet trankil. Marc habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.  Il est pas marié il a 5 enfants. 

Marc a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du charbon. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de Marc ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.  Marc dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant . Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Marc is the coordinator of his group Tet Trankil. He lives in the city of Trou du Nord in Haiti, where electricity is rare, and water is very limited. He is married and has five children.

Marc has been running his business for the last seven years.  He would like to use this loan to invest in charcoal. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.

The other members of Marc's [group] have need of a loan for such businesses as the selling charcoal, rice, or fish. 

Marc says that his main challenge is a lack of steady customers. He says his main goals include increasing his business. His dream is to buy a motorbike to transport goods.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman who has two children. Veronica is 37 years old and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Veronica manages a banana/coconut production business to earn a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,900 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2008, Veronica joined GDMPC. In the future, Veronica wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a tour operator who lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. This is an area that receives many tourists during the peak seasons. She began the business five years ago. Rachael is married and has one child.

She was introduced to Milango through her friends and decided to join in order to access credit for her business. Rachael is asking for a loan of 104,750 Kenya shillings to further develop and advertise her tour company.

Rachael’s aspiration is to be an internationally renowned tour operator and she believes she can achieve this through effective marketing. She will keep the extra income from this loan for future developments. Her business faces a challenge during the low seasons when most tourists return to their home countries.

loans.use: To develop and advertise her tour company.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. This is one of the towns adjacent to the Kenyan port. Therefore, it has a large number of residents, some living and others working within the area. Mwanaisha owns an open-air food café, which has been in operation for the last three years. She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase charcoal to open a charcoal business. This is in an attempt to diversify in order to increase her income streams. Mwanaisha is ambitious and has great plans for her business. She has four children, all of whom are in school and depend on her for support. Her main ambition is to own a restaurant. She will use the extra income from this loan to start a water-selling point.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to open a charcoal business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina de 32 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 7 años. Allí tiene una panadería donde produce panes y postres, que vende entre la gente del macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lugar donde habita. Ella había iniciado el negocio de tienda panadería, con su cónyuge en otro barrio, pero la ola invernal erosionó su vivienda y perdieron recursos, así fue como fue reubicada con su familia en este megaproyecto. Karina y su familia son personas de mucha persistencia, pues antes de emprender su tienda, habían sido desplazados de su tierra en el departamento de Bolívar, posteriormente cuando estaban trabajando con firmeza, sobrevino la ola invernal , pero ellos no se dejan vencer por las adversidades y por eso en Ciudad bicentenario emprendieron su propia panadería, que aprovechando su anterior experiencia, quieren darle un esquema de tienda donde adicionalmente vendan ranchos, víveres y artículos de la canasta familiar. Es su negocio el Marido de Karina prepara el pan y los postres y ella muy creativamente sale con su vitrina a la que le puso ruedas, vendiendo por todo el mega barrio, donde ahora habita. Ellos tienen muchos sueños de prosperidad, como el de adecuar un local independiente, para el buen desempeño de su microempresa. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de consumo que se venden en las tiendas, como víveres, carnes, abarrotes y materias primas en mayor volumen para elaborar nuevos productos de panadería, porque aun cuenta con su horno, vitrinas cilindradoras y produce panes y postres, los que reparte en su vitrina rodante .
texts.en:
Karina is 32 and lives in the city of Cartagena with her partner and their two children, ages 5 and 7. She has a bakery there, where she produces bread and baked treats. With the support of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she sells these to people in Macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, the place where she lives.

She had started her bakery in another neighborhood with her partner, but the rainy season floods eroded their dwelling and they lost their property. This was how she and her family were relocated to this large housing complex.

Karina and her family are very persevering people, as before launching their store, they had been displaced from their land in Bolívar department, and subsequently, when they were working their hardest, they survived the rainy season flooding. But they are not letting themselves be defeated by adversity, and that's why they have launched their own bakery in Ciudad Bicentenario. 

Benefitting from their previous experience, they have in mind a store where they also sell snacks, food supplies, and basic household items. This is their business: Karina's husband prepares the bread and baked treats and she very creatively goes out to sell with her display case on wheels, selling all over the large neighborhood where she now lives.

They have many dreams of prosperity, such as fitting up a stand-alone store for the proper functioning of their small business.

This is the reason why they are approaching their credikiva for their first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. By this means she will buy food items that are sold in stores, such as food supplies, meats, groceries, and ingredients in greater volume for making new bakery products. This is because she still has her oven and rolling display case, and produces breads and baked treats that she distributes in her rolling display case.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in greater volume for making new bakery products and to buy basic household items to sell.

loans.name: Taman Sari Group

texts.en: Having succeeded in the previous period, the Taman Sari groups proceeded to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the applications of  the group to increase the number of loans was granted. Currently the group received 15M IDR with each individual person receiving 1.5M IDR. Because most have been able to increase the number of pig populations, the current loan was used to buy food and fix the cages. Luh Eka used the loan to buy a super quality feed and build new cages. She was very pleased with the effort that can be developed. She hopes to become a big pig seller in her village and use all the profits to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy a super quality feed and build new cages

loans.name: Mwasada

texts.en: Mwasada lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is a mother of three children and runs a shop that has been in operation for the last two years. She started the business after selling her 10 goats to acquire capital. Mwasada was introduced to Milango last year and joined in order to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock e.g. sugar, flour, soap etc. Mwasada currently rents a business premise and her future aspiration is to own a business shop premise and increase the stock, despite the challenge of competition and price fluctuations.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock of sugar, flour, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.ru: Назир проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его дети учатся в школе. Сам Назир занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает арбуз и дыню. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. На полученную прибыль от продажи урожая хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Nazir lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 36 years old, married, and has six children who go to school. Nazir cultivates crops, mainly melons and watermelons. He has been engaged in this for five years. Nazir is taking this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. He would like to use the profits from the sale of his harvest to repair his home.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.ru: Абдуназар проживает в районе Кубодиен. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Абдуназар более пяти лет занимается скотоводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Abdunazar lives in the Qubadiyon region. He is 31 years old, married, and has three children. Abdunazar has been raising cattle for over five years. He is taking this loan to purchase calves in order to increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Newen Domo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Newen Domo” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran carpintería, repostería y amasandería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Paola presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la tercera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda. Su cabello es de color castaño y lo usa tomado. Viste un chaleco color café y es una de las integrantes más altas del grupo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la repostería y también a la artesanía en madera. Se desempeña en estos oficios desde hace dos años. En el primero de estos prepara kuchen, tortas y pasteles. Mientras que en el segundo oficio de la artesanía fabrica y decora bandejas, cuadros, joyeros y perchas de ropa en madera.
Sus ingredientes y materiales, los compra en diferentes distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas, dependiendo el precio de los productos, ya que Paola también se encarga de cotizar, para que le sea más conveniente económicamente. 
Su dinámica de venta, la realiza a través de la promoción de sus productos de boca en boca a su entorno más cercano, entre amigos, conocidos, vecinos y familiares. Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda es durante el verano, por lo que aprovecha de producir una mayor cantidad de productos para venderlos.
Su jornada de trabajo es de lunes a sábado durante las mañanas, horario que le facilita el cuidado de sus hijos.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio de artsanía en madera.
Una de las metas para su negocio, es establecerse con un local establecido en alguna feria artesanal.
Paola vive junto a su marido, sus tres hijos de 9, 5 y 1 años de edad, además de su abuela. Uno de sus sueños es instalarse con un negocio familiar, ya que su marido se dedica a la carpintería, de ésta manera podrían fusionar y complementar sus oficios para el negocio de la artesanía en madera. Todo esto para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. 
Ella está muy agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio y alcanzar sus objetivos propuestos. 
Comenta que se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal del cual forma parte y dentro de las capacitaciones la han orientado a invertir y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Newen Domo” and is comprised of 19 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different fields, including carpentry and baking, among others.  All of the members are from the city of Temuco.  

Paola, the president of the bank, appears in the third row of the photo, in the second place from right to left.  Her hair is brown and is worn up.  She is wearing a brown vest and is one of the tallest members of the group.  She works in pastries, and also artisanal woodwork.  She has worked both jobs for two years.  In the first job, she prepares kuchen, cakes and pastries.  In the second trade of making handicrafts, she makes decorative trays, boxes, jewelry boxes, and wooden clothes hangers. She buys her ingredients and materials from different distributors and major supermarkets, depending on the price of the products.  She also takes care to quote, so that it is economically efficient.  She makes her dynamic sales by promoting her products by word of mouth in her inner circle of friends, acquaintances, neighbors and family.  She says her busiest season is during summer, when she is able to produce a bigger quantity of products to sell.  Her work schedule is Monday through Saturday mornings, which allows her to take care of her children.  With the loan she will buy supplies for her woodworking business.  One of her business goals is to establish a fixed location in a crafts fair.  Paola lives with her husband and three children, ages 9, 5 and 1 years, as well as with her grandmother.  One of her dreams is to establish a family business, since her husband is a carpenter, and be able to fuse and compliment each others’ woodwork.  All of this is to improve the quality of life for her family.  She is very grateful for the help from Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will allow her to invest in her business and reach her proposed goals.  She says she feels very comfortable in her communal bank who have taught her to invest and better distribute her earnings.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  The surrounding area contains a number of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  Note that this region is inhabited by 50% of the Mapuche indigenous population of the country.

loans.use: buy supplies for her artisanal woodwork business.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a grocery seller who lives in Changamwe, Kenya. The business has been in operation for the last four years. This business has supported Jemimah and her two children. She started it off from her savings. On learning about Milango, Jemimah joined and is now applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to start a video show business.

Her aspiration is to develop the grocery business and thereby be a supplier of most commodities to other small traders. Before then, Jemimah needs to overcome the challenge of some customers not paying on time and price fluctuations. The extra income will help her build a rental house for the family.

loans.use: To start a video show business.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 5 years, Cristy has operated a shop, selling vegetables such as cabbages, beans, pechay (bok choy), bitter melons, radishes, spices and seasonings. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more vegetables (potatoes, spring onions, beans, garlic), vinegar and cooking oil to sell. Cristy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 44-year-old married father of six children. Eight years ago, he started up his mechanics business, opening up a garage servicing car repairs, auto parts and motor lubricants. Besides offering competitive service, such as authentic German car parts, Hassan has gained his customers’ trust and loyalty from his work ethics and friendly attitude. He is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, for his business supplies’ purchases of parts, oils and other products.

Hassan’s entrepreneurial spirit was his main drive to establishing his business which has been his main source of income to support his family and his children’s increasing needs.

loans.use: to purchase parts, oil and other products

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 30-year-old hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. Stephen has been operating an Internet cafe for the last five years. His major hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock and insufficient power supply. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and expanding his business to new markets. Stephen needs a loan to buy a generator for his business.

loans.use: to buy a generator for his business.

loans.name: Mustafokul

texts.ru: Мустафокул проживает в городе Истаравшан. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Мустафокул предоставляет услугу. По специальности он сварщик. В этой области Мустафокул более десяти лет. Он берет кредит для ремонта мастерской.
texts.en: Mustafokul lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He earns a living by offering his services as a welder. Mustafokul has been working in this profession for over ten years. He is taking this loan to repair his workshop.

loans.use: to repair his workshop

loans.name: Shaarkul

texts.ru:
Шааркул 53 года, вдова, воспитала 5 детей. Шааркул работает техничкой в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника  дохода для своей семьи, Шааркул занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2009 году. Благодаря упорному труду Шааркул,  ее бизнес, начатый с суммы 18,000 сом  позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 4,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шааркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Шааркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Shaarkul is a 53-year-old widow who has raised 5 children. She works as a custodian in the local school, and also raises livestock as a source of additional income, having started this business in 2009. Thanks to Shaarkul's dedicated work, her business, launched with a sum of 18,000 som, currently earns profits of 4,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Shaarkul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
This is Martina, 53, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, her business partner, and is the mother of two children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. Martina works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Martina operates a business buying footwear and sandals at wholesale prices and selling them with a little profit. Customers are attracted to her low selling prices. Martina also operates a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Martina earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Martina is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Martina hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of slippers and sandals

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en: Remegio is a 45-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and to build a permanent house. Remegio has been running a furniture workshop for the last seven years, and is facing the hardships of price fluctuations and inflation. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and modernizing his workshop to include welding facilities. Remegio needs a loan to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza, 43 years old, is married and has 5 children. She lives in the Philippines and is a coconut farmer. Liza has been doing this work for 15 years, earning PHP 4,000 monthly from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for land plowing. Liza has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to help her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to pay for land plowing.

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru:
Нурие 51 год, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве источника  дохода для своей семьи, Нурия занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду Нурии,  ее бизнес, начатый с суммы 35,000 сом  позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Нурии имеется 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 10 овец,3 козы и 3,50 га земли, где она выращивает картофель и многолетние травы. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Нурия планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса за счет покупки большого сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Nuriya is 51 years old, married, and has raised 4 children. As a source of income for her family, Nuriya raises livestock, having started this business in 2000. Thanks to Nuriya's hard work, her business, launched with a sum of 35,000 som, currently earns profits of 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. Presently, Nuriya's farm has 2 dairy cows, 1 calf, 10 sheep and 3 goats, as well as 3.5 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and perennial grasses.

In order to continue developing her business, Nuriya has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expanding her business by constructing a large barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Amanecer trabaja desde el año 2006 con la fundación Paraguaya,  se encuentran  en el ciclo numero 19. Ellas son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de este trabajo también ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Mirtha ella se dedica  a la venta de joyas, ropas y también es modista. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, hace todos estos trabajos ya que desea poder salir adelante y sabe que la única forma es por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo.
Cuenta la Sra. Mirtha  que el crédito que solicita es para la compra de ropas para volver a vender,  ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a esta oportunidad puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Amanecer Communal Bank has been working since the year 2006 with Fundación Paraguaya and is in its 19th loan cycle. They are women who are eager to get ahead and help one another and also help their families.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Mirtha. She sells jewelry and clothing and is also a seamstress. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person and performs all of these jobs since she wants to be able to get ahead and she knows that the only way is through her own effort and hard work.

Mirtha notes that the loan she is applying for is to purchase clothing to sell. She is very grateful since, thanks to this opportunity, she can improve her and her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase garments to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra repuestos para realizar la reparación de su motocicleta. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores repuestos y de buena calidad para que su motocicleta no le dé desperfectos a corto plazo y así poder cumplir con su trabajo de una forma más adecuada y eficiente. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jonathan, who is 26 years old, is married.  He lives with his wife, who is his first priority.  With the loan he plans to purchase parts in order to repair his motorcycle.  What he wants is to be able to purchase the best used parts and the best quality so that his bike will not have problems over the short term and thus he will be able to accomplish his work in an adequate and efficient manner.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the chance for a loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: To repair a motorcycle

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en: Floramie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child. For the past 5 years, Floramie has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages. Floramie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, beverages, junk foods and biscuits

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is a 65-year-old married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house. Enock has been running a blacksmith business, which he started with 500,000 UGX capital and has grown to 600,000 UGX. His major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, Enock has a vision of buying land to grow crops and expanding business to new markets. Enock wants a loan to buy raw materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking man living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and is passionate about it. He has no hardships in what he is currently doing and just loves working with the young people he teaches. His family goal is to educate his children in the future if he has some, but for now he is planning to construct a family house. Paul intends to use the loan to buy building materials for the house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru:
Салтанат 48 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве источника  дохода для своей семьи, Салтанат занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2003 году с собственных сбрережений. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат,  ее бизнес, начатый с покупки коровы и 6 овец,   на сегодняшний день насчитывает 7 дойных коров, 3 телят, 5 овец, 4 нетелей, что позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса за счет покупки большого сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Saltanat is 48 years old, married, and has raised 4 children. In order to provide a source of income for her family, Saltanat raises livestock, having launched this business in 2003 with her own savings. Thanks to her hard work, Saltanat's business, which started with a purchase of a cow and 6 sheep, currently has 7 dairy cows, 3 calves, 5 sheep and 4 heifers, and earns a profit of 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products.

In order to continue developing her business, Saltanat has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business by purchasing a large barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Waliki Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALIKI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará su cuarto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Eleuteria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cuadros, venta de api, trenzado de mantas y macramé, venta de pescado, venta de ropa y confección, venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de polleras y mantas.

La señora Eleuteria,  indica que hace dos años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (compra de ropa), que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “WALIKI SARTASIÑANI” communal bank will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors headed by Eleuteria. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them we have: selling paintings, selling api [a traditional drink], weaving blankets and macrame, selling fish, selling and making clothes, selling food, selling skirts and blankets. 

Eleuteria indicates that two years ago she became a member of a communal bank in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of one of the other members. right now she has a business selling clothes, something she has been doing for years.  
 
The loan she is taking out now is to buy merchandise (to buy clothes) that she will acquire from the markets in the city of El Alto and later sell at her sales locale. This business helps her support her family. She is single and has a son. 
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the trainings on the topics of health and credit.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 27-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children, to build a permanent home and to have a better life with her family. Irene has been running a fresh foods business for the last three years, after starting with capital she got from harvesting her tomato gardens. She is facing hardships of high fuel and transportation costs, theft and customers not paying on time. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and hiring employees to help her do so. Irene needs a loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Heda

texts.en:
This is Heda, 58, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a single parent of three children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. Heda works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses

Heda oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to Heda. She also manages an apartment rental for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Heda earns a minimum of PHP 400 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Heda is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Heda dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Las Magníficas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAGNÍFICAS” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora María Eugenia es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de polleras, limpieza de quinua, teñido de lanas y moldeado de cebo para chiflería, venta de coca por menor, servicio de costura de deportivos, venta de cerveza y comida, tejido de manta y macramé.

La señora María Eugenía, indica que  es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una prima. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de costura de deportivos que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de un trabajo anterior.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para cambio de negocio, (compra de coca), mismo que comprará de la feria paceña y posteriormente lo comercializará las ferias alteñas por las tardes. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es viuda y tiene ocho hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía se encientra la señora de mantilla amarilla acompañando al grupo, es la hija de la señora Porfiria.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Las Magníficas" (Community Association: "The Magnificents") begins its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the regional center Villa Adela, and is made up of seven members directed by a board, on which María Eugenia is the secretary.  The businesses of the members of the community association are varied and among these we have: chicken raising, quinoa processing, wool dyeing and making baits for traditional remedies, small-scale coca sales, sportswear sewing services, sales of beer and food, blanket weaving and macrame.

María Eugenía says that this is the first time she has joined a community group with Pro Mujer; she joined at the request of a cousin.  She currently has a business in sewing sportswear, which she has worked at for years, learning from a former job.
 
The loan that she will receive is for a change in businesses (to buy coca), which she will buy from the market in La Paz and afterward will sell in the highland markets each afternoon.  These sales will help her to support her family, as she is a widow and has eight children.
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health center.

In the photo, you can also see a woman in a yellow top with the group, she is the daughter of Ms. Porfiria.

loans.use: Venta de coca

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 38-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goals are to build a permanent house and to buy land. John has been running a pub business for the last three years, after working in agriculture. His main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, theft and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of moving his business to a more permanent location. John needs a loan to buy beer and local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy  beer and local brew to sell.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 42-year-old married father of three children. He retailed and repaired spare parts until 2010 when he opened up his own grocery store, selling foodstuffs and candies. 

Jamal is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to increase the supply of goods in his store and to expand his business further. Jamal has always been independent and is happy to have been a self-made trader. His main concern is to maintain a good standard of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to increase the supply of goods at his store

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is married and has 5 children. She is 31 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Mary Jane owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas and coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. Mary Jane has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Mary Jane is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 38-year-old married man with four children. He has been farming for ten years, initially dealing in only maize but now growing a variety of crops. Vincent's hardships are price fluctuations, seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase modern farming equipment. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to buy land to grow more crops. Vincent wants money to buy land for growing crops.

loans.use: to buy more land for growing crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas 2 es de ciudad de Curuguaty, tiene 10 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas y las otras. Actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, es un comité que demuestra mucho interés con todos los programas que la Fundación ofrece.
Julbia es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras de toda variedad y comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas y demás verduras, para que de esa forma pueda estar abastecida para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas 2 group is from the city of Curuguaty, they have ten members, and they are all friends and neighbors in the city.  They are all hardworking and motivated to get ahead in life and help each other.  They now find themselves in their second cycle of loans, and they are a committee which shows great interest in all the programs offered by the Foundation.

Julbia is a person who really wants to prosper and work to help out her family.  She is involved in the sales of vegetable of every type and says that thanks to her work, she has been able to help her family and give them what they need in their day to day lives.

She is looking for a loan to buy tomatoes, green peppers, onions, and other vegetables so that she will be well supplied to suit her clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green peppers, onions, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Norlina

texts.en: Norlina has a live-in who has 5 children. She is 23 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past 2 years, Norlina has managed a banana production business, earning PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Norlina is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 25-year-old businessman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married and has two children. Julius has been operating a retail shop for three years, which he started with his long time savings from agricultural products sales. He faces a problem of finding customers and plans to move the business to a more permanent location. Julius needs a loan to buy items such as sugar and soap for his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar and soap

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married and has four children. She is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alice used her last loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the costs of planting rice. Her business is successful, and she's taking out a new loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Alice hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 35-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for two years, having started with 2,000,000 UGX and now having 6,000,000 UGX. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and taxes. Robert's personal goals are to educate his children, to build a permanent home and self education. His business goals are to buy land to grow crops, to expand his business into new markets and to move the business to a more permanent location. Robert wants money to buy maize flour, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Kalipa

texts.ru:
Калипе 52 года, вдова и проживает с младшим сыном и снохой. Калипа родилась в простой и многодетной семье фермера, с  детства была самостоятельным ребенком и помогала матери по уходу за домом. В 1978 году после окончания школы Калипа вышла замуж и после свадьбы Калипа с мужем стали жить у его родителей.  Муж Калипы работал бухгалтером в местном колхозе, в семье был скот и земля, на которой они сажали овощи и зерновые, на доходы они покупали скот. 
В 2010 году в результате болезни умер муж Калипы. Преодолеть горе Калипе помогли ее дети и внуки. В  данный момент, Калипу поддерживает младший сын, став главным помощником  в хозяйстве.  Благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Калипы, на сегодня  в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 3 головы рогатого скота и 1 лошадь. Будучи активным человеком, Калипа открыла маленький торговый павильончик с товарами повседневного спроса, оборот которого составляет  до 8 000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Калипа обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В планах у Калипы увеличение поголовья скота и товарооборота, а мечтает она купить квартиру в городе Карабалта.
texts.en:
Kalipa is a 52-year-old widow who lives with her youngest son and his wife. Kalipa was born in a large family of a simple farmer. She was a precocious child and helped her mother take care of the household. After finishing school in 1978, Kalipa got married and went to live with her husband at his parents' home. Kalipa's husband was an accountant at the local collective farm, the family had livestock and land, on which they cultivated vegetables and grains, using their profits to purchase additional farm animals. 

In 2010, Kalipa's husband passed away as the result of an illness. Her children and grandchildren helped Kalipa overcome her grief. Presently, she is supported by her youngest son, who has become the main helper in her business. Thanks to Kalipa's persistence and hard work, her herd currently has 3 horned animals and 1 horse. Being an active person, Kalipa has also opened a small retail kiosque that sells daily necessities, with a monthly net income of up to 8,000 som (KGS). In order to continue expanding her business, Kalipa has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle. Kalipa plans to continue increasing the size of her herd and the volume of her sales, and dreams of one day buying an apartment in the city of Karabalta.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mbaitswa

texts.en: Mbaitswa is a 28-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the wholesale business for seven years, having started with 200,000 UGX and now having 4,000,000 UGX. His hardship is customers not paying on time.  Mbaitswa's  business goal is to make more profit. He wants money to buy paraffin, soap, match boxes and packed water to sell.

loans.use: to buy paraffin, soap, match boxes and water to sell.

loans.name: Gulzad

texts.ru:
Гульзад 46 лет, воспитывает 6 детей, младшей из которых 6 лет. Гульзад  работает в библиотеке и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На данный момент в хозяйстве Гульзад  имеется  две коровы, сорок овец и одна лошадь.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзад обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Гульзад планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Gulzad is 46 years old. She is raising 6 children, the youngest of whom is 6 years of age. Gulzad works in a library, while raising livestock and crops as an additional source of income for her family. Her business, started with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS), currently earns around 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products.  Presently, Gulzad's herd has two cows, forty sheep, and one horse. In order to continue developing her business, Gulzad has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy more sheep. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expanding the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Duishekan

texts.ru:
Дуйшекан 57 лет, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Дуйшекан занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит от 10,000 до 60,000 сом (KGS) в квартал от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На данный момент в хозяйстве Дуйшекан  имеется  три коровы и четыре бычка.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дуйшекан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Дуйшекан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Duishekan is 57 years old; she has raised 4 children. As a source of income for her family, Duishekan raises livestock and crops. Her business, launched with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), presently earns from 10,000 to 60,000 som (KGS) per quarter from sales of milk and dairy products. Currently, Duishekan keeps three cows and four calves. 

In order to continue developing her business, Duishekan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further increasing the size of her herd and into constructing a large barn for the animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.ru: Тазагуль 64 года, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Тазагуль занимается разведением кур.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит от 3,000 до 5,000 сом (KGS) в квартал от продажи мясных продуктов и яиц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тазагуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных кур. Доходы Тазагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Tazagul is 64 years old, she had raised 4 children. As a source of income for her family, Tazagul raises chickens. Her business, started with an initial sum of 1,000 som (KGS), currently earns between 3,000 and 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of poultry meat and eggs. In order to continue developing her business, Tazagul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 12,000 som (KGS) to purhcase additional chickens. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.
