loans.use: to purchase hens

loans.name: Lideres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Lideres del Futuro” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran atención de un restaurant, preparación de almuerzos, venta de abarrotes en un almacén, confección de ropa para mascotas y servicios de manicure, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Puente Alto, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Nancy integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pié, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda. Viste una polera manga corta color sandía y una falda larga color blanco. Su cabello lo usa tomado, el cual es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa usada, desde hace 5 años.
Su mercadería está destinada a damas, varones, niños y también ropa de casa. Trabaja en un puesto que instala en la feria todos los días domingos de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 3ºº de la tarde, comenta que su clientela es fija.
Sus productos los compra por fardos en una distribuidora, los cuales revisa antes de vender si necesitasen algún arreglo o limpieza. De esta manera entregar un producto de calidad al cliente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para la temporada de invierno.
Una de las metas para su negocio es comprar un vehículo, que le permita trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con un triciclo de reparto.
Nancy vive junto a su marido, sus dos hijos de 23 y 16 años de edad, además de un primo. Uno de sus sueños en el ámbito personal era capacitarse en algún curso que le permitiera emprender un nuevo negocio, comenta que ya lo está concretando.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que el préstamo le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta de las reuniones impartidas, ya que comparte con un grupo unido, comprometido y solidario, situación que la motiva a asistir con entusiasmo a las reuniones. También ha podido incorporar estrategias de contabilidad en su negocio, aprendidas en las capacitaciones.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Lideres del Futuro” [Leaders of the Future]. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different areas. Among these are a restaurant, preparing lunches, selling groceries, making pet clothing, doing manicures, and more. All of them belong to the Puente Alto community, located in the city of  Santiago.

Nancy is a member of the communal bank. She is standing in the second row, second from the right, wearing a short sleeve shirt and a white skirt. Her hair is dark brown and pulled back. She is a merchant, specifically, she has sold used clothing for 5 years. Her merchandise is for women, men and children. She also sells bedclothing. She works at her locale in the market every day from 8 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. She says that she has regular customers. She buys her clothes in bundles from a distributor and checks them before selling them to see if they need repairs or cleaning. This way she delivers a quality product to the customer.  

With the loan, she will buy clothes for the winter season. One of her goals for her business is to buy a vehicle so she can transport her merchandise. Right now she only has a three wheeled delivery motorcycle. Nancy lives with her husband and her two children, aged 23 and 16, and a cousin. One of her dreams for herself is to take a training course that will allow her to open a new business. She says that she is already getting it all set up.  

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since the loan has allowed her to invest in her business. She also enjoys the trainings, since the group is close, committed and supportive. This makes her enthusiastic about attending the meetings. She has also been able to incorporate accounting strategies into her business, learned from the trainings.

Puente Alto is a community located in north Santiago, the capital of Chile. It started as a small rural town at the end of the 19th century. Due to its population growth, it is now one of the communities with the highest population in Chile, with more than 600 thousand residents. It is the gateway to one of the areas of the foothills in the greater metropolitan areas, known as the Cajón del Maipo. It has space for hiking, riding, and rafting, among other activities with lodging and restaurants.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 52 years old and married, and the couple has six children. Solomon is a teacher who has been teaching for the past 20 years. He faces the challenge of high prices.

The goal Solomon has for his family is education and he intends to use the loan to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 55, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Donato, and the couple have one child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating their business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her expand and continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to add to her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvira hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to afford to give her child a good and high quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rizaldo

texts.en:
Rizaldo is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with 2 children. 

Rizaldo has a shop that sells fish and other seafood such as seaweeds. He also uses his multicab for transporting his fish and other products. Rizaldo has had this business for 5 years. 

Rizaldo has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stock of fish, like milkfish, flying fish, tilapia, dalagang bukid (yellowtail) and sapsap (ponyfish), to sell.

Rizaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future,Rizaldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish, like milkfish, flying fish, tilapia, dalagang bukid (yellowtail) and sapsap (ponyfish), to sell.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
Irma tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada y su esposo trabaja en un taller de mecánica, tiene 5 hijos de 37, 31, 26, 19, 15 años de edad,  vive en La Ciudad de Tela Atlántida.
Doña Irma tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 15 años. Y lo inicio con sus propios fondos. Con la ayuda que sus hijos le hacen enviándole remesas del  extranjero ha podido salir adelante con su negocio. Ella vende productos como, refrescos, dulces, golosinas, galletas, etc. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y en algunas ocasiones también se dedica a vender comida para obtener otro ingreso  extra. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 8,000 lempiras para surtir de productos como,  refrescos, churros, galletas y dulces. Considera que este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar más sus ventas.
Su plan en el futuro es seguir trabajando y abastecerse de otros productos que no cuenta y poder ir a visitar a sus hijos a Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Irma is 54 years old.  She is married, and her husband works in a mechanics' workshop.  She has five children, aged 37,31, 26, 19 and 15 years old.  She lives in the city of Tela Atlántida.

Doña Irma has a business that is a small convenience store.  She has had this business for 15 years, and she started it with her own funds.  With the help of her children, who send her money from overseas, she has been able to move ahead in life with her business.  She sells products such as sodas, sweets, candy, cookies, etc.  She is a very hard-working woman, and on several occasions she also works selling food to obtain extra income.

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras to stock up on products, such as sodas, churros (similar to doughnuts), cookies, and sweets.  She believes that this loan will help her to increase her sales further.

Her plans for the future are to continue working and to stock up with other products that she doesn't have.  She also plans to be able to visit her children in the United States.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sodas, candy, cookies and sweets to stock up her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 33 years old and married with 2 children. He works with a farmers organization in Hoima as a coordinator. 

Moses faces the challenges of high commodity prices and transport costs. His family goal is to educate his children and renovate his residential house. 

Moses intends to use the loan facility to renovate his house.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Lea has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages. Lea has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, eggs, feminine napkins, shampoo, soap and beverages

loans.name: Abdoul Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou Karim s’active dans la vente de produits divers depuis 10 ans. Il part s’approvisionner dans un marché renommé connu pour la diversité de ses produits.
Abdou a 41 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 14 ans et le cadet 2 ans.
Il sollicite un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC  afin d’acheter des produits alimentaires comme le tamarin, l’huile de palme, le miel, et d’autres produits dont la vente est susceptibles de générer un profit. Et cela il le fait pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Et c’est dans ces mêmes soucis qu’il a comme projet futur, de construire un jour une maison pour y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Karim has been active selling a variety of products for ten years. He gets his supplies from a market renowned for the diversity of its products. Abdou is 41 years old, married, and the father of four children. The oldest child is 14 years old, and the youngest is 2. 

He is requesting a loan from the microfinance institution IMCEC to buy some grocery items, such as palm oil, honey, and other products likely to generate a profit from their sale. 

Abdou does all this to meet the day-to-day needs of his family. With these same concerns, his future plans include building a house one day to house his family.

loans.use: to buy various goods (palm oil, tamarind, honey...)

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
La Sra. Denis Daniel es casado y  vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Luque. El cuenta que tiene un negocio de venta y reparación de celulares se dedica a eso desde el 2008, donde gracias al buen servicio que le da a sus clientes ya tiene una clientela bien formada.
Denis se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas metas que desea poder cumplir. El se esfuerza al máximo para poder ir abriéndose camino en el comercio y de esa forma darle un buen futuro a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carcasas, accesorios, estuches, repuestos y demás artículos para venderlos en su negocio. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, y no la desaprovechará.
texts.en:
Denis Daniel is married and lives in his own home in the city of Luque. He has a business selling and repairing cell phones, and he’s been doing that since 2008. Thanks to the good service he provides his customers he already has a well established client base. 

Denis considers himself to be a very hardworking person with a lot of goals that he wants to achieve. He works very hard in order to be able to establish himself in the market and, that way, give his family a good future. 

He’s asking for a loan in order to buy covers, accessories, cases, parts, and other items to sell in his business. He is thankful for the help he’s gotten and he will not waste it.

loans.use: to buy covers, accessories, cases, parts, and other items.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with seven children.
 
Zenaida has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 21,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap & beverages.

Zenaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, cereals, shampoo, soap, junk food and beverages

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Vilma has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages. Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, shampoo, soap, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old married father of one child. For the past year and a half, he has been running an electronics retail business, selling and repairing used electronics, television and satellite parts. Ali developed his skills and experience mainly with the help of his family and brothers.

Seeking to expand his business, Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy more parts for his shop such as domestic power suppliers, satellite dishes, channel receivers, used televisions and additional electronic parts. Previously, Ali was lacking in business capital which hindered his growth and development.

loans.use: to buy more parts for his shop

loans.name: Le Modele De Dorneau Group

texts.fr:
Manigat  est le coordinateur de son groupe Le  Modele de Dorneau. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il n`est pas marie


Manigat a dirigé son commerce d'artisans pendant les dernières 3 années. Manigat  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l'achat et vente des artisanat

Manigat espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres demodele de dorneau  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmetiques.

Manigat  dit que son défi principal il n y a pas des acheteurs constants. ll dit que son rêve c'est d'avoir constuire une maison.
texts.en:
Manigat is the coordinator of his group Le  Modele de Dorneau. He lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare, and water is very limited. He is not married. Manigat has been running his handicrafts business for the last three years. He would like to use this loan to invest in the buying and selling of handicrafts. 

Manigat hopes that this loan will help him to obtain a larger business.

Some other members of Modele de Dorneau have need of a loan for such businesses as selling grocery items and cosmetics. 

Manigat says his main challenge is that there no regular customers. He says his dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts

loans.name: Clavelitos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELITOS” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de papa, venta de papas fritas, comerciante de bisutería, costura de deportivos, comidera.

La señora Justina, indica que hace seis meses que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeros. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de su hermana.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de verduras), misma que los adquirirá de las ferias de La Paz y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Clavelitos” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Juan Pablo. It is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors with Justina as the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are selling potatoes, selling French fries, selling jewelry, selling sports clothing, and an eatery. 

Justina has been a member of the communal bank in Pro Mujer for 6 months, joining via an invitation of the members. Currently she has a business selling food, and she's been doing that for some years. She learned this from her sister. 

The loan that she’s received is to increase her working capital (buy vegetables). She will buy those in the markets of La Paz and later prepare them to sell in her shop. This business helps her support her family since she is married and has 3 kids. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
Jose Abel, tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Choloma, Cortes.
Jose Abel, tiene un taller donde confecciona ropa interior para damas caballeros y niños, elabora todo tipo de ropa como blúmeres, bikinis, sostenes etc. este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años después de que trabajo y adquirió experiencia en una maquila, él decidió establecerlo junto con su esposa, ahora cuenta con 7 empleados que le ayudan a sacar la producción de las prendas. Mediante préstamos ha logrado crecer, tiene el equipo necesario. Actualmente solicita el cuarto préstamo con el cual va invertir en materia prima, como es la tela de licra que utiliza para la elaboración de ropa interior, con el propósito de cumplir con los compromisos y la demanda que tiene de sus productos.
Su meta es mantener siempre inventario de materia prima, para solventar la demanda e incrementar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose Abel is 29 years old.  He is married and has two children aged 8 and 6.  He lives in a village in Choloma, Cortes.

Jose Abel has a workshop where he sews underwear for women, men and children.  He makes all kinds of clothing, such as briefs, bikinis, bras, etc.  He has had this business for the last four years.  After he worked in a factory and acquired experience, he decided to establish it together with his wife.  He now has seven employees who help him with producing the items.  He has been able to grow by means of loans, and has the necessary equipment.

He is currently requesting a fourth loan, which he will invest in raw materials such as the Lycra fabric that he uses for making underwear, with the goal of meeting his orders and the demand that he has for his products.

His goal is to always keep an inventory of raw materials, so as to meet demand and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase Lycra fabric, which he uses for sewing underwear.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada está casada con el Sr. Hilario, quien es técnico agropecuario, tienen 2 hijas que están estudiando en el colegio. Ella, junto a su familia vivían en el chaco y ella solamente era ama casa, y ya que sus hijas querían estudiar, decidieron mudarse a Luque. Ada  estudió corte y confección pensando en montar para su taller en su propia casa, desde el año 1989.
Actualmente tiene un pequeño taller de confección y su sueño es que algún día pueda ampliar su taller y de esa forma también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de Telas, hilos, agujas, botones, etc., con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y confeccionando las prendas que recibe como pedidos. Ella se define como una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante e ir progresando.
texts.en:
Señora Ada is married to Señor Hilario, who is an agricultural technician. They have two daughters who are in school. She, along with her family, were living in the Chaco (a large, semi-arid plains region), and she worked only as a housewife. Since her daughters wanted to go to school, they decided to more to Luque. Ada has studied dressmaking, thinking of setting up a workshop in her own house, since 1989.

Now she has a little dressmaking workshop, and her dream is that someday she can enlarge her shop and in this way also be able to give work to other people.

She is applying for the loan in order to purchase fabrics, threads, needles, buttons, etc., with which she will be able to continue working and making the clothes that she has orders for. She defines herself as a person with a great will to advance and continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, needles, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 29-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been an accountant for three years and this has enabled him to live a comfortable life. His personal goal is upgrading in his studies as he targets to become a senior accountant. Peter wants money to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 40-year-old married woman with two children living in Hoima, Uganda. She has been selling home products for 10 months. Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and high taxes. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Eunice wants money to buy plates, flasks, dishes, cups and glasses to sell.

loans.use: to buy plates, flasks, dishes, cups and glasses to sell

loans.name: Hotlan

texts.en:
"Pak Hotlan": This how people in his neighborhood know him. He lives in a suburb outside Jakarta. Hotlan owns a shop that sells items from food and drinks to airtime. With this business, he calls himself an entrepreneur. He's married and has three children, aged 12, 16, and 19.

At this point, he wants to expand his business throughout the family and the neighborhood. That is why he decided to become an agent for Loket Ruma. He believes that by becoming a "payment point," he can generate money from this informal business. But the main reason he is joining this Ruma program is that the demand among people around him to have a payment point is very high. He sees that people need to have an easy way to pay their bills. He hopes that people will come to him (or, even, he will go door-to-door to the customers' houses) to pay monthly electricity bills or buy prepaid electricity vouchers. Another payment that people are seeking to make through him is for their landline phone bills. 

He is looking forward to starting this Loket Ruma service from his modest shop and seeing how it will work. This loan will serve as a damage deposit for an electronic data capture (EDC) device that as an agent, Pak Martin will use to enter payments and print receipts for customers.

loans.use: To pay a deposit on an electronic data capture device for a bill pay business

loans.name: Wilfram

texts.es: Wilfran de 39 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y su hijo de 6 meses. Él se dedica a ofrecer el servicios de lavado y secado de muebles, negocio que inició hace 3 años, cundo vivió en la ciudad de Bucaramanga, en el departamento de Santander del sur y le enseño un amigo que se dedicaba a esta misma actividad. Por eso una vez llegó a la ciudad de Cartagena emprendió su propia aventura de negocios con mucho éxito, porque con ello ha logrado generar ingresos para  avanzar en el bienestar de su familia  y ha logrado contratos en diversos establecimientos, colegios universidades y a domicilio. Su meta es continuar tecnificando sus procesos  y ampliar su cobertura de clientes, pues sueña con industrializarlo mas adelante. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, maquinarias y equipos, con los cuales logrará efectividad en su labor diaria y aumentar su base de clientes. Su mayor desafío es el deficiente capital de trabajo para lograr hacer las inversiones que requiere para su crecimiento.
texts.en: Wilfran, 39 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and 6 month old son. He provides a service washing and drying furniture. He began this business 3 years ago when he was living in the city of Bucaramanga, department of Santander in the south. A friend who worked in that business taught him. For that reason he came to Cartagenia, and he started his own business venture with a lot of success. With his business he has been able to generate income to further the wellbeing of his family, and he’s won contracts in different establishments, colleges, and homes. His dream is to keep upgrading his service and grow his client base since he dreams of industrializing later on. He’s now applied for a Kiva loan, financed through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he’ll buy machines and equipment. Those will make him more efficient in his daily work and increase his number of customers. His big challenge is lack of working capital to be able to make the investments he needs to grow.

loans.use: to buy machines and equipment.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio tiene 59 años es zapatero, está casado con la Sra. Mirtha, tienen una hija que está cursando el segundo año de medicina en la facultad.
Julio trabajó en la chacra con su padre, después de tener la mayoría de edad viajó a la Argentina en donde empezó a trabajar con su tío de quien aprendió el oficio, luego de varios años estando en el exterior volvió, con un poco de capital y habilitó su propia zapatería. Hoy en día trabaja con él, su sobrino a quien le enseña el oficio, lo cual le es de mucha ayuda.
Julio necesita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima, como ser cueros, debido a que posee pedido de varias botas por el invierno. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Señor Julio is 59 years old. He is a cobbler. He is married to Señora Mirtha. They have a daughter who is in her second year of medical school. Julio worked on the farm with his father. After becoming an adult, he traveled to Argentina, where he began to work with an uncle, from whom he learned this trade. After being out of the country for a number of years, he returned with a little capital and set up his own shoe shop. Now he works with his nephew, to whom he taught the trade and who is a great help to him.

Julio needs a loan to purchase basic materials such as leather, since he has orders for a number of boots for the winter. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy leather to make boots.

loans.name: Pesi

texts.en: Pesi is a 39-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail business for 10 years. She started her business with 2,000,000 shillings and now has 6,000,000 shillings. Her hardships are price fluctuation and inflation. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Pesi wants money to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Monaliza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soft drinks, shampoo, soap & beverages.

Monaliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Monaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cereals, shampoo, soap and beverages

loans.name: Izigirwa Group

texts.fr:
Esperance fait partie du groupe Izigirwa et elle habite à Gitega. Elle a  40 ans et est mariée à Simon, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, dont 4 étudient  à l’école primaire.

Elle  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, savon, sel,…) depuis 15 ans.

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de nouveaux produits  de sa boutique, pour gagner plus lors de la revente.

Les bénéfices du commerce  lui ont permis  d’acheter une parcelle et de construire une maison. Ils  assurent aussi la ration alimentaire de la famille et  les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Esperance is part of the group Izigirwa. She lives in Gitega, and she is 40 years old and married to Simon, a merchant. Together they have five children, of whom four are students in primary school. 

Esperance has had a store (rice, beans, soap, salt, …) for fifteen years. 

She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she will increase her capital and buy new products for her store in order to earn more upon reselling them. 

The profits from her business enabled her to buy a plot of land and build a house. Also, the profits ensure that the family's food intake and the children's schooling costs are covered.

loans.use: to buy new products for her shop

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jerlyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo & beverages.

Jerlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Jerlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, soap, junk foods, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widow with two children.
 
Nenita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. Aside from the sari-sari store, she sells cosmetics from AVON like body lotion and body powder. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, biscuits & beverages.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cereals, biscuits, junk foods, vinegar and breads

loans.name: Machacamarca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHACAMARCA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora María Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de carne, venta de medias, venta de papa y verduras, tejido de chompas, venta de productos varios, venta de refrescos.

La señora María,  indica que este es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, que inicio hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras), que comprara de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y los venderán en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Machacamarca” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Senkata. It is made up of 7 members and is led by a board of directed headed by Maria. The businesses that the members run are varied. Among them are meat sales, media sales, potato and vegetable sales, general products sales, and refreshment sales. 

Maria says that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer, and she was invited by an advisor. Right now she has a business selling food that she began some years back. 

The loan that she’s gotten is to increase her working capital (buy vegetables), and she will buy them in the markets in the city of El Alto. She will sell them at her stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has 4 children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training about health and loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Takku Liguey Dialègne Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Takku Liguey Dialègne" est un groupe de solidarité constitué par 5 femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier.Elles mènent un commerce de produits cosmétiques, de tissus, de chaussures et de produits de beauté divers.Elles ont ouvert depuis un an un compte à l'UIMCEC et y déposent leurs cotisations afin de constituer une épargne et accéder au crédit. Les revenus qu'elles tirent de ce commerce sont insuffisantes pour supporter leurs besoins du fait de la faiblesse de leur fonds de commerce, c'est pour augmenter ce fonds qu'elle sollicitent un pret de 250000f de l'UIMCEC afin d'acheter des produits cosmétiques et des tissus.Elles ambitionnent d'implanter une grande boutique au marché de leur localité.
texts.en:
The group "Takku Liguey Dialègne" is a solidarity group composed of five women who live in the same district. They run a business involving cosmetics, fabrics, shoes, and a variety of beauty products. 

A year ago, they opened an account at the microfinance institution U-IMCEC, and they place their deposits in it to build up savings and to access credit. 

The revenues they derive from this business are insufficient for meeting their needs due to their low business capital. To increase this capital, they are requesting a loan of 250,000 francs from U-IMCEC to buy cosmetics and fabrics. Their ambition is to establish a large shop at the market in their town.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and some fabrics

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es: Robinson se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, tal como lo piden sus clientes; el hace su preventa y viaja a un municipio fronterizo a comprarla, para luego distribuir los  pedidos que vende a crédito y muchas veces de contado. Además  de este negocio Robinson elabora pudines y congelados y los vende a sus clientes de las casas de eventos, con sus dos negocios, que funcionan  simultáneamente ha logrado el bienestar de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio en estructura y en mercado, pero su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo con el que cuenta, para atender a tan creciente demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen,  para elaborar pudines y congelados y también invertirá en mercancías variadas.  Con esta inversión logrará disminuir sus costos, en tanto comprará en mayor volumen,  con descuentos y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Robinson makes a living selling various goods, as required by his customers. He makes his pre-order and travels to a bordering town to buy the items, and then distribute the orders he sells on credit, and many times, in cash. Also, Robinson makes puddings and frozen desserts and sells them to his customers of event houses as part of his business. With these two businesses that compliment each other, he has achieved well-being for his family, comprised of his spouse and their two children.

His goal is to have his business grow in structure and in the market, but his greatest challenge is insufficient working capital that he can count on to serve such a growing demand. This is why he turns to Kiva loans, first financing, which the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo provides. With this loan, he will buy large volumes of wholesale raw materials to make puddings and frozen desserts and also to invest in different goods. With this investment, he will be able to lower his costs, as well as buy in greater volume to get discounts. This is exactly the success his Kiva credit will bring.

loans.use: to buy large volumes of wholesale raw materials, to make puddings and frozen desserts, and also to invest in different goods.

loans.name: Los Hijos De Dios Group

texts.es: La Sra. María de 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Tiene 7 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la compra – venta de artículos de segunda mano como refrigeradoras, lavadoras, cocinas, microondas, etc. tiene 15 años en este negocio el cual inicio con la idea de poder abrir un taller y así solventar sus gastos. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de agua y luz, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Su plan para el futuro es construir el segundo piso de su casa y seguir creciendo con su negocio. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. María pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Los Hijos de Dios”, el cual esta conformado por 8 personas y es su primera vez que lleva el cargo de presidenta.
texts.en: Señora Maria is 35 years old. She is married and has two children who are still dependents. She has been in EDAPROSPO for 7 years, and her business is buying and selling second-hand items such as refrigerators, washing machines, stoves, microwaves, etc. She has been in this business for 15 years. She began it with the idea of being able to open a workshop and thus pay her expenses. With her effort and work, she has succeeded in building her house. Now her income is destined to cover the water and electricity expenses, while her husband pays for food and the education of their children. Her plan for the future is to construct the second floor of their house and continue expanding her business. She will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her business. Maria belongs to the communal bank "Los Hijos de Dios" (The Sons of God), which consists of 8 people, and this is the first time that she has held the position of president.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas lives in Likoni, Kenya. He sells soft drinks in the area. The business has been in operation for four years. He is married and has one child. He learnt of Milango from his friends. Nicholas is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of soft drinks.

His ambition is to advance from selling soft drinks to being a distributor of soft drinks in the near future. The only challenges that Nicholas’ business faces are theft and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: To add stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is engaged in animal breeding. She breeds cows, pigs, hens, and turkeys in Sevkar village, Tavush region. From milk, Emma makes butter and cheese, which she sells directly from her house. Emma sells milk, meat, and eggs as well. All her neighbors know that Emma produces high quality agricultural produce, so she has many regular customers. 

Emma is 41 years old. She is married and has three children: two daughters and a son. Emma’s elder daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents; her younger daughter and the son attend a school. Emma’s husband fulfills private cargo transportation and helps Emma in her occupation as well. 

Thanks to the agricultural business, Emma provides for her family and she also was able to repair her house. 

This is Emma’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments. 

Now she is asking for a 350,000 AMD loan to buy some more pigs for her farm and also fodder for her farm animals.

loans.use: to buy some more pigs for her farm and also fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Merlyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages. Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, shampoo, soap and snacks

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 55-year-old married father of three children. For 18 years now, he has run his butcher shop with courtesy, professionalism and cleanliness, building a good reputation in his neighborhood.

Due to the increasing needs of his family, Mohamad wants to improve his business and is thus applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua. With the money, Mohamad will purchase more raw meat which will increase product availability at his shop. By generating more income, Mohamad will finally be able to assist his son in paying for his furniture as well as repay some of his debts.

loans.use: to purchase more raw meat which will increase product availability at his shop

loans.name: El Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El Renacer” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras, venta de quesos, amasandería, confección de ropa y preparación de comida rápida, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Erica presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en la segunda fila, ocupando el primer puesto de izquierda a derecha. Su cabello es largo, de color negro y está modelado hacia el lado. Además viste con ropa de color negro.
Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa, desde hace 11 años. Realiza costuras básicas como arreglos y confeccionando ropa de casa. Su horario es flexible, ya que varía de acuerdo a los pedidos que realicen sus clientes. Promociona sus servicios de boca en boca y también con un letrero que tiene puesto en la puerta exterior de su casa.
Actualmente cuenta con dos máquinas de coser, entre multipunto digital y una máquina semi industrial recta. 
Compra sus insumos directamente a los proveedores de materiales de costuras.
Con el crédito comprará una máquina de coser overlock.
Una de sus metas para su negocio, es instalar su taller de confección al lado de su casa, para esto debe invertir en infraestructura y compra de materiales de construcción.
Erica vive junto a su marido, sus dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad, además de su madre. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es realizar un curso de corte y confección, para perfeccionarse con su oficio, de esta manera entregar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio y proyectarse, además de la posibilidad de concretar sus metas.
Respecto al grupo del banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que entre los integrantes son muy unidos, comprometidos y consolidados, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando de las reuniones del Banco comunal.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
The community bank, “El Renacer” is made up of 17 entrepreneurs dedicated to various disciplines, including: vegetable sales, grocery sales, cheese sales, baking, sewing and garment making, fast food preparation, and other tasks. All the bank partners are from the community of San Bernardo, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Erica is the president of the group, and is the first person seated in the second row on the far left of the group photo. She has long, black hair tied to the side, and is dressed in black clothing. Erica has worked making clothing for 11 years, and she work on minor seams, repairs and hems, and also makes linens. She works on a flexible schedule, since her tasks vary depending upon customer orders. She spreads news of her business by word of mouth, and she also has a sign that she puts up in the door to her home.

Presently, Erica has two sewing machines to utilize for her business; one is a multipoint machine, and the other is a straight semi-industrial machine. She purchases her input materials directly from distributors, and with the support from this loan she plans to buy an overlock sewing machine. One of her goals for her business is to build a sewing shop onto the side of her house, and therefore she hopes to invest in building and construction materials.

Erica lives with her husband, mother, and her two children, ages 6 and 11. One of her personal dreams is to complete a cutting and preparation course to hone her skills as a seamstress and offer higher quality service to her clients.

Erica is very grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her, and with the support from this loan she will be able to invest in her business and continue developing her skills as she works toward her goals. 

With respect to her community bank group, Erica says that they are a tight knit, committed and participatory group, with all members actively involved in meetings and the events.

The city of San Bernardo is located 18 kilometers directly to the south of the central Plaza de Armas of Santiago, the capital of Chile. Santiago is known as the capital of folklore dancing, and every January the International Folklore Festival is held there. This event unites all the ethnic groups in the country, and other musical groups from all over South America travel to join in the festivities. The Traditional Artisan Fair is also held in Santiago, and showcases the crafts and talents of artists from Chile and many other neighboring countries. In April, the “Abril cuecas Mil” dance event takes place to celebrate the traditional Chilean dance, cueca.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, biscuits, powdered juice, feminine napkins and beverages.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, soap, snacks, beverages, etc.

loans.name: And Dioubo De Leona Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "And Diouba de Léona" se compose de 5 hommes, tous mariés.Afin de s'appuyer mutuellement dans leur commerce de céréales, ils se cotisent chaque semaine et constituent une épargne dans leur compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC. Ce qui leur permet d'accéder aux prêts de l'institution.Le commerce de produits céréaliers leur rapporte des revenus assez intéressants qui leur assure l'essentiel de leurs dépenses d'alimentation et d'entretien de leurs familles. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, ils sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des céréales qu'ils comptent stocker et revendre en période de forte demande.
texts.en:
The group "And Diouba de Léona" comprises five men, all married. For mutual support in their grains business, they pay themselves each week and are building up a savings account at the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. This enables them to have access to the institution's loans. 

Commerce in cereal products brings in the revenues sufficiently worthwhile to ensure they can cover their basic food costs to take care of their families. 

To bolster their business capital, they are requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy grains that they intend to store and then resell when the demand is strong.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for herself. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rose's future prospects by helping her to learn how to budget for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: MAHUCLO est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et qui fréquentent la même église. La représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)se nomme Clémence Sourou. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la dixième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Clémence Sourou est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Michel. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clémence Sourou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Clémence Sourou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Clémence Sourou vend de la bouillie accompagnée du gâteau et de façon secondaire des ustensiles de cuisine de manière ambulante depuis quinze ans. Clémence Sourou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Ce dixième prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les neuf prêts consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHUCLO is a group which consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same Church.  The group's representative (raising her hand in the photo) is named Clémence Sourou.  In order to increase its working capital, this group is requesting a tenth loan from ALIDé.

Clémence Sourou is 37 years old and married to a man named Michel. The couple has five children, all in school and all their dependents.  Clémence Sourou never attended school.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.  To meet her needs and those of her family, she has been selling some paste and cake, and additionally kitchen utensils, for the past fifteen years. Clémence Sourou buys her supplies at a market in Benin and works as an itinerant seller.

This tenth loan will allow the members of this group to increase their level of activity, customer base, and income. Their nine previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy maize, flour and groundnut oil.

loans.name: And Takku Liggey Tabangoye Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "AND TAKKU LIGGEY TABANGOYE" est composé de cinq femmes dont les trois sont mariées et les deux célibataires.Elles s'activent dans un commerce de produits divers ( tissus, articles de mercerie, sacs, chaussures...).Elles se réunissent chaque semaine pour collecter des cotisations qu'elles versent dans un compte d'épargne ouvert à l'UIMCEC. Ce commerce leur rapporte pas mal de revenus avec lesquels elles prennent en charge leurs propres besoins. Aujourd'hui, elles décident d'augmenter leur fonds de commerce et sollicite ainsi auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 250000f pour acheter des tissus, des chaussures et des sacs.Elles ambitionnnent de se lancer dans le commerce de produits agricoles.
texts.en:
The group "AND TAKKU LIGGEY TABANGOYE" comprises five women, of whom three are married and two are not. They are active in the commerce of various goods (cloth, sewing supplies, bags, shoes, …). They come together each week to collect payments that they deposit into a savings account opened at the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. 

This business brings in a fair amount of revenues which the group members use to support themselves. Today, they decided to increase their business capital and are thus requesting a loan from U-IMCEC for the amount of 250,000 francs to buy some cloth, shoes, and bags. The group members have the ambition to get started in the commerce of farm products.

loans.use: to buy cloth, shoes, and bags

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Laarni has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. In addition to that she also has a sari-sari store that sells canned goods, beverages, shampoo and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to increase her stock of ukay-ukay or used clothing, such as pants, short pants, dresses,T-shirts and jackets, as well as curtains.

Laarni has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of used clothing or ukay-ukay to sell

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes for her food stall business. With the previous loan, she was able to purchase bundles of foodstuffs and sell groundnuts, which contributed to her other source of income. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes for her food stall business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Juliet has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. Aside from that she is also cooking viands like pinakbit, afritada, tinola and calderita. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap & beverages.
Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, cereals, biscuits, beverages, and snacks

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Lydia has a food/ retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, biscuits, shampoo & beverages.
Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Sena 1 Group

texts.fr: SENA 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier.la présidente,(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Edwige Lutiana. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Edwige Lutiana est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Taofic. Le couple  a deux enfants à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Edwige Lutiana vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Edwige Lutiana n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Edwige Lutiana vend de tissus depuis six ans par le système de distribution. Edwige Lutiana s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à  Edwige Lutiana et à son groupe SENA 1 de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"SENA 1" is a group composed of three persons whose members are friends residing in the same district. The president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is Edwige Lutiana. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members are requesting a loan from the third time from ALIDé. 

Edwige Lutiana is 39 years old and married to a mechanic by the name of Taofic. They have two children to support. Both of the children are in school. She lives together with her children and husband and ensures along with her husband that household expenses are covered. 

To support herself and her children, Edwige Lutiana has been selling cloth for six years via the distribution system. She gets her supplies  from a city in Benin. This loan will surely enable her and her group "SENA 1" to boost their business and increase their customer base and their revenues. 

The loans previously received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en: Bayaraa is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in Selenge province in Northern Mongolia. Her children study at the local secondary school. She started a garment retails business in 2011 with her husband. She brings the inventory to the border cities and trades them wholesale. The business has been successful and has many regular customers. She is planning to develop further their business activities. Bayaraa is an ambitious woman who says "I'm planning to buy a car with my profits". She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy construction materials for her fence and house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her fence and house

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past seven years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. Dorcas has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, cereals and beverages. Dorcas has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dorcas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, cereals, biscuits, shampoo, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Mariam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and pay for the children's medical expenses. In the future, Mariam hopes that she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house on it. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mariam's future prospects by helping her to learn how to budget for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en: Yanjmaa is a 60-year-old widowed woman who lives with her 8 children in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her children live independently. She moved to the city after she worked as a P.E teacher. Then she started a garment retails business in 2003 with her son. Her son purchases the garments wholesale from China. She stays at the shop counter. The business has been successful because they rent a counter at the biggest trade center at the district. Yanjmaa is a diligent woman who has been trying her best to improve the livelihood and feed the children. She says that "I would like to expand put business activity by purchasing the products wholesale at good prices. I have a plan to save for my son's future". The total amount she is requesting is 1,800,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments

loans.name: Geghetsik

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Geghetsik is an English teacher at a school. Geghetsik is divorced and she lives in Ijevan. Simultaneously with her work at school, she teaches English at her home to college entrants. She has adapted her flat’s room to a classroom, where she conducts her lessons. 

Geghetsik rents a computer and a printer for her lessons, so she is asking for a 600,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a computer and printer for her lessons. She will spend part of her loan to buy a table and four chairs as well. A new table and chairs will allow Geghetsik to make her room more suitable for her lessons.

loans.use: To buy a computer, printer, a table and four chairs for her English lessons.

loans.name: Barcelona Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARCELONA” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Carmen Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de gorros para bebe, venta de comida, venta de golosinas, tienda de barrio, venta de cereales.

La señora Carmen Rosa, indica que es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una vecina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a máquina que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su cuñada.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su capital, (compra de lana y arreglo de máquina), mismo que comprará de la feria paceña y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The communal bank "BARCELONA" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office. It is composed of six members and is directed by a governing board led by Carmen Rosa. There are several businesses that the members of the communal bank are undertaking, including a neighborhood store and the sale of baby hats, food, sweets, and grains.

Carmen Rosa says that it is the first time that she is part of a communal bank with Pro Mujer, becoming a member after being invited by a neighbor. She currently has a machine textile business which she has been working on for years, a trade which she learned from her brother-in-law.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital to purchase wool and repair machinery, which she will buy from the market in La Paz and later sell in her retail space. This business helps her to support her family since she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the healthcare aspect.

loans.use: to buy wool and repair machinery

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr: Mary est une femme qui vit dans la famille de sa petite soeur. Elle n'a pas d'enfants et a perdu son mari depuis plusieurs années.Aujourd'hui, elle  consacre l'essentiel de son temps à l'entretien des enfants de sa soeur.Elle tient dans la maison une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires, ouverte sur la principale route qui longe la ville. Cette boutique lui rapporte des revenus assez importants qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi et surtout à s'occuper de l'habillement et des frais  de scolarité des enfants de sa soeur. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
Mary lives with her younger sister's family.  She lost her husband several years ago and has no children.  Today she devotes most of her time to the care of her sister's children.

In the house, she has a shop which opens onto the town's main road, and where she sells food supplies.  The shop brings rather good earnings which enable her to provide for herself, but also and most importantly, allow her to take care of the clothing needs and school fees of her sister's children.

In order to strengthen her business, Mary is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for the purchase of food supplies.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Balla est un jeune marié, père d'un enfant. Il exerce un commerce de téléphones portables et d'accessoires . Cette activité lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille et de constituer une petite épargne dans son compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC. Son ambition est d'élargir rapidement ses activités et de construire un magasin de vente de téléphones et d'appareils électroniques. C'est pourquoi, il sollicite en ce moment un pret de 200000f pour acheter un lot d'appareils téléphoniques et leurs accessoires.
texts.en: Balla is a young man who is married and the father of one child.  He sells mobile phones and accessories.  This business allows him to support his family and to build some savings in the account he opened with UIMCEC.  His ambition is to rapidly expand his business and to build a shop where he could sell telephones and electronic devices.  This is why he is now requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy several telephones and their accessories.

loans.use: to buy several telephones and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Daveiva

texts.es: Daveiva es una mujer casada, que tiene 3 hijos y vive en el Municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno en el departamento de Bolívar. Ella  se dedica a la venta de mercancías; productos de belleza, artículos para el hogar, ropa y también es manicurista, actividad que realiza a domicilio.  Daveiva reconoce que los financiamientos han ayudado mucho al buen desempeño de sus negocios, pues ha estado durante dos años vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización en la que ha recibido 2 financiamientos, los cuales ha pagado con mucha responsabilidad.  Con su trabajo y este apoyo ha logrado cambiar de vivir en arriendo, a tener su propia vivienda, eso si apoyándose  muy en  los ingresos de su esposo,  el cual trabaja independiente en construcciones y desarrolla también otras tareas. La mayor parte de sus clientes son empleados de empresas, a quien ella les presta el servicio de mejoramiento de imagen a domicilio los fines de semana y los asesora a cerca de las diversas líneas de belleza que posteriormente ella les vende. Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancías variadas e invertirá  en nuevas líneas  como son los productos de aseo, debido a que vive en una zona donde no hay tiendas y quiere incursionar con Jabones desinfectantes,  papel higienico y otros productos de aseo y seguir con su venta de  mercancías como ropa electrodomésticos menores entre otros. Su credikiva tendrá éxito por que Daveiva conoce perfectamente el mercado, tiene experiencia e incursionará en productos que tienen una demanda insatisfecha y de allí se desarrolla esta estartégia.
texts.en: Daveiva is married with three children and lives in the municipality of San Juan Nepomuceno in the Bolivar department. She sells goods such as beauty products, household goods and clothing, and also performs in-home manicures. Daveiva acknowledges that loans have really helped the performance of her businesses, since she has been involved with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for two years and has received two loans from them, which she has repaid very responsibly. With her work and this support, she has been able to go from renting to owning her own home, also relying on the income of her husband, who works independently in construction and other areas. The majority of her customers are company employees to whom she provides in-home beauty services on the weekends and whom she advises on various lines of beauty products which she later sells to them. Her Credikiva is the third loan that she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy varied merchandise and invest in new lines such as toiletries since she lives in an area where there are no shops and she wants to venture into disinfecting soaps, toilet paper and other toiletries and continue selling goods such as clothing and small appliances, among others. Her Credikiva will be successful because Daveiva is perfectly familiar with the market, she has experience and she will deal in products that have an unmet demand. This is what her strategy is based upon.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise and invest in new product lines like toiletries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Srta. Elizabeth, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera vive con su madre, la Sra. Eudelina y dos hermanas menores en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
La Srta. Elizabeth  es una joven emprendedora, desde muy temprana edad  empezó a trabajar con su madre en un pequeño copetín que tienen cerca, ya que es la hija mayor, tenía que colaborar con la manutención de la casa junto a su madre que es soltera, con mucho esfuerzo estudió peluquería y manicura donde obtuvo las mejores notas. Realiza sus servicios  a domicilio, ofreciendo a sus clientes comodidad profesionalismo y buen precio. Comenta que le va muy con su clientela ya formada porque todas son personas muy ocupadas y que no tienen tiempo de esperar horas en los salones de belleza.
Ella solicita un préstamo, el cual quiere poder invertir en la compra de  un secador profesional de pelos y también una planchita, lo cual le ayudara muchísimo en su trabajo. Está muy agradecida por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 26, single and lives with her mother, Eudelina, and two younger sisters in Coronel Oviedo. Elizabeth is a young entrepreneur who started working at a very young age with her mother in a small cafeteria they have nearby. Since she is the oldest sister, she had to help with the upkeep of the house along with her mother, who is single. With a lot of effort, she studied hairdressing and manicure and received the best grades. She performs her services in-home, offering her customers comfort and professionalism at a good price. She reports that it is going well with her established clientele because they are all very busy people who don't have time to wait for hours in beauty salons.

She is requesting a loan, which she wants to invest in buying a professional hair dryer and a hair straightener, which will help her a lot in her work. She very much appreciates the assistance that she is receiving, since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a hair straightener

loans.name: Clemencia Doralisa

texts.es:
Clemencia es una mujer muy dedicada y amorosa, es madre de 3 hijos los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho amor y esfuerzo ya que el padre de sus hijos se separo de ella; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por ser visitada por infinidad de turistas que desean conocer “La laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo es una ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de esparrago, algodón y uva. Cuando Clemencia tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión en especial sus novelas favoritas, asimismo le gusta preparar uno de los platillos que más le gustan el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Clemencia solo tuvo estudios secundario debido a que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar ´para ser profesora.

Día a Día Clemencia abre su negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos y cervezas, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día  y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda una buena atención a sus clientes.

Clemencia esta  muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ala ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora y realizar el pintado de la fachada de su negocio, el cual se ubica en su vivienda, esta mejora le permitirá vender sus bebidas heladas ya que los clientes en esta época consumen las bebidas de esa manera, asimismo al pintar la fachada su negocio se podrá apreciar de mejor manera y los clientes se sentirán mas cómodos, asi mejoraran sus ingresos y podra seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una mejor Calidad de Vida”.
texts.en:
Clemencia is a dedicated and loving woman. She is the mother of three children whom has helped get ahead in life through much care and effort since the father of the children separated from her. Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its year-round warm climate, as well as for being visited by infinite numbers of tourists who want to get to know "the lake of Huacachina." The city is also known for its agriculture, in particular its cultivation of asparagus, cotton, and grapes. When Clemencia has free time she likes to watch television, especially her favorite telenovelas. She also likes to prepare one of her favorite dishes--her favorite is the delicious "Rice with Duck." Clemencia could only study through high school because her parents lacked economic resources, but she would very much have liked to study to be a teacher.

Clemencia starts the day by opening up her business. She sells drinks such as sodas, soft drinks, and beer. She works around 12 hours a day and can attend to up to 30 clients in a day. She thinks that her business is successful because she provides her clients with good service.

Clemencia is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy a freezer and to finish painting the facade of her business, which is located in her home. This improvement will permit her to sell frozen drinks, since during this season that is how clients prefer their drinks. Just so, painting the front of her business will make it look much better and clients will feel more comfortable. This way, her income will improve and she will be able to continue fighting to realizer her greatest dream: "to have a better quality of life."

loans.use: to buy a freezer and paint the facade of her business

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат 62 года рождения,вдова.Она очень трудолюбивая,ответственная женщина. С 1994 года занимается откормом скота,а также,имеет 2 га земли,где она выращивает сельхозпродукции(рис и кукуруза на корм),летом она отправляет скот на пастбище. По бизнесу ей помогают ее сыновья и невестки. Они в мести дружно работают и помогают друг-другу.Мухаббат с 2011 года кредитуется в нашей организации,также имеет хорошую кредитную историю.С целью расширения бизнеса Мухаббат хочет получить 5000 сомони и закупить 2 голов скота.Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat was born in 1962 and is a widow.  She is a very hardworking and responsible woman.  She has been fattening livestock since 1994 and also has two hectares of land on which she cultivates agricultural crops (rice and corn for animal feed).  In the summer, she sends her livestock to pastures.  Her sons and daughters-in-law help her with her business.  They work well together and help each other.  

Muhabbat has been a client of our organization since 2011 and she has a good credit history.  In order to expand her business, she would like to receive 5,000 somoni for the purchase of two head of cattle.  She is looking forward to your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a 42-year-old married father of five children. Jaber’s utmost concern is providing an adequate living for his family.
