Despite his harsh circumstances, he succeeded in creating a freelance business where he retails and carries out house painting. Jaber’s reputation is sound because of his proficiency, neatness and fine finishing.

Due to his experience in the field, Jaber knows that the demand for his service will rise in the summer season. In preparation for this foreseen busy period, he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary painting supplies, from colors to brushes, rollers, tools, and wallpaper.

loans.use: to buy the necessary painting supplies, from colors to brushes, rollers, tools, and wallpaper.

loans.name: Munishon

texts.ru: Мунисхон 56 лет, добросовестная, умная и ответственная женщина,замужем,имеет троих детей.Уже 10 лет она занимается продажей продуктов питания на центральном рынке и у нее много постоянных клиентов. Мунисхон с 2010 года кредитуется в нашей организации,и ни разу не нарушала условия кредитования.А ее муж учитель,они в мести обеспечили и поставили детей на ноги.Мунисхон хочет получить кредит в размере 1000 сомони для расширения своего бизнеса и надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Munishon is 56 years old, she is an honest, smart and responsible woman. She is married and has three children. She has been in the business of selling food on the central market for ten years and she has many regular customers. Munishon has been taking loans at our our organization since 2010 and has not once broken the loan policy. Her husband is a teacher and together they have supported and raised their children. Munishon wants to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni to expand her business and hopes for your help.

loans.use: to buy food for sale.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has one child. 

Rosie has a shop that sells bananas, charcoal and Barbeque sticks. Aside from that, she also sells coconut wine and seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of bananas, peanuts, charcoal and Barbeque sticks.

Rosie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas, peanuts, charcoal and Barbeque sticks.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS AMIGAS” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Eleuteria es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de antenas, costura de deportivos, venta de mandiles y enaguas, tejido de mantas y macramé, costura de deportivos, cajera.

La señora Eleuteria, indica que  es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por voluntad propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chalecos, mantas y chompas que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería, (compra de lana), mismo que comprará de la feria paceña y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Arminda, ya que se fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS AMIGAS" is beginning its first loan cycle through Pro Mujer, which is run by the Villa Adela Social Center.  The group is comprised of seven members and its board of directors is led by Eleuteria who is the president.  The members are involved in different business activities, including antenna sales, sewing of sports clothing, sales of aprons and skirts, weaving of blankets and macramé, and cash register operator.

Eleuteria says this is the first time she has belonged to a Pro Mujer communal bank, and she decided to join on her own initiative.  Currently she has a business knitting vests, blankets and sweaters, which she has been involved in for several years.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her merchandise by buying yarn at the fair in La Paz.  Later she will sell the items ordered by her customers.  The business has helped her support her family, since she is single with two children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health and money saving areas.

One of the members, Arminda, is not pictured in the photograph because she had a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: To buy yarn.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
This is Sylvia, 48, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, in the Philippines. Her husband is Joel, a vendor, and the father of her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Sylvia operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it for a small profit. Her products are men's and women's clothes and other products of the sort. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Sylvia hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and draw her family closer to God. She faithfully meets with her fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Nelly has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, dried fish, biscuits and beverages.

Nelly has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, dried fish, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Unión Y Fuerza Group

texts.es: La Sra. Evangelina de 40 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Tiene 7 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como gaseosas, azúcar, detergentes, etc. tiene 5 años en este negocio y comenzó con la idea de obtener mejores ingresos para así poder cubrir sus necesidades. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de agua y luz, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un hospedaje en la ciudad de Cusco, ya que posee un terreno ahí. Evangelina usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, ya que en estas fechas sus ventas tienden a incrementarse. Ella pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Unión y Fuerza”, el cual está conformado por 8 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta recientemente.
texts.en:
Evangelina is 40 years old, has a common-law husband and two children who depend on her.  She has been with Edaprospo for seven years and earns a living selling groceries such as sodas, sugar, detergents, etc.  For five years she has been in this business which she started to increase her income to cover expenses.  With much effort and hard work she was able to build her house.

Currently, she uses her income to pay for water and electricity, while her husband covers food expenses.  Her goal for the future is to open a lodge in the city of Cusco where she has land.  Evangelina has used the loan to buy merchandise for her business, since this is the time when sales usually increase.  She belongs to the communal bank "Unión y Fuerza", which is comprised of eight people; and she was recently appointed president.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.

Marilyn sells rice cake to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients needed to make rice cake, such as sugar, flour, rice and cheese.

Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI for one year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed to make rice cake, such as sugar, flour, rice and cheese.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Adelaida has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages.

Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, cereals, biscuits, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly's group is comprised of  hard working women. Molly is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Molly has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Molly has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale and will help Molly to generate greater profits and take care of her family. Molly hopes that in the future she will be able to start a supermarket of her own. 

Molly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Molly's future prospects by helping her to manage to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La señora Purificación nació en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco - Perú, tiene de 56 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo uno de ellos vive con ella, su actividad principal es  la agricultura, ella cultiva y comercia diferentes productos como verduras, maíz, Repollo, coliflor, algunas legumbres y pastos para alimento de animales y también se dedica a la ganadería, con la crianza de animales menores tales como gallinas cuyes y cerdos. 
Este trabajo que ella realiza es realmente sacrificado puesto que requiere de muchos cuidados y atención, además significa una gran inversión de tiempo y dinero para poder ofertar  mejores productos cada vez y venderlos a precios competitivos en el mercado y así contar con mejores ingresos.
Para todo esto La señora Purificación necesita de un préstamo, justamente para invertir en alimento para su ganado para poder engordarlo y venderlo a un mejor precio en el mercado.

Purificación es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en el distrito de Huayllabamba y otros en el distrito de Yucay de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Mrs. Purificación was born in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco - Perú.  She is 56 years old, married and has seven children, of whom only one lives with her.  Her main business is farming.  She grows and sells different crops such as vegetables, corn, cabbage, cauliflower, pulses and fodder for animal feed.  She also breeds small animals, such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

The work she does is very hard since it requires much care and attention.  It also requires a great deal of time and money in order to be able to offer the best produce consistently and sell it at competitive market prices to earn more income.

Purificación is in need of a loan to buy animal feed so she can fatten her livestock and sell it at the best market price.

Purificación is a member of the communal bank "Virgen Natividad" and the group is comprised of 15 members who live in the districts of Huayllabamba and Yucay in the province of Urubamba.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
This is Joshua. He is 42 years old and married, with one child, aged eight months. 

In 1997, Joshua established his local food stuff business. He started this business because he needed a source of income, so that he would not continue to be dependent on his father for all his needs. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about LE 950,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Joshua requires a loan in order to increase his stock of palm oil, as this is the season that palm oil is bought at reduced rate from the farmers. 

In the future, Joshua plans to give his only daughter a good education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy palm oil for his business

loans.name: Berna's Group

texts.en:
Berna's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Berna is twenty-one years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Berna has been working hard to manage her restaurant that sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Berna has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food for the restaurateur, and will help Berna to generate greater profits and take care of her family. Berna hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house on it. 

Berna is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Berna's future prospects by helping her to manage and expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more food for the restaurateur.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 65 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Ella tiene un Copetín bien surtido, el que está ubicado en un buen lugar, lo que la ayuda a tener los medios necesarios para el día a día.
Maria comenta que se inicio con la venta de quiniela, y luego cambio de rubro, que hasta hoy le va muy bien. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esfuerza siempre para poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, bebidas, harinas, pollos y otros, con lo cual podrá estar surtida para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old and a single mother of two children.  She has a well-stocked snack bar that is in a good location and helps her make the daily income she needs.

Maria says she began selling lottery but then changed to her current business, which is going very well.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur who makes every effort to give her family the best she can.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, beverages, flour, chicken and other items to have enough inventory on hand to continue making the food she sells.

loans.use: To buy meat, beverges, flour, chicken and other items.

loans.name: Daisy Jepkosgei

texts.en:
Daisy is a 39-year-old woman. She is a married to an accountant and together they are blessed with four children, two sons and two daughters. 

Previously she was employed in a firm where she was getting her monthly salary, but then she decided to increase her income by engaging herself in a retail store activity. For the past three years to date, she has been selling clothes and handbags in Nairobi along a busy street. Her primary customers are ladies. 

She has taken out two previous loans and has been able to pay them back well. She is facing a business environment of insufficient funds to increase her stock and therefore she is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to buy fabric, handbags and ready-made clothes to sell, so that she can meet her customers' high demands. 

Daisy anticipates a profit, which she plans to use to pay for a permanent stall in the town. This will cut the monthly costs for rent in her current area of operation. She also plans to increase her stock turnover to over a million a month. Daisy is an aggresive, innovative and God fearing woman.

loans.use: To buy more fabric, handbags and ready-made clothes.

loans.name: El Pozo Group

texts.es:
El grupo El pozo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Yajahira del Carmen ha trabajado desde muy joven vendiendo de todo un poco con el fin de salir adelante. Actualmente tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita. Además comercializa los derivados del cerdo (nacatamales, moronga, chicharrones) y derivados del maíz (elote, atol, tamal, yoltamal…etc.)
Ella invertirá el crédito en productos para el negocio maíz, leña, cerdo, carne, plátano, pollo…etc. 
Las otras dos integrantes son Cruz Celina quien vende leña y hojas y María la cual desde hace 25 años elabora artesanías.
texts.en:
The group "El Pozo" is comprised of three working women, one of whom is Mrs. Yajahira del Carmen.  From a very young age she has worked selling just about anything in order to get ahead.  Currently she runs a popular restaurant that serves fried foods.  She also sells pork dishes (nacatamales, moronga, and chicharrones), as well as corn dishes (elote, atol, tamal, yoltamal, etc.).

She plans to use the loan to buy products for her business such as corn, fireword, pork, meat, bananas, chicken, etc.

The other two members are Cruz Celina, who sells firewood and leaves, and María, who has been making crafts for 25 years.

loans.use: To buy products for her business, especially corn, firewood, pork, meat, bananas, oil, etc.

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Marié à un enseignant, Abravi est maman de 02 enfants (26 et 06ans) dont 01 à l’école Elle est âgée de 42ans et vend des beignets à la devanture de la maison. Elle est aidée par 01 personne. Sa difficulté principale est le manque de farine de blé par moment. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter de la farine de blé, du sucre, de l’huile végétale. Elle voudrait stocker de la farine de blé pour éviter des pénuries de matières premières et assurer l’éducation du fils cadet. Elle a commencé en 2000.
texts.en: Abravi, who is married to a teacher, is mother to two children (of 26 and 6 years old), one of whom is at school. She is 42 years old and sells fritters in front of her house. She is helped by one person. Her main problem is the lack of flour at times. She is requesting this first loan to buy flour, sugar and vegetable oil. She would like to stock up on flour so that she can both avoid shortages of basic products and provide for her younger son's education. She began her activity in 2000.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and vegetable oil

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 59-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He has been involved in agriculture for more than 17 years. The income from his business helps him to support his family. He sells meat and milk products at the bazaar. 

Ashraf would like to make repairs on his house to enable him to improve his family's living conditions. Ashraf is requesting a 1000 AZN loan for this reason.

loans.use: To pay for house repairs.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, Tsuma has operated a food-vending business, selling foodstuffs retail to his neighbors and passersby. Tsuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 loan, Tsuma wants to purchase foodstuffs, including bundles of wheat flour and maize flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs, including bundles of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Dieynaba est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de trois enfants.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille, elle s'est lancés dans un commerce de poisson fumé et séché. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes côtières et revend son produits en gros dans les localités de l'intérieur du pays, où le produit est très rare. Elle parvient à obtenir des bénéfices assez importants et à constituer une épargne dans son compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC. afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 100000F pour acheter 200 kg de poisson fumé et séché.Son ambition est d'exporter le produit dans les pays limitrophes.
texts.en: Dieynaba is a married woman, who is mother to three children. In order to provide for her needs and to help her husband to cover the family's expenses, she launched herself into selling smoked and dried fish. She gets her supplies in the coastal towns and resells her products on a wholesale bases in inland towns, where they are very rare. She manages to make reasonably good money and has built up savings in her account with U-IMCEC. In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy 200kg of smoked and dried fish. Her ambition is to export her products to adjacent countries.

loans.use: to buy 200kg of smked and dried fish

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Zaina lives in a home that she rents, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses include rent and school fees.  

Zaina has had a retail business for the last 10 years. Zaina also generates additional income through frying cassava (source of tapioca). 

Zaina has applied for a loan of 1400000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She sells products on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

Zaina aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTOGBE 5 est composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline est mariée à un maçon  du nom de Joseph. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline vend depuis huit ans de l’akassa (pâte faite à base du maïs) et de façon secondaire de friperies à son domicile et de manière ambulante au Bénin. Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTOGBE 5, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The JESUTOGBE 5 group has eight members, who all live in the same area. The group representative, named Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline is 41 years old and lives in Bénin. Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline did not go to school. Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline is married to a mason called Joseph. They have six children, all in school and living at home.
In order to meet the family's various expenses, Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline has for the last eight years been selling "akassa" (a type of meal made of corn), and on a secondary level she has also been selling secondhand clothing - from her home and also on a mobile basis in Bénin. She buys her stock in a market in Bénin. In order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her sales and income, Adjosisi Sènami Rosaline - together with the other members of the JESUTOGBE 5 group - is seeking a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase corn and secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Dukorerehamwe Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Jean Damascène fait partie du groupe Dukorerehamwe zone 2. Il a 32 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 4 ans  à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarise. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Jean Damascène est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autre crédit pour accroitre ses activités. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Damascène voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Damascène is a member of the Dukorerehamwe zone 2 group. He is 32 years old, and married with 4 children aged from 4 to 8 years old - 2 of them are in school. He completed six years of primary education.
Jean Damascène is a rice farmer. This is his second successive loan with ACB.  He will use the proceeds of the loan to buy chemical fertiliser and to pay for manual labour. His strategy for growing his business is to seek further credit to expand his activities. In the coming years, Jean Damascène would like to become one of the best rice producers in the region. With his profits, he intends to pay his childrens' school fees.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto, Amivi est une dame de 31ans. Elle est mère de 02 enfants âgés respectivement de 08ans et 06ans tous à l’école. Elle est revendeuse de nourriture dans un marché de la ville de Lomé et est aidée par 02 personnes. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt de WAGES pour acheter des ingrédients nécessaires pour sa restauration ( riz, huile végétale, tubercule…) Elle veut accroitre son activité, ajouter à cette activité la vente de jus et d’eau glacée et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille. Elle a commencé en 2004.
texts.en: Amivi is a 31 year old lady, married to a motorcycle taxi rider. She is the mother of 2 children aged 8 and 6 years old - they are both in school. She is a food seller in one of the markets in Lomé, and is assisted by 2 people. She is seeking this first loan with WAGES in order to buy ingredients needed for her dishes (rice, vegetable oil, yams...) She wants to expand her business, adding the sale of chilled water and juice, and thus to improve her family's living standards. She started in 2004.

loans.use: to buy rice and yams for cooking.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina es una mujer de 43 años de edad, que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos; en el Caserío Nuevo Yapato que se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al Departamento de Piura ubicado a 3 horas del Departamento de Lambayeque

Celestina se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad; y a la venta de cerveza la cual se ubica en su propio domicilio donde tiene clientela conocida.

El préstamo que solicita es por el monto de 3,200 soles; que será utilizado  para invertir en la compra de un congelador; además productos de primera necesidad para surtir su bodega, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Celestina is a 43 year old woman. She lives with her husband and two children in the community of Nuevo Yapato, located in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura, 3 hours from the department of Lambayeque

Celestina sells basic necessity products and beer from her own home. She has regular customers.

The loan she is asking for is for the amount of 3,200 soles. She will use it to invest in buying a freezer and basic necessity products to stock her store. This investment will allow her to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and stock her store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 44 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos; en el Sector 15-8 Caserío CP-11 que se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al Departamento de Piura.

José se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno; además cría ovinos y aves de corral; para esto cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en sus actividades que realiza; esta actividad la desarrolla hace 07 años es por ello que cuenta con amplia experiencia en el manejo de sus negocios.

El préstamo que solicita es por el monto de 1.200 soles; que será utilizado para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de su ganado y mejoras en su corral.
texts.en:
José is a 44 year old man. He lives with his wife and two children in Sector 15-8 Caserío CP-11, located in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura.

José raises and sells cattle. He also raises sheep and poultry. To do this he has his wife's help in these activities. He has done this for 7 years and that is why he has a lot of experience managing his business. 

The loan he is asking for is for the amount of 1.200 soles. It will be used to buy balanced feed to fatten up his cattle and improve his pens.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up his cattle and to improve his pens for the animals.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Kossiwa est mère de 04 enfants dont 03 à l’école. Le premier a 11ans et le dernier 03ans. Pour assurer les charges du ménage, elle a commencé par vendre des sachets plastiques en 2007. Son activité se déroule de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits chez les grossistes de sachets plastiques à Lomé. Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES et ce montant lui servira à acheter des marchandises. Elle veut dans l’avenir devenir grossiste et favoriser l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: 41 years old, Kossiwa is a mother of 4 children, 3 of whom are at school. The eldest is 11 and the youngest 3 years old. In order to meet the family's living expenses, she began selling plastic sachets in 2007. She does this on a mobile basis. She buys the products at wholesalers of plastic bags in Lomé. This is her third successive loan with WAGES and the proceeds will allow her to buy supplies. In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler and to focus on the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase plastic sachets.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacazi, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ele. 
		
Saiu de Gaza Para o Distrito de Boane em Maputo a procura de emprego, trabalha como motorista na empresa Bananalandia há mais de 2 e tem um salário de 10.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, pedra, cimento, ferro e outros).  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e no futuro pretende comprar um mini bus para aumentar a sua renda, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jose was born in the District of Manjacazi, Province of Gaza, South of Mozambique, is married and the father of 4 children, all of whom attend School. He completed 7th grade and didn’t continue his education due to his parents’ lack of financial means. He lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother who lives with him.
	
He left Gaza for the District of Boane in Maputo looking for a job. He has worked as a driver at Bananalandia for over 2 years and has a salary of 10,500.00 meticals (MZN) which he uses for household expenses and some of which he saves in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks and he came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 25,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to buy construction materials for the construction work on his house (sand, stone, cement, iron and others).

He commits to duly paying off the loan and in future intends to buy a mini bus to increase his income, for which he expects to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: buy construction materials for his house (sand, stone, cement, iron and others).

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es una mujer de 43 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos; en el caserío Palominos que se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo grande que pertenece al Distrito de Piura que se encuentra ubicado a 3 horas del Distrito de Lambayeque. Su hija mayor es la que firma como aval en el presente crédito.

Hermelinda se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (ovino; porcino y aves de corral); los cuales a alcanzar peso y tamaño adecuado los comercializa en el mercado local; además recibe una pensión mensual por parte del padre de sus hijos

El préstamo que solicita es por el monto de 1.500 soles; que será utilizado para la compra de alimentos balanceados para su ganado.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a 43 year old woman. She lives with her four children in the community of Palominos, located in the district of Tambo Grande in the district of Piura, 3 hours from the district of Lambayeque. Her oldest daughter is co-signing this loan. 

Hermelinda raises small animals (sheep, pigs and poultry). When they reach the desired height and weight she sells them in the local market. She also receives a monthly support from the father of her children.  

The loan she is asking for is for the amount of 1,500 soles. She will use it to buy balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Kornelis

texts.en:
Kornelis is a 33-year-old man who is living in a remote place with his wife, Yosina, a 27-year-old lady and two children, Aldo, 5, and Ferdi, 3. 

Kornelis sells retail gasoline near the only market in his village. 

The gasoline business is the only income source for his family. Due to limited income generated from the business, sometimes Kornelis faces difficulty in meeting his family's daily needs. Moreover, the market is only operated once a week. This situation affects Kornelis’ income since he can get more money only on Thursday, the market day.

Therefore, Kornelis plans to run another business: selling cattle. He would like to buy cattle from a neighboring village. He is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to buy three cattle.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Myriam Plus Group

texts.en:
Maya is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Myriam Plus.” It is made up of 15 members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Maya is 49 years old. She is married and has five children between 11 and 18 years old. Three of them go to school.

Maya’s main business is selling slippers in the central market of Kinshasa. Since 2002, she has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to achieve her dream of one day opening a clothes shop. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently earns her $50 per week. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

She will diversify her business with her next loan by buying two bags of salted fish and reselling them at a profit.

loans.use: to diversify her business by buying two bags of salted fish and reselling them at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost on her business. With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She decided to access a loan because of the low interest rate. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is widowed with six children who all go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. For the past five years, she has run a business selling charcoal and she sells both retail and wholesale. Rose generates additional income by selling used clothing and she works seven days a week from home. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season, which hinders her customers. Rose lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills. 

Rose is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She aspires to grow her business so that she can become a wholesaler and she wants to educate her children through university.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She does not take acre of any additional family members. Dinah runs a business selling used clothing. She lives in a rented home and her family has electricity but no running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding her family. Dinah's greatest business challenges are defaulters and thieves.

Dinah is requesting a 100,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to purchase clothing to sell. In the future, she aspires to grow her business and import used clothes from Mombasa. She also wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as skirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Marian Alicia

texts.es:
Marian Alicia  tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos entre 22 y 9 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de La  Ceiba, Atlántida.
Doña Marian se dedica hace 15 años a la elaboración de medicinas caseras. Manifiesta que esta es una actividad que viene de tradición en su familia. Por eso tiene la habilidad y el conocimiento como hacer distintas medicinas como purgantes, medicina para los riñones, para la gastritis, y dolor en el vientre. Ella dice que sus clientes quedan satisfechos con el servicio que les da y por lo tanto la mayoría son clientes estables. También para tener otro ingreso extra vende pescado fresco.
Solicito un préstamo con ODEF de 15,000 lempiras para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las medicinas caseras y otra parte para comprar pescado para la venta.
Su meta es seguir elaborando sus medicinas y tener los materiales suficientes para seguir vendiendo.
texts.en:
Marian Alicia is 53 years old.  She is married, and has six children aged between 9 and 22.  She lives in the city of La Ceiba, in Atlántida.

Doña Marian has been working for the last 15 years preparing home remedies.  She explains that this is an activity that has been a tradition in her family.  For this reason, she has the skill and the knowledge of how to make various remedies such as purgatives, remedies for children, for gastritis, and for stomach-ache.  She says that her customers are satisfied with the service she provides, and so most of them are stable customers.  She also has additional income from selling fresh fish.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras from ODEF to purchase raw materials for making her home remedies.  The other part will be used to purchase fish for sale.

Her goal is to continue preparing her remedies and to have sufficient materials to be able to continue selling them.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making home remedies and the other part will be used for purchasing fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Charles. He is married and has four children, 18, 16, 13 and 9. He has two additional dependents who live with him: his spouse and aged mother.  

In 2001, Charles established his business where he sells rice, sugar, detergents, etc. He began his business because he wants to improve his standard of living and that is his only source of finance. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Charles has already received and successfully repaid a loan, and now he requires a new loan in order to buy rice, sugar, shopping plastic and detergent. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Charles plans to embark on an international trade, to put up another home, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, shopping plastic and detergent.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a resident of the Kitale area in Western Kenya, where he has been actively farming for over ten years. He produces eggs, vegetables, milk and fish, which are sold within the local markets. He is married and has a 1-year-old child.

Andrew has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He believes this will improve his farming income and enable him meet family basic needs with ease. He is focusing on having a dairy farm of at least three dairy cows.

He mentions animal diseases and poor market prices as the inherent challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun is 31 years old and is married with three dependent children. She lives with her husband and children in a village of the Mongkol Borey district, Banteay Meanchey province. To earn a living and support her family, Sinoun raises pig in her backyard while her husband is a paid construction worker. She has been in this business for two years and she has faced several years of financial challenge to support her family. 

Sinoun is requesting a 600,000 KHR loan with VisionFund to buy three piglets. She is the leader of a two-member loan group. Sinoun has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while her partner has just been with VisionFund this loan cycle. She has successfully repaid her previous VisionFund loans and they have helped her make her living better than before. Sinoun currently earns up to 5 USD daily to feed her family. She hopes her loan will enable her to improve her business and increase her income so she can build savings for her children.

loans.use: to buy three piglets

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a 31-year-old man who has no family. For the past ten years, he has been working as a mixed farmer, producing tomatoes, milk, and potatoes along with other products. Festus faces challenges such as pests, disease, the high cost of inputs, and poor produce prices. He likes Juhudi's efficient services.

Festus is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy irrigation pipes to set up an irrigation system in his farm. He hopes to double his vegetable production and start fruit farming as well.

loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married and has two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For the past 10 years, Faith has operated a coconut-selling business, selling from door-to-door, mostly to her neighbors. Her goal is to open a shop in the future, and she describes seasonality as her major challenge.

She intends to use the loan of KES 50,000 to expand her business by buying more coconuts to resell.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saad is a 35-year-old, married father of three children. Previously, he ran a grocery store. Five years ago, he started his own sanitary-installations business. With hard work, effort and perseverance, Saad has succeeded in developing his job skills and experience.

Saad is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a power generator necessary for his business. In the future, he also plans to modernize his equipment for greater efficiency at work. Saad is the only breadwinner in his family, and he is responsible for their needs and the household’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy a power generator necessary for his business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena, tiene 40 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos con edades entre 6 y 18 años de edad, vive en la Ceiba, Atlántida.
María Elena, tiene su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos como cremas, perfumes, joyas, desodorantes artículos para cocina, baño etc. de productos AVON y productos para la salud de productos Herbalife. Hace aproximadamente 5 años que lo estableció.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 8,000.00 para surtir el negocio de variedad de cosméticos como ser: cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, joyería, ropa, artículos para cocina y baño de productos Avon y Herbalife, sus ventas son por pedidos y entrega a domicilio. Ella quiere tener productos que ofrecer a los clientes e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Elena is 40 years old.  She is married wit three children aged between 6 and 18 years. She lives in La Ceiba, in Atlántida.

María Elena has her own business selling cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, jewelry, deodorants, items for the kitchen and bathroom, etc.  She sells products from Avon, and health products from Herbalife.  It's been approximately five years since she established her business.

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras to stock up her business with a variety of cosmetics such as creams, deodorants, perfumes, jewelry, clothing, and kitchen and bathroom items, with products from Avon and Herbalife.  Her sales are by order and she delivers to her customers' homes.  She wants to have products to offer to sale to her customers, and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products from Avon and products from Herbalife for sale.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a married man with ten children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Karisa has operated a cafe business for the past ten years, selling to town dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 25,000, he wants to purchase rice, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has three children. All her children go to school. Halima lives in a home that she rents, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.   

She has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT -SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.

She has been in this business for four years and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Halima sells her clothes door to door. She works seven days a week. 

Her business challenges include the rainy season and increasing prices of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations include getting a permanent business premise and also becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a single woman with one child who attends school. She operates a shop and sells products to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mishi lives in a rented house without electricity or running water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mishi is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale business.  in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 54-year-old, married father of six children. A professional blacksmith for 32 years, he has been running his own business for 10 years now, forging gates, fences and windows. 

In spite of starting with very little capital and facing many hardships, Abdel Rahman succeeded in penetrating his area’s market. He is driven by his love of the field as well as his inventiveness and honesty. He offers fair prices.

Abdel Rahman is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a new iron-cutter to support the development of his business. In the future, he plans to expand and move to a bigger shop to accommodate his increasing customers.

loans.use: to buy a new iron-cutter to support the development of his business.

loans.name: Norbert

texts.en:
Norbert is a married man with four children, one of whom attends school. 

Norbert has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Norbert faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of establishing a dressmaking school. 

With the KES 25,000 he is requesting, he wants to purchase embroidery materials and cloth.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials and cloth.

loans.name: Titomagba 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement TITOMAGBA 2 est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même village et qui exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Juliane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Juliane est âgée de 50 ans et vit au Benin. Juliane est une veuve ayant quatre enfants dont un seul est à sa charge et dont certains enfants sont scolarisés. Juliane vit seule avec son enfant à charge. Juliane supporte seule les divers besoins de son enfant. Pour assurer ses différents besoins, Juliane produit de l'huile de palme (à base de noix de palme) qu'elle vend dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Juliane produit également de la farine de manioc qu'elle vend dans sa région. Juliane exerce cette activité depuis vingt cinq ans environs. Juliane s’approvisionne dans sa région. Juliane désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Juliane ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Juliane sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement TITOMAGBA 2.
texts.en:
The TITOMAGBA 2 group is made up of fifteen people who all live in the same village and who are involved in revenue-producing activities. The group's leader, Juliane, has her hand raised in the photo. Juliane is 50 years old and lives in Benin. She is a widow and has four children. Only one of the children is in her care, and some of them have been educated. Juliane lives with her dependent child, and she pays for the various needs of her child.

 To meet her expenses, Juliane makes palm oil (from palm nuts), which she sells locally. Alongside this activity, she makes cassava flour, which she also sells locally. Juliane has been doing this for around twenty-five years. She obtains her supplies in the local area. Juliane wants to sell her products to more customers, but she does not have enough financial resources to allow her to increase the level of her activity. For this reason, she is asking ALIDé for a loan, along with the other members of the TITOMAGBA 2 group.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and cassava.

loans.name: Cruz Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es una mujer de 37 años de edad; vive junto con su esposo y su menor hijo; en el Cruce Antigua Jaén – OLMOS; su esposo trabaja como profesor contratado y apoya en la canasta familiar.

Mariana se dedica al comercio de fruta y compra materiales reciclables con una experiencia de más de 7 años en el Caserío CRUCE JAEN NUEVO y alrededores; además viaja a la selva 2 a 3 veces al mes llevando fruta como SANDIA, CHIRIMOYA y MANGO en campaña.

El crédito que solicita es de 2.000 soles; que va  a ser destinado para la compra de fruta para llevar a la selva a nueva Cajamarca ya que tiene un mercado establecido en esa zona.

El cliente es recurrente en nuestra institución financiera; es puntual en sus pagos, es el sexto crédito que se le va a desembolsar.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 37 year old woman.  She lives with her husband and her minor son in Cruce Antigua Jaén – Olmos.  Her husband is a contracted teacher, and he supports the family’s basic needs.

Mariana sells fruit and she buys recyclable materials.  She has over seven years of experience in the rural community of Cruce Jaen Nuevo and the surrounding areas.  She also travels to the forest two or three times a month to take fruit like watermelon, custard apples, and mangos to sell.

The 2,000 soles loan that she is requesting is to buy fruit to take to the forest and to Nueva Cajamarca because she has an established market in this area.

She is a recurrent client of our financial institution, and she is punctual with her payments.  This is the sixth loan that she will receive.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 53 años de edad; vive con su esposo en la zona rural del Distrito de Morrope esta comunidad cuenta con un aproximado de 150 familias; tiene un hijo que ya es dependiente.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,adicionalmente a la crianza y comercialización de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, el negocio está situado en su domicilio.

El crédito que solicita es por 1.000 soles; que será para invertir en la compra de abarrotes y alimento balanceado para aves y/o aves menores para engorde.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 53 year old woman who lives with her husband in the rural zone of the Morrope district.  This community has approximately 150 families.  She has a son who also works in the store serving customers.

Rosa sells groceries and also raises and sells animals.  She’s been doing this for a year and learned this from her parents.  She runs the business out of her home.  

She’s asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN so that she can buy groceries, balanced feed, and/or small birds to fatten up.

loans.use: compra de mercaderia para incrementar su negocio

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS AMIGAS” iniciará su decimo tercer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de ropa, encuadernación, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de golosinas y otros, tejido de mantas, venta de comida.

La señora Martha,  indica que hace dos años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por voluntad propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su hijo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (compra de víveres), que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Las Amigas" communal bank will start its 13th loan cycle in Pro Mujer through the Los Andes regional office. It is composed of eight members and led by a board of directors headed by Martha. The businesses carried out by the members of the group are varied and include: sale of vegetables, clothing, baby clothing, candy and food, as well as textile weaving and book-binding.

Martha says that she has been a member of a communal bank in Pro Mujer for two years, and joined on her own initiative. Currently she has a neighborhood store business that she has been working in for some years, having learned this occupation from her son.
 
The loan she will now take out is to buy merchandise such as food supplies, that she will acquire in the city markets of El Alto, and subsequently sell in her store. This business helps her to support her family, as she is in a common-law relationship and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training in the area of health and credit.

loans.use: To buy food supplies.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married woman. She has 8 children between the ages of 2 and 22 years, all in school. She is married to Mwinyi, an electrician. Mesalim weaves mats to sell and also operates a food stall and sells her goods from home. She has been weaving for the last 20 years. She aspires to be selling her mats at the market, instead of selling them from home. Mesalim lives in her own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

With the loan of KES 70,000 to repair her house and to add stock of beans and rice to her food stall.

loans.use: to repair her house and to add stock of beans and rice to her food stall.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 59-year-old married father of one child. For 11 years now, he has been operating his van for school children and providing private transportation. Parents and passengers trust Samir for his attentiveness and cautious driving which has built his reputation in the area.

Samir is applying to a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua, to refurbish his van from bodywork to seats and parts; with the money left, he will buy some furniture for his house.

loans.use: to refurbish his van, from bodywork to seats and parts.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 37 year old man married with one child who is 14 years old. Robert is a mixed farmer and has been in farming for 15 years. He plants french beans, tomatoes, cabbages and sells them at the local market within his county. He also runs a grocery shop. His grocery retail business supplements his farming income.
 
Robert has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds to improve his standard of living and increase the family income. He intends to be the leading supplier for groceries in his district in five years time.
 
Some of the challenges he goes through are pests and diseases and crop failure. Robert likes Juhudi for it's efficiency in processing loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Marvin Alonso

texts.es: Marvin Alonso tiene 46 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de accesorios y repuesto de vehículo, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante pero también tiene el negocio en lugar estratégico donde lo visitan sus clientes. Este emprendedor está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos como forros de vehículo, asientos, manerales, entre otros productos que le demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marvin Alonso is 46 years old and sells vehicle accessories and spare parts. He carries out this work door-to-door, but also has a business in a strategic location that his customers visit.

This entrepreneur is applying for a loan in order to invest in the business by buying products such as vehicle seat covers, seats, spare tire covers, and other products his customers ask for.

loans.use: To buy vehicle seat covers, spare tire covers, seats and other products his customers ask for.

loans.name: Mereyda

texts.es:
Mereyda vive junto a su madre en C.P.M Corral  de Arena esta comunidad campesina cuenta con aproximadamente 70 casas; tiene 2 hijos los cuales están casados.

Mereyda se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado menor tales como ovejos y chanchos hace 10 años; cuenta con amplia experiencia en el negocio.

El crédito que solicita es por 1.500 soles; para capital de trabajo, ya que por las lluvias hay suficiente pasto y quiere comprar ganado chico para engordarlo y venderlo en un par de meses.

Esta clienta ya ha tenido 2 créditos los cuales están cancelados puntualmente, el último crédito fue Kiva.
texts.en:
Mereyda lives with her mother in C.P.M Corral de Arena.  This rural community has approximately 70 homes in it.  She has two children, both married. 
 
Mereyda has been raising and selling small livestock, such as sheep and pigs for the past ten years.  She has lots of experience in this business. 

This loan for 1,500 PEN is so that she can have some working capital, since there is plenty of grass after the rains and she wants to buy small livestock to fatten up and resell in a couple of months. 

She has already had two previous loans, which she repaid on time.  Her most recent loan was through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who has four children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She operates a café, which is situated at her place of residence. She has been in this business for the last four years, and aims at opening a hotel in the future. Mariam joined Yehu to access loans and her other source of income is her husband’s earnings.

Mariam owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. She intends to use her loan of KES 50,000 to purchase utensils and cooking fat. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and cooking fat.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos que es su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para realizar la siembra de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores productos y de buena calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, además tener a corto plazo una buena producción. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 46, and married. He lives with his wife and children, who are his highest priority. With his loan he intends to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor for planting coffee. This way he will be certain to do a proper job. 

What he wants is to be able to buy better, good quality products, so that his plantation will be healthy and develop properly, and also have good production in the short term.

This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He had not had loans from regular banks before, but Fudecosur has offered the loan with better terms and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: To grow coffee.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 29 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos. Estudio la carrera técnica de ingeniería de sistemas, la cual le ha servido para buscar trabajo en una empresa reconocida. Con los deseos de seguir superándose decide estudiar su segunda carrera, cursando el primer ciclo de la carrera de administración de Negocios, decidió estudiar dicha carrera porque es su vocación, ya que le parece interesante e importante, también   sabe que de esta manera tendrá mejores oportunidades de empleo. El crédito que solicito lo invertirá en sus pagos de pensiones. Su mayor deseo es de culminar satisfactoriamente su carrera, y posteriormente emprender su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29, and lives with his partner and his two children. He studied for a degree in systems engineering technology, which has been useful to him in seeking work in a well-known company.

Wishing to continue improving himself, he has decided to study for a second degree, and is in the first year of a business administration program. He decided to study this field, because it is his calling, and seems interesting and important. Also, he knows that in this way he will have better work opportunities.

He will use the loan he applied for to pay for room and board. His greatest desire is to finish his degree satisfactorily and subsequently launch his own business.

loans.use: To pay for room and board.

loans.name: Richar Williams

texts.es:
Richard Williams, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la zona de Raúl Porras Barrenechea en el distrito de Carabayllo. Él se dedica a sus estudios de Ingeniería de Sistemas en la Universidada César Vallejo,son sus padres quienes lo apoyan económicamente para el pago de sus materiales y pensiones y ellos son también su mayor motivación para sobresalir y salir adelante teniendo una profesión con la cual mas adelante podrá apoyar económicamente a sus padres.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en el pago de sus mensualidades ya que al hacer el pago completo del ciclo puede tener un pequeño descuento.
texts.en:
Richard Williams is 26, and lives in the Raúl Porras Barrenechea area of Carabayllo district. He is studying to be a systems engineer at César Vallejo University. 

His parents support him financially for the payment of his study materials and room and board. They are also his greatest motivation for excelling and succeeding, and having a profession through which he will be able to support his parents financially.

With the loan he has applied for he will pay his monthly fees, as by paying in full for the term, he can get a small discount.

loans.use: To pay monthly fees for his systems engineer degree program.

loans.name: Guadalberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Gualberto es de la ciudad de Concepción, está casado con la Sra. Crismilda, tienen dos hijas pequeñas, que aun no van a la escuela. El Sr. tiene una ferretería y adjunto a el una fábrica de piletas de granito, única en la ciudad, tiene muchos clientes locales, y de las ciudades aledañas.
El Sr. Guadalberto, es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo poder seguir creciendo. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que día a día se esfuerza al máximo para ser mejor.
El solicita el crédito a la fundación y a Kiva para la compra de una máquina para la fábrica de pileta ya que les hacía mucha falta para cubrir la demanda en el mercado. El agradece a Kiva y a la fundación por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Guadalberto is from the city of Concepción.  He is married to Crismilda, and they have two young daughters who do not go to school yet.

He has a hardware shop, and attached to the shop he has a factory that makes granite sinks.  It is the only one in the city, and has a lot of local customers and a lot from neighboring cities.

Guadalberto is a person with a lot of desire to get ahead, and through his work he is able to continue growing.  He is defined as a very hard-working and enterprising person.  Every day he puts forth maximum effort in order to improve.

He is requesting the loan from the Fundación and Kiva in order to buy a machine for the sink factory.  He really needs it to cover the demand in the market.

He is grateful to Kiva and the Fundación for the opportunity that he is getting.

loans.use: to buy a machine for the factory.

loans.name: Namunda

texts.en: Namunda is taking another loan of KES 50000 to expand her existing business. She plans to purchase utensils and cooking fat for the food stall. The previous loan improved her living standards and that of her family. The loan was able to increase profits to her business. She really thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman who has two children, aged 16 and 10 years, both enrolled in school. She is married to Omar, a business man. She is engaged in a business of selling firewood in her place of residence. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Mwanakombo aspires to have a charcoal depot in the future.

Mwanakombo's greatest monthly expense is school fees and food. Mwanakombo owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. She joined Yehu to access loans. With the KES 50,000, she plans to purchase stock of firewood to resell.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood for resell.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado es un hombre de 31 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en el caserío San Francisco de Senquelo, donde la gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de animales, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
La actividad a la que se dedica Amado es la crianza y comercio de ganado ovino y caprino, el cual es alimentado y engordado para luego ser comercializados en las principales zonas de Chiclayo y Piura. 
El monto del crédito es de 1500 nuevos soles, necesarios para la compra de más animales como pavos, cerdos y ganado ovino y caprino, para poder seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de los pobladores de su zona.
texts.en:
Amado, 42 years old, has a partner and 3 children in his care. He lives in the village of San Francisco de Senquelo, where the people farm and sell animals. It is located in the district of Olmos, which is in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Amado raises and sells sheep and goats, which are fed and fattened to then be sold in the main areas of Chiclayo and Piura.

The amount of the loan is 1500 nuevos soles. It is needed for the purchase of more animals such as turkeys, pigs, and sheep and goats, in order to be able to continue to satisfy the needs of the people of his area.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 48 years old. He lives in a small village of Kaspi District, East Georgia with his family: wife – Marine, 22 year old son and 21 year old daughter. Gocha works as a truck driver in the village. He is mainly busy with transportation of furniture and other loads. Marine and her son lead the agricultural business for the family. They have, in their village, an apple orchard. Marine sells harvested apples to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris.

Gocha requested credit for start-up of a pig farm. He will purchase piglets and place them in the old shed located in the family’s garden. In 6-7 months, Gocha will sell grown pigs and get profit. Also, part of the credit will be used for cultivation of a family owned plot of land, for sowing maize. The two new business initiatives will give additional income to the family. They will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and to rent a tractor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Nusura

texts.en:
Nusura is a married woman who has three children. Two of her children are enrolled in high school while the third is in primary school. For the last 10 years, Nusura has been operating a food stall, which is situated in her home. Her goal is to open a hotel in the future. 

Nusura owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. She describes seasonality as her major challenge, and school fees as her greatest monthly expense. With the loan of KES 45,000, she plans to start a new business of selling firewood.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling firewood.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 42 years old. She lives in Kaspi District with her husband, Vazha. Lali works as a nurse in the village. Along with her main job, she is actively involved in the family agricultural business, which is an important source of funding for the family. In particular the family has 3 milk cows. 

Lali produces cheese and sells it in the village, as well as at Tbilisi (capital city) open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. Lali has requested credit for purchasing piglets and feed for cows. She will feed the piglets during the next 5 months and sell grown pigs in the village in the summer. The family will get additional profit from these activities. They will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed for cows.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is widow and has two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Fatuma operates a food stall, which she has been doing for  four years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passersby. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase utensils, beans, and cooking oil.  She describes theft to be her major challenge and food to be her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Afuwa's Group

texts.en:
Afuwa's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Afuwa is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past two years, Afuwa has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Afuwa is requesting a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more braids for  hair.  This loan will help Afuwa to generate greater profits and take care of herself. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start a clothes business. 

Afuwa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Afuwa's future prospects by helping her to learning how to save her profits.

loans.use: to buy more braids.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 46 years old. She lives in Kaspi District with her family: husband,Zaur, and mother in law. Zaur works as shepherd in the village. Lali is leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have 2 milk cows. Lali produces cheese and sells it in the village to local dairy products retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 480 Laris. 

Lali requested credit for purchasing materials for expansion of the cattle-shed. After expansion she will be able to purchase additional cows and increase the amount of produced and sold cheese. This will increase the income of the family. They will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cattle-shed expansion.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman who has 7 children, all enrolled in school. She operates a green grocer and sells her goods at the market. Chari has been in the business for 4 years and aims at opening a shop. 

The KES 20,000 will be used to buy fruits and vegetables. She sells her goods to her neighbors. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She joined Yehu to access cheap loans. She describes her major challenge to be seasonality and she spends more on school fees and food during the month.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marekh

texts.en:
Marekh is 52 years old. She lives in Mtskheta District with her family: a 30 years old son and a 14 year old granddaughter. The granddaughter goes to school. The family earns a living through the dairy business. They have 4 milk cows and 7 calfs. Marekh produces cheese and sells, on average, 80 kg of this product locally to dairy products retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Marekh has requested credit for the start-up of a small pig farm. She will purchase piglets and raise them. In 8-9 months Marekh will already have piglets to sell. Also, a small part of the credit will be used to cultivate land for sowing alfalfa. The alfalfa will be used for feeding cows during fall and winter periods. Start-up of a new business initiative will bring additional income to the family. They will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and to rent a tractor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman who has 3 children, all in school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. She has been selling mats for the last 6 years at the market. 

Mwanaidi intends to use the KES 20000 to add stock of mats to her business. She sells her mats to people from outside the country. She plans to open a shop in the future, and her major challenge is seasonality. She spends more on school fees and food during the month. She joined Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to add stock of mats.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with five children between the ages of 32 and 40 years. She operates a kiosk and her primary customers are neighbors. She has been in the business for the last 15 years and she was previously a farmer. High transportation cost is her major challenge. Nzadze lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Nzadze intends to use the KES 30,000 to purchase omena (dried small fish), maize flour, and rice. She joined Yehu to get loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase omena (dried small fish), maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Pak Martin owns a shop in his neighborhood ("Pak" means something like "father" and is used to identify a person respectfully.). His shop is located on a strategic corner in the neighborhood, and is painted pink. His neighbors call his shop the pinky Shop.
