In this shop, he sells various everyday items and provides extraordinary services. The items he sells include food, drinks, mineral water, rice, instant noodles, stationery, and lamps and other electrical devices. Also--last but not least--he provides tire repair services. 

Pak Martin runs this business along with his wife. However, he will be the one who interacts more with the customers and makes sure they are happy with the services he provides. Pak Martin has three sons. The oldest is 24, the second one is 23, and the youngest one is 18 years old. 

For quite some time, Pak Martin has been very interested in becoming a Loket Ruma agent. The ones who encouraged him the most are actually all of his neighbors. The reason is that with a Loket Ruma business, he can actually provide more value-added services for his customers and generate more income for his family. His customers, who are mostly his neighbors, would come to his Warung Pinki and pay their bills. He hopes that most of the payments will be for electricity bills. This loan will serve as a damage deposit for the electronic data capture (EDC) device that as an agent, Pak Martin will use to enter payments and print receipts for customers.

loans.use: To pay a deposit on an electronic data capture device for his bill pay service business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Veronica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Verónica está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas son Verónica del Rosario, Claudia Vanessa y Katty de los Ángeles  quienes se dedican al comercio de artesanías desde hace varios años. 
La coordinadora del grupo es Verónica del Rosario la cual inicio hace 23 años a vender artesanías y poco a poco fue aumentándolo. Ella comercializa en uno de los mercados locales de Masaya e invertirá el crédito en jarrones de barro, jarrones de piso, azucareras, bolsos de cuero, cortinas de bambú…etc.
texts.en:
The Veronica Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women.  Their names are Verónica del Rosario, Claudia Vanessa, and Katty de los Ángeles, and they have been involved in the sale of arts and crafts for many years.

The coordinator of the group is Verónica del Rosario who began to sell craft items 23 years ago and has been growing her business little by little.  She vends in one of the local markets in Masaya and will invest her loan in pottery vases, urns, sugar bowls, leather bags, bamboo curtains, etc.

loans.use: to buy crafted items, especially pottery vases, floor-standing vases, sugar bowls, leather bags, bamboo curtains, etc.

loans.name: El Talisman Group

texts.es:
El  grupo el Talismán lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Tereza Yamileth quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años en uno de los supermercados más reconocido. Ella está casada con  el señor Norlan con el cual tiene 5 hijos.
Los otros Integrantes  son Carmen quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos y Kevin tiene dese hace 2 años una moto taxi en la que invertirá el crédito en mejoras a su vehículo.
texts.en:
The “Talismán” group is composed of three people.  One of them is Tereza Yamileth who sells fruit and vegetables, an activity she’s been carrying out for five years in one the best known supermarkets.  She’s married to Norlan and they have five children.  

The other members are Carmen, who sells cosmetics and Kevin who has had a mototaxi for two years and will invest the loan to service his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy perishables.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth nació en la provincia de Urubamba, tiene 25 años, soltera, ella se dedica desde hace algún tiempo a comprar y vender choclo, pero ahora Lizeth  trabaja como recepcionista en un hotel y desea adquirir un préstamo para que pueda comprarse una motocicleta para poder movilizarse hacia su centro de trabajo.

Lizeth desea mas adelante poder tener y operar su propia agencia de turismo y porque no, un pequeño hotel, ya que está reuniendo experiencia en este rubro, que al parecer lo disfruta mucho.
texts.en: Lizeth was born in Urubamba Province.  She’s 25 years old, single and has been working for some time as a choclo [dehydrated potato] merchant.  Now, however, she’s working as a receptionist in a hotel and she wants a loan to be able to buy a motorcycle to drive to work.  Lizeth would like later on to have and operate her own tourism agency and, why not, her own small hotel since she’s acquiring experience in that line of work which she seems to enjoy very much.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.es: Mildred de 50 años vive en Puerto Colombia, municipio turístico a orillas de mar Caribe, y tiene dos hijos en las edad de 25 y 26 años, quienes trabajan y responden a los gastos familiares. Mildred en su residencia tiene un pequeño almacén, en el cual vende artículos de miscelánea, como colonias, cosméticos, papelería, artículos escolares, ropa infantil y accesorios femeninos. Negocio que nació hace 3 años con una vitrina y pocos productos, gradualmente fue creciendo hasta lograr un mayor dinamismo en su clientela. En la actualidad planea surtir su negocio con productos de la temporada, pues se acerca el día de las madres y con ello el aumento de sus ventas, lo cual  Mildred necesita aprovechar, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para cumplir con su meta estratégica. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías, con las que  surtirá su miscelánea con calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior, papel de regalo etc. Su inversión será exitosa,  en tanto que la potencial demanda, la conducirá al incremento de sus ventas y con ella a la generación de un mayor ingreso para continuar fortaleciendo el capital de su miscelánea y esto la hace muy feliz.
texts.en:
Mildred, 50, lives in Puerto Colombia, a tourist city on the shores of the Caribbean Sea.  She has two children who are 25 and 26 years old who work and help out with family expenses.  

Mildred has a small store at home where she sells miscellaneous articles like cologne, cosmetics, paper goods, school supplies, children’s clothes and women’s accessories.  The business was born three years ago with just a display case and few items.  It gradually grew until it attained a more dynamic clientele.  

At present, she plans to stock her business with seasonal products because Mother’s Day is approaching and sales increase as a result and Mildred wants to take advantage of this.  However, her working capital is insufficient to reach this strategic goal which is why Mildred is calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy merchandise to stock her variety store with shoes, cosmetics, underwear, gift-wrap paper, etc.  

Her investment will be successful because potential demand will lead to increased sales and with them higher income to continue strengthening the variety store’s capital and this makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy merchandie to stock her store.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa es el grupo formado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias, ya que no quieren que sus familias pasen por las mismas necesidades por las que ellas pasaron. 
Elsa es parte del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la costura desde ya hace un tiempo, y que ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus prendas que confecciona y a la vez le dan mucho trabajo. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo su trabajo y así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
"Kuña Guapa" is a group that consists of ten women from the city of Villa Ygatimi. These women are the leaders of their households. They strive their hardest to help their families because they do not want them to lack the necessities that they had to forego.

Elsa is a member of the group and says that she has been a seamstress for quite some time. She has a good customers who always buy the garments she produces. They provide her with a great amount of work. Elsa is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, rubber, and other supplies so that she can continue her work and help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, rubber, and other supplies.

loans.name: Revelacion En Dios Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Revelación En Dios está conformado por ocho emprendedoras que se unieron y formaron este grupo, ellas ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en crédito y durante el crédito ha demostrado ser personas responsable y con deseos de superación, tiene objetivos y metas en la vida para crecer en su negocios. Diana Isabel es parte de este grupo y su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general, está solicitando financiamiento para comprar pantalones, camisas, blúmer, faldas entre otros productos.
texts.en: Revelación En Dios is a Communal Bank composed of eight entrepreneurs who have come together to form this group. They have already worked with Fundación León, receiving a loan, and they have proven themselves to be responsible people who want to improve in life, having aims and goals to make their activities grow. Diana Isabel is a member of this group, and her economic activity is selling products in general. She is requesting a loan to buy trousers, shirts, shorts and skirts among other products.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, shorts and skirts

loans.name: Victor Javier

texts.es:
Victor tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mala, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, así como también playas hermosas y la generosidad de su gente; Victor es padre de una pequeña de 6 años, debido a algunos problemas ajenos se separo de la madre de su hija pero ello no ha impedido que pueda verla y por ello trabaja muy duro para darle una buena calidad de vida. En ocasiones que dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio; también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Victor trabaja en su negocio de servicio de reparación de motos, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 4 clientes en el día ya que depende del tipo de reparación que realice; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es carismático y los clientes siempre lo buscan.

Victor agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar los repuestos que necesitan para la reparación de los vehículos, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija, así el podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio taller”.
texts.en:
Víctor, 37, lives in the city of Mala, a city noted for having a hot climate and for being very welcoming as well as for its beautiful beaches and for the kindness of its people.  

Víctor is the father of a little 6-year-old girl.  Due to some outside problems, he separated from his daughter’s mother but this hasn’t kept him from seeing her and this is why he works hard to give her a good quality of life.  Whenever he has any free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends in the neighborhood and he also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz con Pollo” [Chicken with Rice].

Víctor works repairing motorcycles.  He spends about 10 hours daily at work and can take care of up to four customers per day depending on the type of repairs he does.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s charismatic and customers always seek him out.

Víctor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy spare parts he needs to repair the vehicles.  In this way he will be able to improve his income and his and his daughter’s quality of life so that he can continue striving toward making his dream a reality: “To own his own repair shop.”

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Las Residentas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Residentas” es un comité de 10 mujeres, es un grupo unido, trabajador y lo más importante, son solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas. 
Lilian es parte del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de perfumes de todo tipo de marcas. Ella misma se define como una persona con muchas ansias de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella está solicitando la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de perfumes, con lo cual quiere cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Ellas están agradecidas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group known as "Las Residentas" is a committee that consists of 10 women. They are a close-knit and hardworking group, but most importantly, they are supportive of one another. These women are from the city of Villarrica. All of them are neighbors and friends.

Lilian is a member of this group. She says that she sells perfumes of all types and brands. Lilian defines herself as someone who is very eager to succeed so that she can help her family through her work. She is requesting assistance from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy perfumes so that she can fulfill her customers' orders.

These women are grateful to receive this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service the vehicles.

loans.name: Magníficas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAGNÍFICAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Fabiola es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de garrafas, confección de polleras, brostería, venta de salchipapas, tienda de barrio, venta de productos naturales.

La señora Fabiola, indica que  es hace cinco meses que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pollos a la brosther que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá y su tía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar de mercadería de su negocio (compra de arroz y papa), mismo que comprará de la feria paceña y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyarse ya que ella es soltera.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, ya que es gratuita, y el préstamo rápido.
texts.en:
The community association "Magníficas" is beginning its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Center Villa Tejada.  They are made up of six women and directed by their board, where Fabiola is the secretary.  The businesses which the group members are working to grow are quite varied and include: sales of bottles, sewing traditional dance costumes, running a fried chicken stall, selling sausage and potato snacks (salchipapas), a corner store, and sales of natural products and remedies.

Fabiola says it has been five months since she joined the community association at Pro Mujer, joining through an invitation from her friends.  She currently has a business selling fried chicken, which she's been doing for years, learning from her mother and her aunt.
 
The loan that she will receive is to enlarge her stock (to buy rice and potatoes), which she gets from the La Paz markets and then sells in her own business.  This business will help her to support herself, since she is single.
  
When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center because it's free and has quick service.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba, provincia de Urubamba en el departamento del Cusco - Perú, casada, con 56 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales dependen directamente de ella y de su trabajo. 
Su actividad principal es la compra y venta de granos de maíz para semilla, además comercia productos tales como zapallo, el cual adquiere en grandes cantidades y posteriormente lo vende en el mercado de Juliaca en el departamento de Puno - Perú, y es precisamente para comprar zapallo que la señora Carmen Rosa necesita de un préstamo, el cual le permita concretar su negocio, realizar la transacción y mejorar sus ingresos para invertirlo nuevamente en su actividad, darle crecimiento sostenible para el desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa was born in Huayllabamba District, Urubamba Province in Cusco Department, Perú.  She’s 56 years old, married and has six children three of which directly depend on her and her work.

Her main activity is buying and selling corn kernels for seed and she also sells products like pumpkins which she buys in great amounts and then sells them in the market in Juliaca in Puno Department, Perú.  It’s precisely to buy pumpkins that Carmen Rosa needs the loan for.  It will make it possible for her to make the deal, conclude the transaction and improve her income to reinvest in once more in her activity to create sustainable growth for her family’s development.

loans.use: to buy pumpkins.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 36 years old. She lives in a small village of Dusheti District with her family: her husband, Mamuka; her 9- and 13-year-old sons; and her in-laws. Maya works as a teacher in a local school and Mamuka works as a driver in a local company. Both of their children go to school. Along with their main jobs, Mamuka and Maya are actively involved in the family’s agricultural business. They run a dairy farm with five milk cows. Maya and her mother-in-law produce cheese and sell an average 100 kg of cheese to their loyal customers in Tbilisi. The family’s total average monthly income is 900 GEL. 

Maya is requesting a loan to purchase additional milk cows which will enable her to produce and sell 20% more cheese. Her loan will increase their income by 150 – 200 GEL. Maya plans to use this income to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. For the past ten yeras, she has operated a food stall business. Asha’s greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees and her greatest business challenge is seasonality. During the dry season, she experiences low customer turn-out. Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Asha is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge, es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es casado, pero aun no tiene la dicha de ser padre. Él se dedica al comercio, tiene una casa de ventas de Celulares, activaciones y carga de saldo electrónico. 
Jorge se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, él y su esposa trabajan arduamente para que de esa forma puedan ir progresando y de esa forma poder, algún día, cuando tengan hijos darles un buen futuro. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de saldo electrónico, ya que muchas veces se le agota y pierde clientes, ahora quiere estar bien surtido y de esa forma tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge is from the city of Encarnación. He is married, but he has yet to become a father. Jorge is a merchant who has a shop where he sells mobile phones and activates and recharges electronic phone credits. He defines himself as a hardworking person who wants to succeed. Jorge and his wife work hard so that they can make progress, be able to have children someday, and provide them with a good future.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy electronic phone credits since he frequently runs out and loses customers as a result. Now he wants to be well-stocked so that he can generate good earnings.

loans.use: to buy electronic phone credits to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra Juana tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, quienes son todos ya mayores e independientes.
La  Sra. Juana es costurera de profesión, aprendió esta profesión hace más de 40 años. Empezó trabajando como empleada de una tienda que se dedica a las confecciones, y con la ayuda de sus hijos le compraron para su propia maquina y pudo emprender dicha actividad hace más de 20 años.
Juana solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales, telas, botones gomas y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is 64 years old and she is a single mother of 3 children, all adults and economically independent.
Juana is a seamstress, a profession she learned more than 40 years ago beginning as an employee in a sewing workshop. Around 20 years ago, she was able to start her own activity, thanks to the helps of her children who bought her a sewing machine.
Juana is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cloths, buttons, elastics and other items she needs to continue her job and to meet her customers’ requests.

loans.use: To buy cloths, buttons, elastics.

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTIDAS” iniciará su sexto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Silveria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, venta de dulces, artesanía y costura, ferretería, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de ropa.

La señora Silveria,  indica que hace años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ferreteria que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumento de mercadería (compra de tornillos), que adquirirá de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.

En la Fotografía se encuentra Rene acompañando al grupo y remplazando su mamá, la señora María, que se encontraba en consultorio
texts.en:
The “Concentidas” (The Pampered Ones) communal bank will start its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 11 members led by a governing board headed by Silveria.  The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: sweater knitting, candy sales, crafts and sewing, hardware, food sales, blanket sales and clothing sales.

Silveria indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer communal associations for years having been invited to join by a girlfriend.  She currently has a hardware business that she’s been operating for years.

The loan she will take out is to increase merchandise.  She will buy screws in the city of Oruro and then sell them in her store.  This business helps her support her family since she’s married and has two children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training.

In the photo, René is with the group representing his mother, María, who was at the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy screws.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with ten children, all of whom attend school. For the past twenty years, she has operated a retail shop, selling goods to her neighbors and passersby. Mariam owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. Mariam decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mariam is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. In the future, she hopes to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Neo

texts.en:
Neo is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small market where she sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Neo is requesting a loan 600,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more food for resale. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and take care of her family. Neo hopes that in the future she will be able to start a salon of her own. 

Neo is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and is a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Neo's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food to resell

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Resty has been working hard to manage a small market where she sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Resty is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more food for resale. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for her younger siblings. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to start a shop of her own. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Resty’s future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 10 years, Fatuma has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. 

Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish another shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Luchadoras es del Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran  en el primer ciclo y comentan que se unieron ya que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y sus familias. 
La señora Evangelista vende carbón, y comenta que le va muy bien, ya que últimamente es muy utilizado por las personas, ya que es más económico. Tiene muy buena clientela y su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma darle lo que necesitan a su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más carbón, con lo que podrá estar bien abastecida para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee known as "Mujeres Luchadoras" is from Chaco. They are currently in their first loan cycle and say that they joined together because they saw this as a great opportunity to make progress for themselves and their families.

Sra. Evangelista sells charcoal and says that she has done very well. As of late, her product is used by many people since it is very affordable. Evangelista has a good customer base and her goal is to continue working so that she can provide what her family needs. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal so that she can provide enough inventory for her customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is 29 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.  For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. 

Kwekwe decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and hiring more employees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Saint Laurent Plus Group

texts.en:
Mawete is 53 years old and a widow with nine children. For the past 12 years, she has sold fruit in her local area located in the eastern part of Kinshasa. Mawete is the chairwoman of a community bank named "Mawete Plus," that is comprised of 16 members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their individual businesses. She has previously borrowed and repaid a loan from HOPE DRC to expand her business. Mawete’s business generates 35 USD weekly in profits and one of her strategies is to keep close relationships with her clients.  

Mawete is requesting a loan to buy two sacks of fruit to resell at a profit. She will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits.  Her ambition is to become a fruit provider.

loans.use: to buy fruit to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Merida

texts.en:
Merida is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She sells skirts and shirts, which she has been doing for two years. 

Merida is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing such as skirts and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en:
Theresie is 57 years old and married to a businessman.  She sells milk and cakes, which she has been doing for 16 years.
 
Theresie is requesting a loan, which she will use to add more liters of cooked milk and cakes to sell. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more milk and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sorpresa lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras uno de ellos es Luis quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 12 años e invertirá el crédito en comprar de mercadería principalmente granos básicos, productos lácteos, productos de uso personal y de aseó.
Los otro integrantes son Carlos quien vende derivados del maíz como elote, yoltamal, tamal…etc. Y Xochilt quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 8 años.
texts.en: The group "Sorpresa" ("Surprise") is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Luis, who has had a grocery store for 12 years. He will invest the loan in buying merchandise, principally staple grains, dairy products, personal care products, and toiletries. The other group members are Carlos, who sells corn by-products such as corncobs, yoltamal (a type of tamale), tamales, etc. And also Xochilt, who has had a grocery store for 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase inventory: staple grains, meat, dairy products, candy, etc.

loans.name: Angel Rodrigo

texts.es:
Ángel Rodrigo tiene 27 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos vive con sus hijos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Ángel Rodrigo se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas cuyes cerdos además a la construcción.
Solicita el crédito para ponerse su propia tienda de abastos, víveres.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar animales y alimento como abonos y balenciados.

Las compras y las ventas de las mercaderías las realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda.
Su sueño es tener una casa en 4 esquinas, darles la educación a sus hijos y tener una tienda competitiva y a buen nivel.

En el tiempo libre le gusta criar animales y dedicarse a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Ángel Rodrigo, 27, is married and has two children he lives within Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He raises animals like chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and also works in construction.  He’s asking for the loan to set up his own grocery and food store.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy animals, feed and manure.

His purchases and his sales take place in the city of Guaranda.  His dream is to have a house in Cuatro Esquinas and to give his children an education and to have a competitive, good level store.  In his free time he likes to raise animals and to farm.

loans.use: to buy animals, feed and manure.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. For the past ten years, she has operated a shop, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Florah additionally sells secondhand clothing to provide another source of income. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. Florah decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Florah is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to purchase bales of secondhand clothing to sell. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 28 years old. He is married with one child. For the past nine years, he has owned a store where he sells different merchandise such as flour, cooking oil, yeast, and sugar.

Aloys is requesting a loan to buy more yeast, flour, and salt to sell. He will use the profits from his loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, and yeast to sell

loans.name: Blanca Graciela

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 30 años de edad; que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos; en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope que se encuentra ubicado a 50 minutos del Distrito de Lambayeque.

Blanca se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales; hace 06 años actividad que aprendió de sus padres; ella cría a sus animales en la parte trasera de su domicilio; ella los alimenta y engorda y una vez que ya alcanzan un tamaño y peso adecuado los ofrece a la venta.  También cuenta con el apoyo de ingresos por su esposo con la pesca.

El crédito que solicita es por el monto de 3.000 soles; que será para invertir en compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales; posteriormente desea invertir en el mantenimiento de una hectárea de maíz sembrado.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 30 year old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the rural zone of the Morrope district, located 50 minutes from the Lambayeque district.

Blanca has been raising and selling animals for six years; something she learned from her parents.  She cares for the animals in an area behind her house, feeds them, fattens them up, and offers them for sale once they reach the adequate weight.  She also counts on her husband’s income from fishing. 

The loan, in the amount of 3,000 PEN, is so that she can buy balanced feed for her animals.  She later wants to invest in maintaining a hectare of corn that has been planted.

loans.use: to buy feed and care for land.

loans.name: Klever Geovanny

texts.es:
Klever Geovany tiene años de edad 23 es soltero vive con sus familiares en la ciudad de Guaranda provincia Bolívar.

Klever Giovanni trabaja en un Cyber Servinet para atención al cliente
 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de vitrinas y papelería como cuadernos hojas unitarias útiles de oficina etc., para tener un servicio de calidad hacia el cliente.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá abastecerse de mercadería por medio del cual obtendrá ingresos  para beneficio personal y superación junto a su familia. 

Las compras y las ventas  de los productos lo realizan con frecuencia en la ciudad de Riobamba.


El sueño es mejora su status económico-social.


Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es satisfacer con todas las necesidades de las personas que atiendo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte como vóley bollo.
texts.en:
Klever Geovany, 23, is single and lives with his family in the city of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar
Klever Giovanni works as an attendant in an internet café.
He is requesting the loan to buy window cases and stationery, like office paper, notebooks, etc., in order to offer his clients quality service.  
With the help from the loan, he’ll be able to stock up on merchandise that he can sell and obtain income for personal benefit and to help his family.
He frequently performs the buying and selling of products in the city of Riobamba. 
His dream is to improve his social-economic status.
The challenge he faces is satisfying the needs of every one that he attends.
In his spare time he enjoys sports, like volleyball.

loans.use: to buy showcases and stationery, like office paper and notebooks.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Adjoa est une femme âgé(e) de 58 ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et a 02 enfants( 30ans et le 27ans ).
Adjoa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et vend dans une boutique. Elle n’éprouve pas de difficulté  particulière.
Adjoa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation . Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, diversifier les produits et assurer la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjoa is a 58-year-old woman. She is married to a pensioner and has 2 children aged 27 and 30.

Adjoa works as a retailer of grocery products. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them in a shop. She does not face any particular difficulties.

Adjoa has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy food products. She wants to reinvest in her business, diversify her product range and ensure the health of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас 35 лет,замужем за Голибжона и на воспитании имеет 3-х детей.Она учительница в общеобразовательной школе.Ее очень любят и уважают в школе.Но у нее есть и вторая профессия, она хорошая швея,у нее много учеников и постоянных клиентов. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,Мукаддас начала свой бизнес. На первый полученный займ она купила себе швейную машинку.Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду,она сумела развить свой бизнес. С 2009 года Мукаддас кредитуется в нашей организации и ни разу не имела случаев просрочке.В связи с переходом на летний сезон она хочет закупить ткани для национальных платьев.Она благодарна "Арванд"  и надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Mukaddas is 35 years old, married to Golibjon and raising three children.  She is a teacher at a general education school.  She is very well loved and respected at the school.  She also has a second profession - she is a good seamstress and has many students and regular clients.  In search of a source of income for her family, Mukaddas started her own business.  She used her first loan to purchase a sewing machine.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business.  Mukaddas has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2009 and never had an occurrence of late payments.  Due to the transition to the summer season, she wants to purchase fabrics for national dresses.  She is grateful to "Arvand" and relies on your help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 61 años pero tiene el optimismo y la alegría de un joven de 20, vive al lado de su esposa y sus 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son gemelas, ama mucho a sus hijos, ellos son su mayor tesoro y su razón para vivir, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener las “Líneas de Nazca” las cuales son dibujos extenso en medio de un campo árido las cuales servían como calendario de lluvias para la cultura Nazca siglos atrás; asimismo tiene un clima cálido y sobre todo se caracteriza por la generosidad de su gente. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta componer canciones y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Escabeche”.

Día a Día Jose le dedica a su negocio de venta de herramientas para maquinaria de demolición, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el dia, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es carismático y sobre todo responsable con los clientes.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas herramientas para su negocio como brocas, barras cónicas y barrenas integrales, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, para así seguir trabajando y luchando para conseguir su más grande sueño.” Tener una ferretería muy grande”.
texts.en:
José is a very hardworking man; he’s 61 years old but has the optimism and joy of a 20 year old.  He lives with his wife and three children two of which are twin girls. He loves his children very much; they are his greatest treasure and his reason to live.  His house is located in the city of Nazca, a city noted for the Nazca Lines which are huge drawings in the middle of an arid field that served as a calendar of the rains for the Nazca culture centuries ago.  It also has a hot climate but above all is characterized by the generosity of its people.  When he has free time he likes composing songs and also likes to enjoy one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Escabeche.”

Day to day, José works in his business selling tools for demolition equipment.  He works about 8 hours daily and can tend to up to 10 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s charismatic and above all responsible with his customers.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to buy more tools for his business like drill bits, conical bars and augers which will allow him to have more variety of products and improve his income to continue working toward attaining his greatest dream: “To have a very large hardware store.”

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Ligia Iris

texts.es: Ligia Iris tiene 47 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a brindar  entretenimiento de video juego el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde la emprendedora habita, ya tiene sus cliente a quienes le ofrece su servicio. Ligia Iris está solicitando financiamiento para realizarle algunas mejoras a su vivienda en el cual con el crédito comprara cemento, zinc, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Ligia Iris is 47 years old. She engages in entertainment, offering a videogames service located in the house where she lives. She has some customers to whom she offers this service. Ligia Iris is requesting a loan to make some improvements to her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cement, zinc and sand among other construction materials.

loans.use: To buy cement, zinc and sand among other construction materials.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Adama from Aberdeen western area in Freetown. She is divorced with 2 children, 3 and 13 years old. One of her children attends school. 

Adama runs a bar and restaurant, where she sells Star beer, stout, soft drinks, and food. She has been running this business for 12 years. She works at the business 6 days per week and 10 hours a day and has one employee working for her. Her other source of income comes from a cinema centre. Adama says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and electricity power supply.

Adama has requested a loan in order to buy more assorted drinks and variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and bush meat. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and as a single parent she wants to educate her children up to university level. In the future, she plans to own the biggest entertainment centre. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more assorted drinks and a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and bush meat

loans.name: Fudia

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Fudia from Krootown in the central area of Freetown, Sierra Leone.  At the moment, she is single and has no children. 

In 2007, Fudia established her business, selling used items.  She is very hard working and works at the business six days per week.  She began her business when she was a student and found it to be very profitable.  She says that the main challenge she faces is insufficient capital to invest in the business. 

Fudia requires a loan in order to more buy more rugs, carpets, mats and drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living.  In the future, Fudia plans to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rugs, carpets, mats and drinks.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla est un homme âgé de 38 ans. Il est marié å un revendeuse. Il a un enfant de 02 ans.
Komla travaille comme revendeur de boissons depuis 2005. Il vend dans une boutique et est aidé par 03 personnes. Sa difficulté est le manque de casiers pour faire d’énormes stock afin de mieux répondre aux clients.
Komla a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin de réaménager son bar et acheter des casiers supplémentaires.
Dans les prochaines années, Komla voudrait un bar annexe et rehausser l’activité génératrice de revenu de sa femme.
texts.en:
Komla is a 38-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has a 2-year-old child.

Komla has been working as a drinks retailer since 2005. He sells his products in a shop and is helped by 3 people. His main problem is a lack of chests in which to store a large amount of stock so that he can better meet customer demand.

Komla has requested his 2nd loan from WAGES so that he can refurbish his bar and buy additional chests. In the years ahead, he would like to have an adjoining bar and to increase his wife's revenue-generating activities.

loans.use: to refurbish his bar.

loans.name: Shairbu

texts.ru: Шайрбу 45 лет, замужем, воспитала 5 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Шайрбу занимается животноводством.  Начатое 25 лет  назад со стартовой суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шайрбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и телят. Доходы Шайрбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Shairbu is 45 years old, married and raised five children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry.   This business, started 25 years ago with a sum of 50,000 som (KGS), today yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Shairbu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a dairy cow and calves.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Vicente Guerrero 2 Group

texts.es:
Francisca cuenta con 52 años, lo cual tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, es una niña cursa el 1° de la secundaria y otro niño cursa el 4° de la primaria vive felizmente casada Santa Cruz es su esposo quien es empleado del gobierno de Florencio Villarreal.

Francisca es comerciante y se dedica ala venta de calzado como es de Andrea y Mega Shoes ella lleva un poco mas de 3 años con su negocio y piensa invertir su préstamo en suficiente calzado para su venta y poder tener mas ganancias mientras mas calzado tenga mas ingresos tendría ya que es su fuente de mantención de su familia.

Francisca  y 9 mujeres más son integrantes, la cual pertenece al grupo Vicente Guerrero 2 por tanto decidieron ponerle ese nombre con el motivo del nombre de su colonia es así como decidieron ponerle ese nombre. Todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras capaces de sacar adelante a sus familias a continuación mencionaré quienes son las integrantes y a que se dedica cada una de ellas: Dolores, Lucia, Marisela, Francisca, Alba, Virginia, Adelaida, Inés, Paula y ventura quienes se dedican ala venta de: Abarrotes, Sabanas y Cobertores, Sobre camas, Perfumes, Pan, Accesorios de Bisutería, calzados, Frutas y Verduras.
texts.en:
Francisca, 52, has 2 children who depend on her. Her daughter is in 7th grade and her son is in 4th grade. She lives happily with her husband in Santa Cruz, who works for the government of Florencio Villarrreal.

Francisca is a businesswoman and has sold footwear at her store, Andrea y Mega Shoes, for 3 years. She will invest her loan into buying enough shoes to sell so she can make more of a profit – the more shoes she has, the more shoes she sells – as this is her source of income to support her family.  

Francisca and 9 other women are members of the Vicente Guerrero group; a name that comes from the town they live in.
All of these hard-working women are capable of providing and meeting the needs of their families. The members are as follows: Dolores, Lucia, Marisela, Francisca, Alba, Virginia, Adelaida, Inés, Paula and Ventura. The members sell the following: groceries, sheets and blankets, bedspreads, perfumes, bread, jewelry accessories, shoes, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: buy more shoes to sell.

location.town: Cruz Grande, Municipio Florencio Villareal, Estado

loans.name: Adonaï Plus Group

texts.en:
Béatrice is a chairwoman of a Community Bank named “Adonaï Plus”, which is composed of 12 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Béatrice is 48 years old and single. She sells loaves of bread. She has been in business since 1986 with a beginning capital of US$20. After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program she decided to join one of its groups in 2010. Béatrice has already received seven loans from Hope that she repaid correctly. With her next loan she is planning to diversify her business by buying some crates of drinks in order to generate more profit.

 Every month her business generates a profit of US$500. Béatrice’s dream is to open a larger drink facility in her area. She runs her business in the south-western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to diversify her business by buying some crates of drinks for reselling at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alex David

texts.en:
Alex is 27 and continues selling artisanal handicrafts near the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu, one of the new Seven Wonders of the World. He purchases most of his items, such as silver earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, wholesale in Cusco. 

About five months ago, Alex began crafting leather purses using typical designs of the region. However, his sewing machine is not ideal for working with leather; sometimes the needle cannot enter the material because it is too thick. A loan will help Alex purchase a machine more suited for working with leather. Right now, it takes him two days to make five purses. He hopes that the machine will increase his productivity.

Alex looks forward to finishing his tourism degree in the next five months, and in the future hopes to open a tourism agency.

Alex is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is 21 years old and runs a small computer repair business with his brother. They do not have a formal shop. Rather, clients contact them when they have problems and make arrangements to bring the equipment to the brothers. At the same time, Gerardo is studying orthodontics, a degree which takes about 5.5 years to complete. Gerardo is requesting a loan to purchase computer repair equipment such as cables and memory cards. In the future, he would like to open a stand where he can offer technical services.

Gerardo is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to purchase computer cables and memory cards

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 33 years old and has been running a hostel in Cusco for five years. Her hostel can accommodate 25-30 guests on a given night. 

Eloisa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bedsheets for the hostel. In the future, she would like to open a second business renting pickup trucks.
 
Eloisa is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to purchase bedsheets for her hostel.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Gani

texts.ru: Гани сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2007 года. Настоящее время  у него сезон летней обуви. Он принял заказ на мужскую обувь до лета. Жена Гани работает на текстильной фабрике. Сын помогает в торговле обуви. Также у Гани  есть еще один бизнес, он помогает брату реализовывать медикаменты. Он привозит свой товар а также  привозит брату  лекарства для продажи.   В настоящий момент он хочет получит кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Gani has been partnering with our organization since 2007.  It is now a season of summer shoes.  He accepted an order for men's shoes until the summer.  Gani's wife works at a textile factory.  His son helps with the shoe sales.  Gani also has another business  - he helps his brother to sell medicines.  Gani delivers his merchandise and also delivers medicines for his brother to sell.  Currently, Gani wants to obtain a loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шафоат жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Шафоат занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и корма для скота.
texts.en: Sharofat is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 41 years old, married and has four children.  Sharofat is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds cattle at home.  She is requesting this loan to buy a cow and livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy a cow and livestock feed

loans.name: Siyovush

texts.ru: Сиёвуш житель города Куляб. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него 9 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Сиёвуш вместе с братом занимается животноводством. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством, сеет пшеницу и другие виды зерновых культур. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Siyovush is a resident of the city of Kulob.  He is 25 years old, married and has nine children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Siyovush and his brother are involved in animal husbandry.  Besides this, Siyovush is involved in agriculture.  He sows wheat and other types of cereal crops.  He has been in this business for seven years.  Siyovush is requesting this loan to buy calves and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy calves and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.es:
El grupo Michael lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Carmen Idalia quien tiene un local de video juegos en el cual invertirá el crédito con mejoras al local, compra de equipo, muebles…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Rebeca quien elabora artesanías de maderas negocio que inicio hace 4 años y Paula Emilia quien desde hace 8 años elabora y vende artesanías.
texts.en:
The Michael group is made up of three hard working and enterprising members. One of them is Carmen Idalia, who has a video games store. She will use the loan to improve her store, buy equipment, furniture...etc.

The other members are: Rebeca, who produces wooden handicrafts, a business she started 4 years ago, and Paula Emilia, who has produced and sells handicrafts for 8 years.

loans.use: to improve her store and buy equipment and furniture

loans.name: Fatmata   M

texts.en:
Fatmata is 27 years old and single with no children for now.  She runs a general merchandise store in Aberdeen western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She also has three additional dependents living with her at home. 

When her father died five years ago, Fatmata did not have anyone to take care of her schooling, so she decided to run this business because she needed a permanent source of income to support her family. She sells assorted drinks, bundled water, body creams, hair products, and gallons of oil. She does not have any source of income except her business. She is faced with electricity problems that hinder her in cooling drinks. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy different kinds of drinks and provisions items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, she would like to open a mini-market. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of drinks and provisions such as bundled water, body creams, and hair products.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Abu from Aberdeen in the western area in Freetown. He is a father with an 8-month-old child and he works very hard to support his family. For the past 10 years, Abu has run a building materials store where he sells paint, cement, nails, shovels, and pans. He works seven days a week, 11 hours a day. Abu does not have any other source of income and his major business challenge is the poor road network in his area. 

Abu is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan through BRAC to buy more building materials such as paint, cement, nails, shovels, and pans. The extra income from his loan will allow him to increase his capital. Abu’s dream and business goal is to have a permanent structure for his store. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, pain, nails, shovels, and pans

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 22 years old. He lives in a village near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. Otar lives with his family – parents and 13-year-old sister. She goes to school. Otar’s parents work as agricultural workers in the village. They get a monthly salary. Otar takes care of a milk cow, owned by the family. He produces cheese and sells it in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Otar requested credit for purchasing calves. He will raise them for 9 months and sell grown calves in winter for higher price. Otar will use his profit for further development of the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Célibataire de 27ans, Mr Koffi est électronicien de profession. Vu que le métier ne passe pas comme il le souhaite, il a ajouté la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Il a démarré son activité en 2006 et l’exerce avec 01 personne dans un atelier. Il sollicite ce second crédit de WAGES pour acheter  des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut acheter une photocopieuse pour faire des copies aux élèves. Il pense aussi vendre des cartes de recharges et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi, age 27, is a single man who is an electronics technician by trade. Unable to be fully satisfied with his profession, he added the sale of general food items to his activities. He started this secondary business in 2006, and works out of a shop with one other person. 

He is seeking a second loan from WAGES to buy general food items. He also wants to buy a copier to provide a photocopy service to the students, and he is considering selling mobile phone recharge cards. He plans to get married eventually.

loans.use: to buy general food items.

loans.name: Nineli

texts.en:
Nineli is 57 years old. She lives in a small village of Mtskheta District with her family: her husband – George, her 31-year-old son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Nineli’s son is a laborer. He works in the village on house renovation jobs. Nineli is busy with small poultry farm. She has 15 hens and sells eggs in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Nineli requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. She will start production of cheese, which will be sold in the village. The income of the family will increase. Ninuli plans to reinvest the total profit received from the dairy farm in the same business, in order to expand it in the future and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! 

This is 37-year-old Kadiatu from Krootown in the central area of Freetown.  She is widowed and has three children between the ages of 17 and 20 years.  Her children all attend school. 

For the past eight years, Kadiatu has run a home commodities store, selling items such as cups, plates, bags and carpets.  She began her business just after the war when she came back from Bo and she works six days per week, eight hours a day.  Her parents did not send her to school and she leaned how to tie dye cloth from her mother.  To earn additional income, she processes tie dye (gara) to sell to her customers.  Kadiatu says that, while her customer base has increased, she lacks sufficient capital to run her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more used items such as plates, suitcases, bags and carpets.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children.  In the future, she plans to build a house. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more used items such as plates, suitcases, bags and carpets.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! 

This is 39-year-old Mariama from Krootown in the central area of Freetown.  She is married and has one child who is three years old.  Her husband works at a non-governmental organization (NGO). 

Mariama runs a general store business, selling merchandise like assorted drinks, snack foods, mayonnaise, butter, hair products and other groceries.  She has been running this business for five years.  She works at her business six days per week.  Her other source of income comes from her husband.  She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve her retail grocery store.

Mariama has requested a loan of 6,000,000 SLL in order to buy more items to stock and sell in her general store.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her savings and educate her child.  In the future, she plans to expand her business and become a wholesaler. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items to stock and sell in her general store.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla est homme de 32ans. Il est père de 02 enfants (04ans et 03 mois) et sa femme est ménagère. Afin de mieux prendre les charges du foyer, Mr Komla a commencé en 2009 par vendre des friperies dans un quartier de la place et achète à Lomé. Il sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des balles de friperies. Il veut assurer le bien être de la famille et avoir une grande boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Mr. Komla, age 32, is the father of two children aged 3 months and 4 years old. He is married to a homemaker. 

To provide for the household, Mr. Komla started to sell second-hand clothing in 2009. He conducts his sales locally and buys his merchandise in Lomé. 

He is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy bales of used clothing. He plans to ensure his family’s well-being, and he would like someday to own a large ready-to-wear store.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru: Музаффар мужчина в возрасте 33 лет, он женат  имеет 2 детей. Занимается откормом крупно рогатого скота. В свободное время работает на стройке маляром. Жена домохозяйка, но помогает Музаффару,  доит корову и готовит различные молочные продукты и продает их. Основные покупатели их домашнего производства соседи и знакомые. Кредит получает в первые на покупку скота и немного корма.Заранее благодарит организацию за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Muzafar is a 33 year-old man, who is married and has two children.  He is involved in fattening up cattle.  He works as a painter at a construction site during his free time.  His wife is a homemaker and helps Muzafar by milking the cow, preparing and selling various milk products.  The main customers of their home-made products are neighbors and friends.  Muzafar is obtaining a loan for the first time to buy livestock and some livestock feed.  He is grateful in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Piedad de 30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 5 y 10 años respectivamente y con ellos vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde genera sus propios ingresos, con sus negocios de vender mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos y también productos alimenticios, dulcería,  entre otros artículos. Su actividad como comerciante la inició hace aproximadamente dos años, cuando llegó a su barrio una campaña promocional de una multinacional, ofreciéndole convertirse en promotora de sus productos mediante guías especializadas, ella conocía esta experiencia a través de sus amigas y por eso se incorporó a la oferta y logró con ello conseguir clientes entre familiares, vecinos y amigos, que poco a poco fueron refiriéndole a otros clientes mas. Sus ventas actualmente las realiza a crédito de un mes de plazo, de acuerdo con el valor de lo que compre su cliente. Sus compras las realiza cada 21 días, tal y como se trabaja en este tipo de negocio  y paga sus facturas en ese mismo lapso de tiempo.  Como madre jefe de hogar, tiene el gran desafío de sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, hasta lograr su sueño de verlos convertidos en personas de mucho éxito; ellos son el motor que la impulsa a trabajar continuamente; últimamente agregó en su negocio nuevos productos cosméticos a su oferta y también ofrece servicios domésticos a una familia, con los que genera mas ingresos para apoyar los gastos familiares compartidos con su madre y sus hermanas, con quienes habita. Su alegría y dinamismo en el trabajo, son potencializadores del éxito de sus esfuerzos, pero necesita aumentar su capital de trabajo para empezar a cumplir su meta de incrementar sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía variada como cosméticos, pues requiere tener un capital disponible, para poder otorgar un mayor plazo a sus clientes y aumentar la base de estos. Hechos que darán como resultado el éxito de su inversión y serán  el avance para cumplir mas adelante sus sueños.
texts.en:
Piedad, 30, has 2 children aged 5 and 20, respectively. She lives in the city of Barranquilla. She generates her own income by selling products through specialized product guides and also food products and sweets, among other things.
She started her business approximately 2 years ago when a multinational came to her town with a promotions campaign, offering her the chance to become a promoter of their products through specialized guides; she heard about this experience through friends who had done it and so she became part of it, too, and obtained clients through her family, neighbors and friends, who, little by little, referred her to more clients.  
She credits her sales 1 month in advance according to the amount her client buys. She buys product every 21 days, like you do when you have this type of job, and pays her bills in the same amount of time.
As a mother, head of the household, her biggest challenge is to provide and meet the needs of her children until she achieves her dream of seeing them become successful people; they are the impetus for her to continually work. Lately, she added new cosmetics to her offerings and also offers domestic services to a family, in order to generate more income to support the household expenses that she shares with her mother and sisters, with whom she lives.
Her joy and dynamism help her succeed in her business, but she needs to increase her business capital to achieve her goal of generating more income. This is why she is requesting her 1st Kiva loan with Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy varied merchandise like cosmetics. She needs disposable income to stock up on more products and to offer her clients more products. This will result in the success of her investment and will be the advancement she needs to be able to achieve her dreams in the future.

loans.use: buy a variety of merchandise, like cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru: Солиха 1963  года рождения, у нее 4 детей. Она торгует на рынке детской одеждой. Стаж в бизнесе 15 лет. Первый кредит получала 9 лет назад, но по семейным обстоятельствам уезжала в Российскую Федерацию. После того как сын и муж устроились на работу в России она со спокойной душой вернулась обратно на Родину и заняться любимой работой. Кредит получает для того чтобы привезти сезонную детскую одежду для продажи.
texts.en: Soliha was born in 1963 and has four children.  She sells children's clothing at a market.  She has 15 years of experience in this business.  Soliha obtained her first loan nine years ago, but had to go to the Russian Federation for family reasons.  After her son and husband found work in Russia, she returned home with a calm heart and got involved in her beloved work.  Soliha is requesting this loan to bring in seasonal children's clothing for sale.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. Получает очередной кредит для расширения бизнеса. Этим делом занимается уже 21 год. Дилором продает  женскую обувь, косынки и шарфы. Раньше торговала на улице мелкими изделиями и говорит что с поддержкой организации со временем  расширила свой ассортимент и увеличила товарооборот.Сейчас у нее торговля идет хорошо и поэтому на полученный кредит она хочет привести летний ассортимент женской одежды. Она очень благодарна организации "Арванд" потому что с помощью этой организации она хоть как то улучшила свои условия жизни.
texts.en: Dilorom has been partnering with our organization since 2009.  She is requesting her next loan to expand her business.  She has been involved in this business for 21 years.  Dilorom sells women's shoes, scarves and shawls.  She previously sold small items on the street and says that, with the help of our organization, she expanded her selection with time and increased her goods turnover.  Currently, her sales are going well and this is why she wants to use this loan to bring in a summer selection of women's clothing.  Dilorom is very grateful to the "Arvand" organization because she improved her quality of life somewhat with the help of this organization.

loans.use: to buy a summer selection of women's clothing

loans.name: Clara De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora Clara de la Luz es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan los cuales comercializa en San Marco, Carazo todos los días y los fines de semana vende nacatamales  actividad que viene realizando desde hace 15 años aproximadamente 
Clara está casada y tiene tres hijos por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
texts.en: Clara de la Luz is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman.  She sells bread for a living, which she takes to market in San Marco, Carazo every day, and on weekends she also sells nacatamales (a steamed meat and vegetable-filled tamale).  She has been engaged in this activity for about 15 years.  Clara is married and has three children, and she works hard for them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, eggs, yeast, pork, cornmeal, etc.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession, Ami est une jeune dame de 33ans. Elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure depuis 2000 et est à son premier crédit à WAGES. Afin de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients, elle vend en même temps des produits cosmétiques (mèches, tissages, maquillage dans son atelier). C’est justement pour cela que le prêt est sollicité. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle veut réaménager son salon de coiffure et améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Ami, age 33, is a hairdresser by trade. She opened her salon in 2000, and she is seeking her first loan from WAGES. To better meet customer demand, she also sells cosmetic products (hair extensions, weaves, and makeup) at her salon. This is why she requires financial assistance. 

She has one person helping her, and her goal is to refurbish her hair salon. In the long term, she hopes to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Meet Moses, a 47-year-old widower who lives in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He has three children between the ages of 18 years and 25 years, two of whom are currently attending school, one at the university level.

Moses established his general merchandise business in 1998 after his position as a government worker was eliminated through privatization. He works very hard at his store 12 hours a day, 6 days per week in order to support his family. His main business challenges are insufficient capital and price inflation.

Moses requires a loan of le 6000000 to buy a stock of items to sell in his store, and believes that the extra resulting income will allow him to pay his monthly installment and increase his savings. In the future, Moses plans to expand his business into a wholesale operation. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a stock of items to sell in his general store

loans.name: Danitza Soledad

texts.en:
Danitza is 21 years old and studying hotel administration, with two years left to finish her degree. She also continues running a small business with her mother selling artisanal products. This year, her mother turned over the entire business to Danitza, who is now 100% responsible for buying goods and selling to tourists on weekends near the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu.

Purchasing her wares from wholesalers on Saturdays in Cusco, Danitza is requesting a loan in order to buy inventory such as silver jewelry, backpacks, alpaca sweaters and ceramics. Her dream is to open a chain of hotels and a travel agency.

Danitza is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as silver jewelry, backpacks, alpaca sweaters and ceramics.

loans.name: Rosmery Mirtha

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha de 25 años de edad, separada de su conyugue, nació en la ciudad del Cusco, pero actualmente vive en la provincia de Urubamba por motivos de trabajo. 
Mirtha trabaja actualmente en turismo, es recepcionista en un hotel de la zona, y también hizo de guía turística hace un año, su sueño es seguir trabajando duro para que a corto plazo pueda abrir un negocio de cabinas de internet, Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar poco a poco sus computadoras a medida que estudia la carrera de contabilidad, la cual le ayudará mucho en sus actividades comerciales. Su tenacidad y empuje le hizo incursionar en el negocio de la compra y venta de maíz, actividad que viene realizando simultáneamente  a la hotelería, para poder solventar sus estudios superiores y tratar de formar una nueva relación sentimental, casarse y tener su propia familia. Realmente un ejemplo de lucha y perseverancia.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 25 years old and is separated from her husband.  She was born in the city of Cusco, but she currently lives in the province of Urubamba for work reasons.

Mirtha now works in tourism; she is a hotel receptionist in a hotel in her zone, and she's also been a tour guide for the past year.  Her dream is to continue working hard so that she can open an internet kiosk business very shortly.  She needs a loan to begin buying her computers one by one, at the same time as she studies accounting, which will help her greatly in her business activities.  

Her tenacity and drive led her to start a business buying and selling corn, an activity which she does concurrently with her work at the hotel to pay for her advanced studies and she is trying to start a new relationship, get married, and have her own family.  This is really an example of struggle and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Matilde De Los Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 63 años de edad, es viuda desde  hace varios años, de esa relación tuvo seis hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya todos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de ellos que es discapacitado.

Ella para ganarse la vida y la de su familia desde hace varios años tiene un local en su casa en donde vende carne asada, cueritos y otros bocadillos acompañadas de plátanos asados que son la delicia de sus clientes, también vende sodas, jugos naturales y de fabrica, en las  noches vende meriendas y su especialidad es el arroz con menestra y carne asada. Trabaja de jueves a domingo desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00. Su negocio es muy concurrido y esto es por la sazón que les pone a sus platos que la hacen única.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The Colon Community Bank meets every other week in Colon, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by a lot of hills. Mrs. Matilde lives here. She is 63 years old and has been a widow for many years. She has 6 children who are grown. One of them lives with her because he is handicapped.

She earns a living and provides for her family with a business in her house she has had for many years. Here she sells carne asada, cueritos, and other snacks along with fried plantains-a favorite of her customers. She also sells sodas, natural juices and bottled juices. At night she sells snacks.
