Her specialty is rice with mixed vegetables and carne asada. She works from Thursday to Sunday from 3:00 pm until 7:00 pm. Her business is very popular because of the unique spices she adds to her dishes.

This loan is to buy ingredients for preparing food. She has been in the community bank for 3 years and she likes the help she receives from the loans. Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: buy food

loans.name: Momoh

texts.en:
This is 40-year old Momoh from Krootown in the central area of Freetown, Sierra Leone.  He is married and has one child who is seven years old.  In addition, he has two relatives that live with him at home.

Momoh runs a clothing store business, selling jeans, slippers, polo shirts, ladies body suits, capes and bags.  His store is located within a busy market.  For the past seven years he has been running this business.  He works at his business six days per week, eight hours a day.  He also works as a fisherman to increase his income and meet his family’s needs.  He says that the main challenge to his business is insufficient capital to invest in the business.

Momoh will use the loan of 6,000,000 SLL to buy clothes including jeans, slippers, polo shirts, ladies body suits, capes and bags.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay for his son’s schooling.  In the future, he plans to operate an international business. 

He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as jeans, slippers, polo shirts, ladies body suits, capes and bags.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo has been a primary school teacher for eight years.  She is 34 years old and currently teaching a second grade curriculum that covers mathematics, communications, social studies, science and physical education.  She says that she chose this profession because she has always enjoyed teaching children.  A loan will help Consuelo purchase a laptop for the private lessons she provides. 

Consuelo is deeply concerned about the state of education in difficult-to-reach jungle zones.  In the future, she would like to start an NGO that provides bilingual educational materials to people who live in the Amazon regions of Peru.  The lessons would be translated from Spanish into local languages like Matsiguenga.  Consuelo emphasizes the importance of providing “resources that match the reality” of those whom we seek to serve.

Consuelo is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level.  The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to facilitate the private lessons she provides.

loans.name: Mehroj

texts.ru: Мехроч три года как занимается торговлей. Также он занимается пополнением счетов мобильных телефонов и продажей сим-карт. Ему 22 года. У него имеется небольшая будка, где он работает продавцом. В жаркое время года он рядом с будкой ставит холодильники и продает прохладительные напитки и мороженное. Мехроч живет вместе с родителями. Он разведен. Его мать работает медсестрой в больнице. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов, газированных напитков и мороженного.
texts.en: Mehroj has been involved in sales for three years.  He is also involved in refilling mobile phone accounts and selling SIM cards.  He is 22 years old.  Mehroj has a small kiosk, where he works as a salesperson.  During a hot time of year, he installs refrigerators near his kiosk and sells cold beverages and ice-cream.  Mehroj lives with his parents.  He is divorced.  His mother works as a nurse at a hospital.  Mehroj is requesting this loan to purchase products, carbonated beverages and ice-cream.

loans.use: to purchase products, carbonated beverages and ice-cream

loans.name: Bijahon

texts.ru: Биджахон жительница города Худжанд. Ей 60 лет. У нее имеется пекарня, где она печет и продает лепешки. Кроме того у нее имеются работники. В этой области она шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки, масла и угля.
texts.en: Bijahon is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is 60 years old.  She has a bakery, where she bakes and sells flatbread.  Besides this, she has employees.  Bijahon has been in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan to buy flour, butter and coal.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter and coal

loans.name: Ravshanniso

texts.ru: Равшаннисо жительница города Худжанд. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Равшаннисо занимается торговлей парфюмерии и полотенце. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения халатов и женского нижнего белья.
texts.en: Ravshanniso is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is 40 years old, married and has three children.  Ravshanniso is involved in selling parfumes and towels.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase robes and women's undergarments.

loans.use: to purchase robes and women's undergarments

loans.name: Yeny Marita

texts.es:
Yeny es una madre muy luchadora, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio saca adelante a sus 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 5, 8, 13,17, a los cuales ama mucho y son su mayor tesoro, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, la cual acoge a infinidad de turistas en cualquier época del año; también es conocida por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de Algodón, el esparrago y la uva. Cuando Yeny dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta cantar y lo hace al lado de sus hijos, así como también le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, debido a los pocos recursos de sus padres ella solo estudio hasta el tercer año de la carrera de obstetricia pero le hubiera gustado mucho terminar su carrera.

Día a día Yeny trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, le dedica alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 50 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene variedad en los productos que ofrece y su buena atención.

Yeny está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora y vitrinas para su negocio, de esta manera podrá conservar mejor sus productos y tener una tienda más ordenada y sobre todo limpia y los clientes tendrán más confianza para comprar sus productos y así mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchado cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño.” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Yeny is a very determined mother, with great strength and a willingness to sacrifice to help her four children, ages 5, 8,13, and 17, get a good start in life because she loves them and they are her greatest treasure.  Her home is located in the city of Ica, a city known for its warm climate throughout the year, and because it's where the Huacachina lake is located, which attracts numerous tourists at every time of year, and also it's famous for its agriculture, especially the production of cotton, asparagus, and grapes.

When Yeny has free time, she likes to sing and she does so with her children, and they also like to enjoy one of their favorite foods, which is the delicious "Arroz con Pollo" (Chicken and Rice).  Because of her parents' poverty, she only studied through the third year of her degree program in obstetrics, but she would have really liked to finish her degree.

Every day, Yeny works at her business selling groceries, she dedicates around 10 hours a day and helps as many as fifty customers a day.  She believes that things are going well in her business because she has a good variety of products that she offers and good customer service.

Yeny is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva who have helped her to buy a freezer and glass cabinetry for her shop.  She will be better able to keep her products fresh and have a better organized and cleaner shop, so her clients will feel more confident about buying her products.  This will improve her margins and she continues struggling each day to make her dream a reality, "to have a larger store."

loans.use: to buy a freezer and glass cabinets.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.en:
Betzabe is 22 years old and, for two years, she has been selling artisanal products near the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu, which receive many visitors every year. Betzabe also recently finished her degree in hotel administration.  At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as jewelry, leather wallets, wooden crafts and ceramic cups and plates.  Betzabe relies on suppliers in both Cusco and Lima. 

In the near future, Betzabe plans to open a restaurant serving Peruvian rotisserie chicken in collaboration with her brother and his girlfriend.

Betzabe is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as jewelry, leather wallets, wooden crafts and ceramic cups and plates.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 22 years old and works in computer maintenance and repair.  A loan will help him purchase tools such as screwdrivers and aerosol spray to be used in computer repair.  In the future, Fernando would like to open a stand where he can offer technical services.  And, in the long run, he hopes to complete his degree in hotel administration and open a small business such as a travel agency or a car rental service.

Fernando is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level.  The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to purchase computer repair tools such as screwdrivers and aerosol spray.

loans.name: Firuzjon

texts.ru: Фирузчон проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он предоставляет услугу. Развозит пассажиров по своему маршруту по городу. В этой области он год. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины марки Газель.
texts.en: Firuzjon lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 27 years old, married and has two children.  He provides a service.  Firuzjon transports passengers along his route in the city.  He has been in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan to repair his Gazel vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his Gazel vehicle

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим житель города Вахдат. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Абдурахим зарабатывает путем разведения крупного рогатого скота. В этой области он 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Abdurahim is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  He is 48 years old, married and has five children.  Abdurahim earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: Сухробчон проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где вместе с женой занимается торговлей женской обуви. Этим видом деятельности Сухробчон занимается 15 лет. Он берет кредит для покупки летней обуви.
texts.en: Suhrobjon lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 37 years old, married and has four children.  He leases a retail outlet at a market, where he and his wife sell women's shoes.  Suhrobjon has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy summer shoes.

loans.use: to purchase summer shoes

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia Patricia tiene 34 años de edad es soltera, vive con sus familiares en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de BOLÌVAR.
Silvia Patricia tiene un negocio de Cyber “La Pila” atención al cliente.
Solicita el crédito para cubrir los gastos de la operación a la cual se va a someter su madre.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá cubrir todo tipo de gastos de la operación a la cual su madre se someterá y asi su madre se recuperara de sus problemas de salud.
Las compras de medicamentos los realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda.
El sueño es poder establecerse económicamente para poder seguir apoyando a su familia especialmente a su madre. 
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es apoyar a su madre en todo lo necesario.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar junto a su madre, además realiza deporte como básquet.
texts.en:
Silvia Patricia is 34 years old and single, and she lives with her family in the city of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province.  She has a business called Cyber "La Pila," which does customer service.

She is asking for a loan to cover the costs of a surgery her mother needs to have.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to pay for all the costs of the operation which her mother is going to have, and then her mother will be able to recover from her health problems.  She is going to buy medications in the city of Guaranda.

Her dream is to be able to economically establish herself to be able to continue supporting her family, especially her mother.  The challenge she currently faces is to help her mother in every way she needs.  In her free time, she likes to have fun with her mother, she also likes to play basketball.

loans.use: to pay for her mother's operation.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 52 года, замужем. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Анара занимается животноводством.  Начатое 25 лет  назад со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Доходы от бизнес- деятельности позволяют Анаре оплачивать образование своего сына в университете. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и телят. Доходы Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Anara is 52 years old, married.  To provide a source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry.  This business, started 25 years ago with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS), today yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  The earnings from the business allow Anara to pay for her son's university education.  In order to further develop her business, Anara requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a dairy cow and calves.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Divinas Fortalezas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIVINA FORTALEZA” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cristina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: servicio de internet, costura de chamarras, venta de carteras.

La señora Cristina,  indica que hace un año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura que viene trabajando hace años, siendo un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumento de mercadería (compra de tela), que adquirirá de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de fin de semana. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “Divina Fortaleza” (Divine Strength) communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional center.  It is comprised of six members and run by a board of directors that is headed by Cristina.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied and among them we have:  internet service, making jackets, and selling wallets.

Cristina says that she joined the communal bank with Pro Mujer a year ago.  She joined by invitation from a friend.  She currently has a sewing business that she has been working in for years as it is a family business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase merchandise (buy fabric ) that she will get in the city of El Alto.  She will later use the fabric to make clothes that she will sell at the week-end fairs.  This business helps her support her family.  She is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she said that she likes the trainings about loans and health.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Marina Lizbeth

texts.es: Maria Lizbeth es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado en brindarle financiamiento para invertir en su negocios en la compra de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Esta emprendedora durante el crédito ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con metas en la vida y crecer cada día. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como accesorios, calcomanías, recargas entre otros productos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria Lizbeth is an entrepreneur who has been supported with financing to invest in her business so that she could buy products to offer to her customers.  During the last loan cycle, she showed herself to be a responsible person with goals in life and a desire to grow each day.  Now she is requesting a loan to buy products such as: accessories, stickers, cellular phone minutes, and other products that her customers want.

loans.use: to buy accessories, stickers, cellular phone minutes and other products that her customers want

loans.name: Luz Evelyn

texts.es:
Luz es una joven de 24 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y sus 2 hermanas menores, las cuales se encuentra en edad escolar y las apoya mucho en sus estudios, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, hermosas playas y su agricultura. Luz es profesora de educación inicial, trabajo en un nido pero los ingresos no le alcanzaban mucho y decidió tener un negocio de venta de ropa para niños, desde hace ya un año ella viene trabajando muy duro en su negocio, es muy detallista en cuanto a los colores de la ropa y los modelos; su madre la animo a tener este negocio ya que siempre la apoyado en todo lo que ella realiza ya que para Luz no solo es su madre sino su mejor amiga, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy detallista, amable y carismática con sus clientes, así como también por su esfuerzo.

Luz está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar andamio, maniquís, y espejos grandes, con esta mejora podrá exhibir sus productos de manera más llamativa para mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño.” Titularse como profesora y tener una Galería”.
texts.en:
Luz, 24, lives with her mother and her 2 younger sisters, who are in school and whom she helps with their studies.
She lives in the city of Imperial, known for its warm climate, beautiful beaches and agriculture.
Luz is a kindergarten teacher and worked in a kindergarten, but the income wasn’t very good so she decided to open a children's clothing store. She’s been in business for a year now, working very hard; she is very detail-oriented when it comes to colors and styles. Her mother encouraged her to open this business as she has always supported Luz in everything she does; for Luz, she’s not only her mother, but also her best friend. She thinks her business is doing well because she is detail-oriented, kind, charismatic with her clients and she puts in the effort.

Luz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help, she’ll be able to buy scaffolding, mannequins and big mirrors. With this improvement in her business, she’ll be able to exhibit her merchandise in a manner that will catch more attention and improve her sales and income, which will help her continue the fight every day to achieve her big dream: complete her teaching degree and have a big clothing store.

loans.use: buy scaffolding, mannequins and big mirrors.

loans.name: Mina Chojlla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MINA CHOJLLA” iniciará su decimo primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: zapatería, venta de ají verdadero, venta de muebles, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, trenzado de mantas, venta de aretes.

La señora Juana,  indica que hace seis años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumento de mercadería (compra de arroz), que adquirirá de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal association "Mina Chojlla" will begin its eleventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Community Center of the Andes.  They are made up of nine members and guided by a board, led by Juana.  The businesses that the members of the community organization have are varied, and among them are a shoe shop, sales of chili peppers, furniture sales, food sales, grocery sales, weaving blankets, and earring sales.

Juana says it has been six years since she joined the communal association with Pro Mujer, joining because of regional advertising.  Currently, she has a business in food sales which she has been working at for years.

The loan which she is getting is to buy more merchandise (to buy rice), which she would acquire in the city of El Alto and later prepare and sell at her place of business.  This business helps her to support her family, as she is married and they have three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the meetings with her friends.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Roberto Mauricio

texts.es:
Roberto Mauricio tiene 39 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija en Guaranda Provincia de BOLÌVAR.

Roberto Mauricio se dedica a la venta de articulos deportivos en un local arrendado, además es entrenador deportivo y tiene un gimnasio

Solicita el crédito para incrementar mercaderías en suplementos para deportistas de alto rendimiento deportivo y para el bienestar de su familia.

Con el apoyo del credito puedo comprar articulos de deportes y bebidas energisantes.

El sueño es incrementar el negocio y poner sucursales en la provincia de bolivar. Ha enfrentado desafios como la competencia.

Le gusta estar tranquilo disfrutando de la creacion mirar las cosas buenas que tenemos al rededor por que le relaja.
texts.en:
Roberto Mauricio, age 39, is married and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.

Roberto Mauricio sells sporting goods at a rented location.  He is also a sports trainer, and he has a gym.

He is requesting the loan to increase his merchandise of supplements for athletes.   He will do this so the athletes have high performance and for his family’s well-being.

With the support of the loan he will be able to buy sporting goods and energy drinks.  His dream is to expand his business and to set up branches in the Bolívar province.  He has faced challenges like the competition.

He likes being peaceful and enjoying the Creation.  He likes looking at the good things that we have around us because it relaxes him.

loans.use: to buy sporting goods and energy drinks.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina  ahora tiene 42 años de edad, comviviente, con 3 hijos menores de edad que oscilan entre 7 y 13 años, vive en la actualidad en la Provincia de Urubamba la cual queda a una y media hora de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es comerciante, agricultora y ganadera, sin duda un trabajo muy sacrificado el cual demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, sus productos principales con los que comercia son el maíz, legumbres,  lechugas zapallo, hortalizas entre otros productos, además tambien comercia con ganado vacuno pero en menor proporción y no muy constantemente.
Ella quiere mejorar sus ingresos ofertando productos de mejor calidad y en mayor cantidad y  para eso necesita de un préstamo y comprar mas productos agricolas y mas ganado y así poder contribuir con la educación de sus menores hijos y así proporcionarles una mejor calidad de vida en general.

Avelina es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad”  que viven en la Provincia de Urubamba en Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Avelina is now 42 years old, she lives with her life partner and has 3 young children aged between 7 and 13. She is currently living in the Urubamba Province, located at about half an hour away from the town of Cusco. Her main economic activities are retailer, farmer and livestock breeder, definitely very demanding activities requiring a lot of time and effort. The products she mainly sells are maize, pulses, lettuce, pumpkin and vegetables. On top of this she also sells cattle but in lesser quantities and in a not very constant manner.

She wants to improve her earnings by offering a bigger amount of products of better quality; she is therefore requesting a loan to buy more farming supplies and more cattle, so that she will also be able to contribute to the education of her young children as well as to offer them a better standard of living.

Avelina is a member of “Virgen Natividad” (Virgin of the Nativity), a Communal Bank located in the Urubamba Province, Cusco, Perù.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies and more cattle.

loans.name: Ignacia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ignacia lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ignacia quien vende frutas y tiene una mueblería desde hace 6 años. El negocio lo inicio con el comercio de perecederos y luego invirtió en otro rubro esto fue posible gracias a los préstamos lo cual ayudo aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Griselda quien crianza cerdos desde hace 3 años y Guillermina tiene una pulpería desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The Ignacia group is made up of three hard working and enterprising members.  One of them is Ignacia, who sells fruit and has had a furniture store for the last 6 years.  She started her business by selling perishables and later invested in other products.  This was made possible thanks to the loans that helped her grow her business.
The other members are Griselda, who has been raising hogs for the last 3 years, and Guillermina, who for the last 2 years has owned a general store.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal crops.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ruth lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Yolanda de 47 años quien vende perecederos desde hace 1 años en su casa y con el crédito ella aumentara el negocio e invertirá en la venta de frijoles cocidos, atol, atolillo según comento.
Las otras integrantes son Aura quien ha vendido de todo un poco actualmente comercializa leche, pinol, pinolillo, pan etc. Y Cleris vende cajetas, pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
The "Ruth" Group is composed of 3 hard-working and enterprising women, one of whom is Yolanda (aged 47) who has sold perishables for the last year from her house. With this loan she will expand her business, intending to invest in cooked beans and a roasted maize drink which she will sell.

The other two members are Aura, who has sold everything at one time or another, and now sells milk, plus the same roasted maize drink , bread, etc. And Claris who sells fudge and the same roasted maize drink.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables and invest in other products.

loans.name: Paytsar

texts.ru:
Пайцар занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом в деревне Тандзавер. Она разводит крупный рогатый скот и кур, выращивает овощи и фрукты. Полученные молоко, говядину, яйца, овощи и фрукты Пайцар реализует в городах Капане и Каджаране. 
Пайцар 23 года. Она живет с мужем и родителями мужа в деревне Тандзавер, Сюникского региона. Муж работает в сельской общине, а также преподает историю в сельской школе. Родители мужа пенсионеры. Вся семья помогает Пайцар в ведении сельскохозяйственного бизнеса, благодаря которому они содержат семью. 
Пайцар необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для покупки трех бычков для расширения сельскохозяйственного бизнеса, а также для покупки картофельной рассады и дизельного топлива для организации посевных работ.
texts.en: Paytsar is involved in an agricultural business in the Tandzaver village.  She breeds cattle and chickens and grows vegetables and fruits.  Paytsar sells her farm products, such as milk, beef, eggs, vegetables and fruits, in the cities of Kapan and Kadjaran.  Paytsar is 23 years old.  She lives with her husband and his parents in the Tandzaver village of the Syunik region.  Her husband works in the village community and also teaches history in a village school.  His parents are retired.  The entire family helps Paytsar to run the agricultural business, thanks to which they support the family.  Paytsar needs a loan in the amount of 800,000 dram to buy three bulls in order to expand her agricultural business and also to buy potato seedlings and diesel fuel to organize sowing work.

loans.use: to buy three calves for her agricultural business and also potato seedlings and fuel to organize sowing work

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru: Гулжахон красивая,умная,трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина в возрасти 39 лет,замужем за Рахмонберди и на иждивении имеет троих детей. Уже 12 лет занимается откормом скота. А муж работает таксистом и помогает ей по бизнесу. Они вмести стараются содержать семью в достатке. В 2009 году Гулжахон обратилась в организацию "Арванд", получила кредит в размере 1000 сомони и закупила 4 молодых баранов и начала свой бизнес. С тех пор она кредитуется в нашей организации и показала свою добросовестность и честность. В данный момент у нее в наличии имеется 1 корова,1 бычок и 3 барана. На очередной займ она хочет закупить 4 баранов. Она очень благодарна "Арванд" и надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Guljahon is a pretty, smart, hardworking and responsible 39 year-old woman, who is married to Rahmonberdi and raising three children.  She has been involved in fattening up livestock for 12 years.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps her with the business.  They try to provide well for their family.  Guljahon came to the "Arvand" organization in 2009 and obtained a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni, then bought four young sheep and started her own business.  Since then, she has been obtaining financing from our organization and showed her conscientiousness and honesty.  Currently, she has one cow, one bull and three sheep.  She wants to use her next loan to buy four sheep.  Guljahon is very grateful to "Arvand" and relies on your help.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción se han unido con las ganas de trabajar y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a otras. Ellas son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, y han visto en el programa de la fundación una gran ayuda para ellas y sus familias.
 Podemos hablar de la Sra. Dominica, tiene 40 años, tiene seis hijos de los cuales cuatros aun viven con  ella. Vive en una casa muy humilde, ella se dedica a la venta de remedios yuyos por la calles todos los días. Ella es una señora muy  dedicada a su familia y a  sus hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus familiares ya que no tiene marido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios yuyos en cantidad, con lo que podrá tener mayor producto en cantidad y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Seventeen women from the city of Asunción got together with the desire to work and help each other out through this work.  They are all friends and neighbors from this city and the programs of the foundation have greatly helped them and their families.
Mrs. Dominica is 40 years old and has six children, four of whom still live with her.  She lives in a very modest home.  She makes a living selling natural remedies every day in the streets.  She is a woman that is very dedicated to her family and her children and counts on the support of her family because she does not have a husband.
She is requesting the loan for the purchase of natural remedies in large quantities which will give her more products and enable her to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase natural remedies for resale.

loans.name: Affossogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AFFOSSOGBE est composé de quinze personnes qui habitent dans la même agglomération et exercent tous des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Véronique est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Véronique est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Benin. Véronique n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Véronique est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Noel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Véronique vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Les charges familiales sont supportées à la fois par Véronique et son mari. Afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Véronique vend depuis une dizaine d’année de l’huile de palme qu'elle produit ; et de façon secondaire de l'akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) dans sa région. Véronique s’approvisionne  dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Véronique sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AFFOSSOGBE, crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group AFFOSSOGBE consists of fifteen people who live in the same neighborhood and practice income-generating activities.  The group’s representative is Veronique, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Veronique is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to a farmer named Noel, and they have four dependent children who all go to school. Veronique lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

To help support her family, Veronique started selling homemade palm oil locally about ten years ago. As a sideline, she also sells a maize-based paste called akassa. She buys her supplies locally. 

To meet customer demand and to increase her sales and revenue, Veronique is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group AFFOSSOGBE.

loans.use: to buy maize and palm nuts.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda ahora tiene 41 años de edad, nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco - Perú, pero actualmente radica en Yucay  distrito de la misma provincia de Urubamba; está Casada y Tiene 5 hijos. Su actividad principal es la  compra y venta de maíz, actividad la cual desempeña desde que tenía 18 años, y que es bastante común en esta provincia y que también representa mucho movimiento y competencia.
La señora Yolanda desea crecer en esta actividad para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y proporcionarles las comodidades que por ahora le son limitadas, por ello ella requiere de un préstamo para comprar más maíz, segur trabajando duro y que esta actividad en un futuro no muy lejano, le permita abrir un restaurante campestre.

Yolanda es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” del distrito de Yucay.
texts.en:
Yolanda is now 41 years old.  She was born in the district of Huayllabamba, in the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.  However, she now lives in Yucay district in the same province of Urubamba.  She is married and has 5 children.  Her main business is buying and selling corn, which she has been doing ever since she was 18 years old.  This is a very common occupation in this province, and it is a business where there is a lot of activity and competition.  Yolanda wants to grow her business so that she can get ahead with her children and provide them with the kinds of comforts that, at this point, she can only give them on a limited basis.  To do this, she needs a loan so that she can buy more corn.  This way she can continue to work hard, and with this activity in the not too far future, open a restaurant in the country.

Yolanda is a member of the communal bank "Virgin Natividad" in the Yucay district.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Socorro Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 49 años. Ella tiene una minipulperia la cual inicio con la venta de gaseosa y chiverías, negocio que por medio de los préstamos fue surtiendo y ampliando poco a poco actualmente vende desde granos básicos, refrescos, productos lácteos…etc.
La meta de Socorro es aumentar más el negocio con el cual ha salido a delante.
texts.en:
Socorro is a hardworking and enterprising woman of 49 years.  She has a small corner store, which she started with the sales of sodas and snacks, a business that she is growing and stocking little by little through loans.  Currently, she sells grains and beans, drinks, dairy products, etc.

Socorro's goal is to grow her business, as before this has worked out for her.

loans.use: to buy bread, soda, oatmeal, soft drinks, cream, etc.

loans.name: Hiladion

texts.en:
Hiladion is 24 years old and works in warehouse logistics. He recently started this job after finishing his degree in hotel administration. Additionally, Hiladion earns income through a business buying and selling artisanal handicrafts. He is responsible for purchasing merchandise such as woven textiles and alpaca wool products such as hats, sweaters, scarves, and blankets. A loan will help him purchase more merchandise, which he will then send to his sister who sells them to tourists visiting the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu.

Hiladion’s future ambition is to put his degree to use by opening a hotel in his family’s house near Macchu Picchu.

Hiladion is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as woven textiles and alpaca wool products.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Luz Marina is 35 and has a store in Cusco where she sells artisanal products such as alpaca wool sweaters, scarves, and silver jewelry. She has had this business for about ten years. A loan will help her purchase more merchandise from Cusco, Lima, Arequipa, Puno, and communities in the Amazon jungle. Luz Marina typically travels two times a year to purchase inventory. She says that in the future she would like to export products to Italy. She is in the process of applying for a visa to travel to Italy and develop business opportunities.

Luz Marina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters, scarves and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is both a dedicated student and an entrepreneur. She is 22 years old and nearly done with her degree in secretarial techniques. Simultaneously, she has been running a “snack” shop for the last 1.5 years. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase inventory for her store, such as fruit, vegetables and bread. Miriam looks forward to finishing her academic program and hopes to open a chain of snack shops in the future.

Miriam is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "El Sr de los Temblores III" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its first cycle with Asociación Arariwa, although some group members were previously members of other village banks.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and bread.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married with 1 child. She is 49 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional feeds for hog raising. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Patricia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for hog raising.

loans.name: Sunnifa

texts.en:
Sunnifa is married with 2 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Cavinte, Ozamiz City. Sunnifa sells chicken eggs to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional stocks of eggs for her to retail. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Sunnifa hopes to improve her living situation and to support her family, especially in their daily basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of chicken eggs for her to retail.

loans.name: Phina

texts.en:
Phina is a 52-year-old widow and a mother of three daughters and two sons who are still dependent on her. One of her five children is still in school while the others are garment workers and construction workers. Rice farming is Phina's primary source of income to support the family. She farms on a 1.5 hectare farmland once per year, and she has been in this business for almost 14 years. She supplements her income by feeding chickens to sell once every three months. 

Living in a village of the Prey Chhor district, she has been facing several challenges in earning to support her family, such as fruitless rice farming and low earned income to support her five children. Currently, she can earn around US$9 from her business to feed her family. 

This is the first loan for Phina with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of US$600 with VisionFund to buy a motorbike for asset creation in the family and also to use as a means of transportation to support her business. This loan will enable her to own a motorbike and Phina hopes to earn more from her business so as to save for her daughter's higher education.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for asset creation and to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Adama. She is married and has four children, aged 20, 17, nine, and four years. In 2001, Adama established her palm oil and garri business. She began her business because she is not educated but she does not want to be dependent on anyone for her survival. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Adama requires this loan to buy garri and palm oil in large quantities. It is hoped that her profit will be increased to SLL 600,000 monthly. Her greatest challenge is high transport costs. She hopes to educate her children to university level and to own her own storage facility, build her own house, and improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy garri and palm oil.

loans.name: Sanusi

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Sanusi. He is married and has three children, aged 19, 18, and 16 years. He has one additional dependent whom he adopted, who lives with him. In 2007, Sanusi established his cinema business to show football matches and movies. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Sanusi requires a loan to buy a projector. In the future, Sanusi plans to improve the cinema by providing comfortable chairs. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To improve his cinema and buy a projector.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional plastic products and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Querube De María

texts.es:
La señora Querube es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 37 años quien se dedica al comercio de artesanías y prendas desde hace 6 años. Este negocio lo inicio primeramente con una floristeria y luego empezo a invertir en otros rubros como es la artesanías de barro y empezó a ofrecer este arte a sus amistades y poco a poco fue aumentando su negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en mercadería artesanías y prendas de oro y plata.
Ella está casada y tiene dos niños de 10 y 6 años respectivamente, y sus metas son terminar sus estudios universitarios en farmacología y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Querube is a hardworking and enterprising woman of 37 years and has been in the business of selling handicrafts and gold and silver jewelry for the past six years.  She started this business with a small flower shop and began to work in other types of artwork, like pottery, beginning by offering these crafts to her friends and little by little has grown her business.  The loan will be invested in craft wares and gold and silver jewelry.

She is married and has two children, who are 6 and 10 years old, and her goals are to finish her university studies in pharmacology and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and gold and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Aiah

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Aiah. He is married and has two children, aged 11 and seven years. He has two additional dependents. In 2004, Aiah established his motor vehicle spare parts business. He began his business because he was not fortunate to get a job after his education. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Aiah requires a loan to buy spare parts like fan belts, clutch plates, etc. In the future, Aiah plans to establish himself in other areas, closer to garages. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is the father of two children aged 12 and two years.  He resides with his family in their rural home in Nkubu in central Kenya.  He has actively practiced mixed farming in this area since he became an adult.  His family’s basic needs are met through his farming income.  His farm currently produces bananas, coffee and cereals for the local market.

Joel has requested a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He believes that good farming methods and the acquisition of better breeds will increase his farming income and enable him to adequately meet his family’s basic needs.  In the future, he wants to buy more land to expand both his banana and coffee plantations. 
  
He says that pests and diseases have been the worst challenges with cereals and coffee farming respectively.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson lives in Compound #3.  He is 34 years old and married with four children.  He is educated through the 9th grade level.  

Since 2005, he has been selling cement, building materials and others items.  He learned this method of selling from his parents.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more cement, building materials and other items for his business.

He plans is to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cement, building materials and other items for his business.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza nació en la ciudad de Abancay del departamento de Apurímac en Perú, pero actualmente vive en el distrito de Yucay de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada, tiene 5 hijos, 3 de los cuales están en edad escolar, por ello trabaja comprando y vendiendo artesanías.

Esta actividad comercial se ha incrementado mucho debido al crecimiento del turismo en esta region, y por el constante desarrollo y la construcción grandes plantas hoteleras en los últimos años dentro de esta provincia, es por ello que La señora Lorenza a puesto sus esperanzas de crecimiento en el comercio y venta de artesanías y souvenirs, por lo cual necesita hacer un préstamo para poder comprar más mercadería ya que esta próxima la temporada alta para el turismo, y de esta manera percibir mejores ingresos y así proporcionar una mejor educación para sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Lorenza was born in the town of Abancay, in the Peruvian department of Apurímac, but she is currently living in Yucay, located in the Urubamba Province, in Cusco. She is 45 years old, she is married and she has 5 children, 3 of whom are of school age. For them she works buying and selling handicrafts.

Thanks to an increasing amount of tourists in the region, to the constant development and to the building of big hotel facilities in the past few years, the handicrafts market has sensibly grown. Lorenza has pinned her hopes on the increase of the buying and selling of handicrafts and souvenirs, and for this reason she is requesting a loan in order to buy more products: the tourist high season is approaching and she plans on increasing her earnings, thus being able to offer a better education to her young children.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Alphanso

texts.en:
Alphanso is 40 years old.  He lives in Compound #3 with his wife and children who range in age from five to 14 years.  All his children attend school and Alphanso is educated through the 11th grade.

Since 2011, he has been operating a provisions shop, where he sells fresh milk, sugar and others items.  He stated this business with his brother’s help.  One of the main problems he faces is transporting the goods to his shop.  He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fresh milk, sugar and others items for his business.  He likes the way his business keeps him busy.  

In the future, he plans is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh milk, sugar and others items for his business.

loans.name: Graines Plus Group

texts.en:
Léa is a leader of a Community bank named “Graines Plus” which means seeds in English. It is made up of thirty-one members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Léa operates a pastry shop that she started in 2000. Her business is located to the North-eastern part of Kinshasa. She works hard with good management for business expansion.  With her loan, Léa will be able to increase the production of loaves of bread in order to meet the customer demand and generate additional profits. Her business makes US$30 of profit per week. One of Léa’s strategies to keep her clients is that she tells them in advance about any changes that may occur in her business. Léa is 55 years old, a widow and has seven children whose ages vary between 23 and 35 years old.

loans.use: to increase the production of bread in her business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a la orilla del mar y con su vocación turística es muy visitado especialmente  por familias los fines de semana y en época de vacaciones, para disfrutar de playa, brisa y mar y de la deliciosa comida preparada con la especialidad del pescado. Rosa quien vive con su hijo de 9 años de edad, en este hermoso paisaje tiene un negocio donde vende pescado de mar y cervezas, aprovechando el potencial del mercado y su experiencia como parte de una familia tradicional de pescadores, donde sus 3 hermanos  realizan esta actividad  y están asociados a su negocio. En su negocio tienen una lancha pesquera con motor fuera de borda y dos trasmayos, la pesca la realizan  en el sector de Caño Dulce, balneario ubicado a 30 minutos de Puerto Colombia y el producto de su actividad lo llevan a casa de Rosa para que ella inicie su comercialización. Este negocio tiene 20 años de estar funcionando y cuenta con una clientela acreditada; así mismo Rosa tiene un estadero donde vende cervezas los fines de semana, que realiza independiente del negocio de sus hermanos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, porque su capital de trabajo para el logro de sus propósitos se convierte en un desafío, cuando de invertir se trata. Con este su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprara, cervezas directamente al camión y no a través de los puntos fríos y reparará  los 2 trasmayos. Su inversión tendrá éxito porque ganará el costo de la intermediación y porque adecuará su estructura física para desempeñar su labor de pesca de manera efectiva.
texts.en: Rosa, 45 years old, lives in the Puerto Colombia municipality, located on the sea shore. It is a tourist spot and frequented by families on weekends and during vacation seasons to enjoy the beach, breezes and sea and the delicious meals prepared with the area specialty, seafood.  Rosa, who lives with her 9 year old son in this beautiful place, has a business where she sells fish and beer, taking advantage of the market potential and her experience coming from a traditional family of fishermen.  Her three brothers are fishermen and are part of her business.  In their business they have a fishing boat with an outboard motor and two gill nets.  They fish in the Caño Dulce area, a resort located 30 minutes from Puerto Colombia, and they take the fish to Rosa for her to sell.  This business has been running for 20 years and they have a reputable client base.  Additionally, Rosa has a stand where she sells beer on weekends, a business independent from her brothers.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because the investment in the working capital of her business is a challenge.  With this first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation she will buy beer directly instead of from middlemen and will be able to repair the two nets.  Her investment will be successful because she will gain the cost of the intermediary and will improve the equipment that will make the fishing more effective.

loans.use: to repair 2 fishing nets and purchase beer directly.

loans.name: Virgilio  Antonio

texts.es:
Virgilio tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero,  vive en la ciudad de la ceiba Atlántida.
Virgilio hace dos años tiene un negocio de venta de comida y de frutas. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios y vende Pollos Rostizados, refrescos, golosinas y frutas. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco con la administración y el esfuerzo que ha hecho. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar estratégico donde hay diferentes negocios y sus ventas son favorables.
Con el préstamo que el solicito de 20,000 lempiras es para abastecerse de productos como Pollos, refrescos, golosinas y otra parte es para hacerle mejoras al local donde funciona su negocio. Para darle una mejor comodidad a los clientes y mejoren sus ventas.
Su meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio mejorando  económicamente. También su meta personal es casarse y tener una familia estable.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 28, is single living in the city of La Ceiba, Atlántida.  For the last two years he’s had a business selling food and fruit.  He started the business with his own funds.  He sells roasted chickens, soft-drinks, snacks and fruit.  His business has been growing little by little with the good administration and effort he’s put into it.  His business is located in a strategic spot where there are various other businesses and sales are good.

With the 20,000 lempira loan he requested he will stock up on products like chickens, soft-drinks and snacks and will use a part of it to do some improvements to the place where his business operates to provide better comfort to his customers and so his sales will improve.

His goal is to continue working in his business improving economically.  His personal goal, also, is to get married and have a stable family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store and to do some physical improvements to it.

loans.name: Jose Ernan

texts.es:
Jose, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7, y 9 años de edad y una cuñada.
Hace dos años que Jose tiene una pulpería para vender productos comestibles de la canasta básica familiar, la cual fue heredada por  una tía.  En busca de  obtener otros ingresos él realiza  otro trabajo con una empresa que vende cosméticos, al igual que su esposa quien trabaja en una maquila. Para este negocio de la pulpería tiene el apoyo de una cuñada quien atiende muy bien a los clientes.
Con el fin de incrementar el inventario de productos y mantener surtida la pulpería está solicitando un préstamo de 5,500.00 Lempiras, con el cual comprara arroz, azúcar, manteca, carne de pollo, refrescos, galletas, y otros.
Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, adicionar la venta de cosméticos para generar ingresos y poderle dar el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar el nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José, 30, lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with his wife and two children who are 7 and 9 years of age and with a sister-in-law.  He’s had a grocery store for two years to sell basic staple items which he inherited from an aunt.  Aiming at earning additional income he also works with a firm that sells cosmetics and his wife works in an assembly plant.  His sister-in-law helps him with the grocery store taking care of customers.

With the goal of increasing his inventory of products and keeping the store stocked, he’s asking for a 5500 lempira loan to buy rice, sugar, lard, chicken, soft-drinks, cookies and others.  His goal is to make the business grow and to add cosmetics sales to generate income and be able to give his children schooling and improve the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Nancy Olivia

texts.es:
Nancy Olivia tiene 45 años de edad es divorciada tiene un hijo, vive con su hijo en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.
Nancy Olivia se dedica al comercio minorista de una tienda de abarrotes y vende productos de primera necesidad
Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio, comprar materiales de construcción para arreglar la casa ya que es uy inconmoda.
Con la ayuda del crédito cubriré gastos para puertas y ventanas.
Las compras de los productos agrícolas lo hace frecuentemente en la ciudad de Guaranda en talleres Lizardo.
El sueño tener un negocio prospero que sea conocido a nivel provincial e inter-provincial, el cual tenga gran éxito.
Los desafíos a loa que se enfrenta es que su familia no tenga problemas de salud.
En el tiempo libre le gusta tejer le encanta crear manualidades.
texts.en:
Nancy Olivia is 45 years old, divorced and has a son.  She lives with her son in the city of Guaranda of the Bolivar province.
Nancy Olivia makes a living in retail sales in a grocery store where she sells basic needs products.
She is requesting the loan to start a business, purchase construction materials to fix the house which is very uncomfortable.
The loan will cover the costs of doors and windows.
She frequently buys farm products in the city of Guaranda in the Lizardo shop.
Her dream is to have a prosperous business that is well known in and outside her province, one that is very successful.
Her challenge is to make sure that her family is healthy.
In her free time she likes to knit and make handicrafts.

loans.use: to get construction materials.

loans.name: Mwangaza Plus Group

texts.en:
Djuma is chairman of a community bank called “Mwangaza Plus,” which is composed of 14 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity with the purpose of receiving loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC to develop their businesses. 

Djuma, 40, is the married father of four children aged between 2 months and 12 years, three of whom attend school. Djuma sells miscellaneous products, and he has been in this business since 2002. He likes it because it supports his family financially. He has worked with determination and good management in order to achieve his goal to someday open a large general store in his neighborhood. With his next loan he intends to buy miscellaneous goods to increase his inventory. Currently, he earns a weekly profit of 40 USD.

loans.use: to increase his inventory and raise more working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya, where he lives with his wife. He has four children who are all adults. He has been providing for his family's needs with the income from farming and a retail shop in the local market. He has been in farming for 30 years and currently produces maize, milk, and beans, which are all sold within the local market.

Joseph has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him construct a zero grazing unit on his dairy farm. He hopes to continue providing basic needs for his family and expand his retail business.

Joseph laments of poor markets for farm produce and inadequate rains. He adds that in the future he will install an irrigation system to help his farming business throughout all seasons.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a single man who is 32 years old and without children or dependants. He rides a motorcycle commonly reffered to as a "boda boda" in the outskirts of Kampala city. He transports clients from all corners of the city but more so the ones that have known him for some time and have built confidence in him. Fred has been doing this business since 2009. He works six days a week and farms vegetables to supplement his income. He wants this loan to buy his own motorcycle since he rides someone else's who he has to pay UGX 10,000 per day. He wishes to do large-scale agiculture in the future.

The major challenge he faces is when clients who he has transported reach their destinations and refuse to pay. The rainy season also affects the business because the muddy roads are slippery and make him and his passengers risk having accidents. Fred describes himself as very  hard working and honest. His dream is to save up enough money to become an extensive agriculturalist.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a 27-year-old female. She is married and has a two-month old baby. She operates a retail shop where she sells artificial hairpieces within Kampala city center. 

She started the business so that she could earn income to meet her daily needs. She wants this loan to buy more hairpieces to restock the shop. She has operated the business since 2009. She works six days each week from Monday to Saturday, from dusk until dawn. Her major clients are mainly salons that do plaiting and weaving.

Her dream is to expand her business into a wholesale shop. Her major challenge is competition from the neighboring shops that sell the same products, as well as the demand for hairpieces being seasonal, ie; mostly tied to the festive season. She describes herself as a hard working, social and shrewd person. Above everything else, she loves the kind of business she does and dreams of being the leading supplier of these products in her area.

loans.use: To buy more artificial hair pieces

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de la Sra. Eladia y la Sra. Hilda, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para informarse del  Programa Comité de Mujeres y logró juntar a 16 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. Ellas  son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto.
La Sra. Eladia es una persona muy trabajadora, y ayuda a sus compañeras a poder tener siempre un espíritu de solidaridad. Ella tiene una despensa y comenta que tiene buena venta, ya que siempre ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes. su meta es poder agrandar su negocio y de esa forma poder mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtir su local con verduras, carne, golosinas, productos como fideos, arroz y demás, ya que esto le dará más variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Sra. Eladia and Sra. Hilda, who came to the office of Fundación Paraguaya to obtain information about the Women's Committee Program. They were able to gather 16 hardworking and humble women who want to support themselves every day. The members work independently in their jobs as merchants, but they also engage in joint activities.

Sra. Eladia is a hardworking individual who always helps her fellow group members with maintaining a spirit of solidarity. She manages a food pantry and says that she has good sales because she always offers a good variety to her customers. Her goal is to expand her business so that she can improve her earnings and help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to restock her shop with vegetables, meat, candy, noodles, rice, and other products. This will enable her to provide greater variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, candy, noodles, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Lirio De Los Valles esta por diez emprendedoras que son de las misma localidad donde habitan y se formaron para salir adelante apoyándose unas a otras, este grupo es su primer crédito que está solicitando para invertir en sus negocios y  ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad  y así generar ingresos y sacar adelante a sus familias. Vianca Lisseth es parte de este grupo y su actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes les ofrece sus servicios, esta emprendedora está solicitando crédito para comprar  pantalones, camisas, blúmer, sandalias, faldas, variedad de cosméticos entre otros productos.
texts.en: The Lirio De Los Valles ("Lily of the Valley") communal bank is made up of ten entrepreneurs who live in the same town. They formed the group to move forward supporting each other. This is the first loan that this group is asking for in order to invest in their businesses and offer their customers variety, and in this way generate income and move their families forward. Vianca Lisseth is part of this group, and her business is selling general merchandise. She does this door-to-door, since she already has her regular and casual customers to whom she offers her services. This entrepreneur is asking for a loan to buy pants, shirts, underwear, sandals, skirts, and a variety of cosmetics, among other products.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, sandals, skirts, and a variety of cosmetics, among other products.

loans.name: Villa Bolivar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA BOLIVAR” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Victoria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: panadería, venta de queso, venta de pan, venta de plásticos, tejido y venta de mantas, venta de fruta, venta de coca, venta de ropa.

La señora Victoria, indica que hace cuatro años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de un nuevo negocio, ya que invertirá este dinero en la compra de un Kiosco para la venta de slachipapas, mismo que instalará cerca a su casa. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía falta la señora Reyna ya que encontraba en consulta médica
texts.en:
The “Villa Bolívar” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 9 members led by a governing board headed by Victoria.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: bakery, cheese sales, bread sales, plastics sales, weaving and selling blankets, fruit sales, coca leaf sales and clothing sales.

Victoria indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer communal associations for four years having been invited to join by a girlfriend.  She currently has a business selling cheese; she's been in business for years.

The loan she’ll take out is to add a new business; she will invest this money in the purchase of a kiosk to sell “salchipapas” [fried sausages with fried potatoes] that she’ll set up at home.  This business will help her support her family since she’s married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.
 
Reyna is absent in the photo because she was attending a health appointment.

loans.use: to buy a food kiosk.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 30 años de edad, nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú, tiene 2 hijos pequeños y su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras en general y variedad de frutas, Lourdes realiza esta actividad hace 5 años y ahora necesita capital para poder comprar fruta como por ejemplo Naranjas, bananas, mandarinas, papayas etc. de Quillabamba que es la zona productora de fruta a nivel regional, y de esta manera poder mejorar y variar su mercadería.

De esta manera Lourdes desea incrementar su oferta y percibir mejores ingresos, para mejorar su comercio y crecer dentro de su comunidad.
texts.en: Lourdes, 30, was born in Huayllabamba District, Urubamba Province in Cusco, Perú.  She has two small children and her main economic activity is selling vegetables in general and a variety of fruit.  Lourdes has been in this business for five years and needs capital now to buy fruit like oranges, bananas, mandarins, papayas, etc. in Quillabamba which is the regional fruit producing center so that she can improve and vary her merchandise.  In this way, Lourdes hopes to increase her offer and earn better income to improve her business and to grow in her community.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married father of two children, and he owns a workshop that has been in operation for the last five years. He started the business from his personal savings. Upon learning about Milango, Francis joined the organization to access credit for his business operations.

Francis is applying for a loan of 83,450 KES to purchase a hydraulic machine. This will help him improve operations at his workshop. His ambition is to have a fully equipped workshop that can generate income by performing major repairs and maintenance both locally and internationally. Frnacis believes the additional income from this loan will help him pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a hydraulic machine.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a father of six children who are all adults. He has been in farming for more than 40 years. His farm produces maize, beans, and tobacco for the local market.

Samson has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to help him buy two bulls that will help in breeding and transporting his farm produce, especially maize and beans, from the farm to the stores and nearby markets. He adds that hiring transportation services during harvesting seasons and to the nearby markets is costly. He believes the farming income will help improve his standard of living.

He mentions lack of enough rains to enable irrigation as a challenge, coupled with high costs for water harvesting tanks.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi has been in active farming for 22 years and has one farmhand who he employs. His farm produces milk and eggs, which he sells to the local market. He earns additional income from his low-cost rental houses in the local market. He is married and has three children. His youngest is only 10 years old and is still in school. 

Daudi has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry business. He will buy poultry birds with the loan. He also plans to buy his own car to help in transportation, which has become very expensive to hire.

Daudi says lack of enough water remains a challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a mother of three children, ages 32, 22 and 12. She has been in farming for ten years and currently produces maize and beans for the local market. She is 51 years old.

Aileen has made a loan request for 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This is her second loan; her first loan was for 46,800 KES. She will use the loan to buy poultry birds and venture into poultry farming. Her future plans are to construct a greenhouse and farm throughout. She says improved farming income will help meet family needs, especially educating her youngest child.

She says drought has been the major challenge. She is looking for ways to harvest water during rainy seasons and to set up an irrigation system.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 56-year-old married woman with two children who have both finished school. She is a first time borrower and wants a loan of Ugandan shillings 800,000 to buy a gas cooker for her restaurant.

She started the restaurant late last year in November because she wanted something to keep her busy and generate income at the same time. The restaurant is supplemented by the sale of milk and matooke from her farm at her village home in Isingiro. Her clients are mostly people within her business location and she earns a net income of Uganda shillings 100,000 (One Hundred Thousand Shillings) per month. Her major challenge as she carries out her work is the stiff competition from the many neighboring restaurants.

Alice's dream is to expand her business into a big and beautiful cafeteria. She hopes that she will also start outside catering if she can save up enough money to do so. Alice describes herself as a self-motivated and honest lady.

loans.use: To buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Castro

texts.en:
Castro is a 37-year-old man married with three children, two of whom attend school. He is employed with the Irish embassy as the security supervisor but supplements his income with a motorcycle, which he uses to ferry customers over the weekend. He started working at his job in 2004 and works five days a week. His job as well as where he rides his motorcycle are located in the outskirts of the city. 

He is taking this loan to pay school fees for his children and to repair his motorcycle, which has broken down. He hopes to develop a savings culture with the UGAFODE so that in future, he can pay his children's school fees without having to keep borrowing.

Castro describes himself as very hard working and honest. He urges UGAFODE to expand to more branches nationwide so that the clients are able to access their services even when they move outside the city.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Usiel Ezequias

texts.es:
Usiel,  de 23 años de edad, vive en una aldea suburbana del municipio de Morazan Yoro junto  con su pareja con quien tiene una niña de 4 años de edad.
Usiel  ha sido agricultor desde pequeño, su padre le enseño y le  apoyo  con las tierras para que pueda realizar sus propias actividades de agricultura, el cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijoles.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 3,000.00 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento de limpieza y una buena preparación de la tierra de sus cultivos de maíz y frijoles, con el fin de mejorar las cosechas y sacar una producción de calidad. Su sueño es buscar cómo superarse sacando cultivos de calidad.
El pertenece a un grupo solidario el cual  está conformado por 4 miembros, viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Usiel, 23, lives in a suburban village in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro, with his spouse; they have a four year old little girl.

Usiel has been a farmer since he was little; his father taught him and gave him the land so that he could do his own farming; he grows basic crops like corn and rice.

He’s asking for a 3000 lempira loan to clear his fields and prepare the soil well for his corn and bean crops with the objective of improving harvests and obtaining quality products.  His dream is to find the way of improving himself by producing quality crops. 

He belongs to a solidarity group that has four members who live in the same community and are farmers.

loans.use: to clear his fields.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba en la provincia de Urubamba en el Departamento del Cusco - Perú. María tiene 56 años edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, su actividad principal es la venta de verduras en el mercado principal de la localidad.

La señora María también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas además pertenece a la asociación de criadores de cuyes del pueblo de Yucay. En esta oportunidad María requiere el préstamo para comprar fruta como manzanas, naranjas, bananas, etc. y también animales como cuyes y gallinas.  

María es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” del distrito de Yucay
texts.en:
María was born in Huayllabamba District in Urubamba Province in Cusco Department, Perú.  She is 56 years old, married and has six children.  Her main activity is selling vegetables in the main market in her location.


María also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens and is a member of the town of Yucay’s guinea pig raising association.  On this occasion, María needs the loan to buy fruit like apples, oranges, bananas, etc. and also to buy animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

María is a member of the “Virgen Natividad” in Yucay District.

loans.use: to buy fruit and small farm animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to erect a new shelter for her food stall.

loans.name: Kavata

texts.en:
Kavata lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She runs a retail shop that she began using her savings twenty years ago. It has been a great source of support to Kavata’s family of eight children. On hearing about Milango from an employee, Kavata joined in order to access credit for her business.
