Kavata is applying for a loan of 83,450 KES to buy retail stock like sugar, rice, flour and soft drinks. The extra income made possible by the loan will go towards the education of her children. Kavata aspires to own a wholesale shop sometime in the near future, despite challenges like price fluctuations and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old, married and has three children aged fifteen, eleven and five years. The children all go to school.

Joseph has been a farmer for the past ten years. He grows cereals and vegetables and then sells them in the local markets. He also trades in khat for additional income. Joseph says poor prices for farm products within the local markets remain a challenge.

Joseph has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy pipe to set up an irrigation system on his farm. He says this will result in a big boost for his farm since water is the leading challenge in the area for farmers.

loans.use: To buy irrigation pipe.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He has been a farmer for the last thirty years and employs two farmhands. His farm produce includes milk, bananas, and French beans, which are all sold within the local market. He is married and has four children, with the last two still schooling.

He has requested a second loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to buy irrigation pipes. He says setting up an irrigation system will mitigate the challenge of short rains, which limits farming income. He plans to buy more acres of land to expand his farming business.

Michael says occasional winds that destroy bananas remain a challenge, coupled with low prices for the farm produce.

loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has been in mixed farming for over eighteen years and currently relies on his farming income to meet all his family’s needs. He also retails  cereals (grains) to supplement his farming income.

Edward has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats for his dairy farm due to their resistance to harsh weather conditions. He plans to buy more acres of land to expand his farming business.

Edwards points out poor market prices, high cost of farm inputs, and labour costs of farmhands as the major challenges.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He has been in active farming for seven years and sells his farm produce, which includes mainly milk, vegetables, and fruits, to the local market. He runs a grocery retail business to supplement the farming income. He is married and has one child, aged two years.

David has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He plans to expand his farm to three acres in five years and believes farming will continue to improve the living standards of his family.

He sees pests, diseases, and poor prices for farm produce as the challenges in the business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Jeffew

texts.en:
Jeffew is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya, where he lives with his family of three children. He has 12 years of experience in farming and currently produces coffee, passion fruits, bananas, and cabbages, which are all sold within the local markets. He trades in domestic animals for additional income.

Jeffew has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy piglets and venture into pig farming. He says the business will enable him to educate his three children (ages 13, 7, and 5), who are all in school. He also plans to install an irrigation system on his farm for intensive banana farming.

Jeffew says animal diseases and the high cost of farm inputs are the inherent challenges in his business.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary (pictured here with one of her pigs and which should not be mistaken for the current loan purpose) is 30 years old and has been in active farming for 17 years. Her farm produces pigs, maize, and beans. She also operates a retail shop in the local market where she sells her agricultural produce.

Mary has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy two bulls to help in moving her farm produce from the farm to the stores and to nearby markets during harvesting. Mary has a future plan to buy more parcels to land to expand her maize and beans acreage.

She laments of poor infrastructure as the major challenge to her business.

loans.use: To buy two bulls

loans.name: Lucrecia Judith

texts.es:
Lucrecia Judith tiene 21 años de edad tiene un hijo es soltero, vive con su mama en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.
Lucrecia Judith es comerciante de cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para aumentar y fortalecer el comercio de cerdos.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar al contado cerdos lo que antes necesitaba para incrementar su negocio como comerciante.
Las compra y la venta  de cerdos lo realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda.
El sueño es estudiar para culminar sus estudios superiores y tener mejor nivel económico de vida con su familia. 
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener determinada carrera profesional.
En el tiempo libre le gusta leer obras literarias y pasar junto a su hijo.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Judith is 21 years old. She has a son. She is single and lives with her mother in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar province.

Lucrecia Judith sells pigs.

She is asking for the loan to increase and strengthen the pig business.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy pigs with cash, which she needed before to increase her business as a merchant.

She buys and sells the pigs in the city of Guaranda. 

Her dream is to study to complete her higher education and have a better economic position with her family.

The challenge she faces is to have decided on her professional career.

In her free time, she likes to read literary works and walk with her son.

loans.use: to be able to buy pigs with cash

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay De Huayaringa Group

texts.es: Judith es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Señor de Muruhuay de Huayaringa” la cual está conformado por 07 personas responsables dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. Judith de 34 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando a 03 de ellos. Hace 02 años que aperturo un bar en su domicilio donde  brinda bebidas como gaseosas,  agua mineral y cervezas, esto nació con la idea de generar ganancias para su hogar, también nos comenta que ayuda a su pareja en la siembra y cosecha de palta y chirimoyas. Judith se siente feliz pues con su trabajo y esfuerzo a logrado apoyar a su hijos en su educación y mejorar su vivienda. A futuro le gustaría poner una boutique, la cual le generaría mayores ingresos asegura ella. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para compra gaseosas, agua mineral y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Judith agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella. Jhon  fue acompañado de su pareja la cual está ubicada a su lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the “Señor de Muruhuay de Huayaringa” communal bank composed of 7 responsible people dedicated to a variety of commercial activities.  Judith, 34, has a spouse and four children and she still supports three of them.  

Two years ago she opened a pub at home where she sells beverages like soft-drinks, mineral water and beer.  This arose from the idea of generating profits for her home.  She also comments that she works with her spouse planting and harvesting cherimoyas [custard apples].  

Judith is happy because with her work and effort she’s managed to support her children’s education and improve her dwelling.  In the future she’d like to open a boutique that would generate higher income, she assures.  

On this occasion she asked for a loan to buy soft-drinks and mineral water to have what her customers want on hand.  Judith thanks Kiva lenders for helping people like her.  

Jhon attended with his spouse who is on his left.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, mineral water and beer.

loans.name: Danitza Sarit

texts.es:
Danitza  es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus hijos, casa ubicada en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural del distrito pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Danitza es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su conviviente es agricultor, arrendando terreno para la siembra de marigol y maíz.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 4500 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la adquisición de un vehículo motorizado (moto furgón) para el transporte de su ganado e insumos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Danitza is a 28 year old woman living with her spouse and two children who are in her care.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and children located in the Guaraguaos Alto settlement in Tambogrande District.  She lives in the rural part of the district but does have electricity.

The activity that Danitza carries out is raising small farm animals (sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl) that she sells in the local market once they reach ideal size and weight.  Her spouse is a farmer; he leases land to grow marigolds and corn.

The loan she asking for is 4500 new soles to buy a motorized vehicle (motorcycle powered cargo truck) to transport her livestock and farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy a motor vehicle to transport her livestock.

loans.name: Hilda Luisa

texts.es: Hilda es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de Cocharcas, tiene 48 años de edad, ella vende todo tipo de cereales y ropa, es madre de 2 hijos, es casada, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 15 años, gracias a Finca pudo educar a sus hijos y ahora ellos son profesionales ,con  las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal aprendió a ahorrar y  distribuir las ganancias de su Bancomunal, pudo construir su casa, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales como haba, trigo, quinua, entre otros.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen de Cocharcas". She is 48 years old and sells all types of grains and clothing. Hilda is married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 15 years. Thanks to FINCA, she has been able to provide her children an education and now they are professionals. The training classes from her Communal Bank have taught her how to save and allocate her earnings toward the construction of her house.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of dry goods such as beans, wheat, quinoa, and other products.

loans.use: to buy dry goods such as beans, wheat, quinoa, and other products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a single mother of four children, and she owns a grocery stall that she has been running for ten years. 

Jennifer is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase fruits and vegetables, such as potatoes, tomatoes, and cabbages, for sale. Her ambition is to open a retail shop in addition to her stall and to have more stock of groceries in order to widen her income stream. But Jennifer needs to overcome challenges like the high cost of produce, the onset of the rainy season, and the fact that her customers do not always pay on time. The extra income made possible by the loan will help her educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 28, married and has a one-month-old baby. His main source of income for the past three years has been from his farm (his wife has a shop in the marketplace as well). He is challenged by low prices for his produce, plus pests and plant diseases.

Nicholas has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets. He says he wants to venture into pigs because they breed so quickly and cost less to feed than animals such as dairy cows.

Nicholas is planning to buy more acres of land to branch out into horticultural farming as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is 47 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business.   

Aliitasi needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to continue improving and expanding her plantation.

In 2012, Aliitasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Aliitasi's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment for growing taro.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 44 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business.  

Rosalia needs a loan of WST $2,250 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family.

In 2008, Rosalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Rosalia's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment for growing taro.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es: Perseverancia, iniciativa y deseo de desarrollo por salir adelante son parte de las características primordiales de la alcancía comunal "Ebenezer", conformado por 7 integrantes en su mayoría mujeres desde hace mas de 6 años, este grupo viene trabajando de forma paraja y en constante desarrollo, cada integrante en forma individual, muestra de ello es la señora Nelly de 52 años de edad casada y con 4 hijos de los cuales uno aun es menor de edad. Ella se levanta todas las mañanas muy temprano para abrir la bodega que tiene como fuente de ingresos para su hogar, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones a lo largo de 8 años que es el tiempo que tiene su bodega. La señora Nelly emprende este negocio a raíz que necesitaba ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Con el reciente préstamo implementara mercadería  para la venta de la bodega. Como la Nelly cada integrante tiene una historia en particular con buenos y malos momentos a lo largo de sus vidas pero, si en algo coinciden es el deseo de superación que demuestran todos los días por el bienestar de sus familias y negocios.
texts.en:
Perseverance, initiative and the wish to develop to get ahead are just some of the main characteristics of the “Ebenezer” communal bank composed over six years ago of 7 members, most of them women.  This group has been working steadily developing constantly as well as each member individually.

An example of this is Nelly, 52.  She’s married and has four children one of which is still a minor.  He rises every morning very early to open her store that’s her source of income for her home.  It’s given her much satisfaction in the 8 long years it’s been in operation.  Nelly started this business because she needed to help her husband with household expenses.

She will use this latest loan to stock up on merchandise to sell in her store.  Like Nelly, each member has their own particular story with both good and bad moments throughout their lives.  But, if they have anything in common, it’s their desire to improve which they prove daily in their quest for their families’ and their businesses’ wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Mwakamusha

texts.en:
Mwakamusha is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya, and she sells charcoal and firewood, a business she started six months ago. She is a single mother of one school-going child. 

Mwakamusha is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase additional charcoal for sale. She has no other source of income and greatly depends on charcoal sales for her living. The challenges of this business include some customers not paying on time and the high cost of transport. This is especially difficult for a trader dealing with little stock and, thus, a reduced profit margin.

Mwakamusha aspires to build a house for her family in the near future and to supply charcoal to other dealers. She believes her association with Milango and its partners will help her achieve these goals.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.
